Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: People that have given this 9 or 10 Stars need their brains checking. Genuinely awful. Poor acting, dreadful storyline. I'm embarrassed to have sat and watched this sad excuse of a movie. Will Ferrell hasn't been in a decent film since Anchorman, and Rachel McAdams? No idea. Don't kid yourselves that this is a distraction during Lockdown. In fact, im off outside to catch the Corona Virus. I'm sure it'll be less painful than this movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This was fun to watch. I have to say Dan Stevens has to be the best actor of our generation.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I can't get over this movie! So many great scenes! I've watched it almost once a week since August. Absolutely my new favorite movie Rachel McAdams should win a Best Actress award for her role as Sigrit as well as for being adorable! No one else could have played this role. The music was superb and the editing was spot on!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
If you love Eurovision, watch it! If you don't love Eurovision, watch it and you may be "turned"! ;)
In the absence of Eurovision 2020 this is the perfect substitute i think! Not the thickest script but who cares, good music, humor and some good actors makes up for a nice evening in the spirit of Eurovision! :)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Americans won't get it. Even after this movie.
Review_body: As an European, I truly loved this film. The Eurovision cliches are spot-on. Musical parts were extremely entertaining. You can truly see Ferrell's passion for the contest in his acting. He did a great job of revealing the entertaining part of Eurovision without making fun of it. Fantastic and a must-watch for every Eurofan!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will is too old and too overweight for this part. He didn't fit it at all. Yeah, Will plays the typical fool he does in all his roles but with each and every roll it gets less and less funny. I thought the story line was ok and the whole movie would have been better with someone other then Will.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I don't get the 1 star reviews?! Aside from Brosnan sounding like the Swedish chef,it was brilliant! If you love Eurovision,watch it! Lots of cool cameos too...happy film,I take it some of the reviewers didn't get the humour?!
"The Elves went too far!!" 🤣
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Never thought I'd say this but...
Review_body:
Will Ferrell really impressed me with this one! I've never been a fan oh his, but this one.. the trailer doesn't really do it justice, this movie is AMAZING!!!
The funniest, sweetest movie I've seen in years.
The script is great (competition and love story aside, it's also got crime, fantasy, intrigue) the scenery is wonderful, the music is great throughout, the sing-along knocked me off my feet, Dan Stevens is fantastic and the ding dong guy is A LEGEND!
12 POINTS!!!
I already know I'm gonna love this movie forever. Thank you Mr. Ferrell and everyone involved!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Screw the critics, this movie is very funny
Review_body: I was initially planning to skip this movie after reading scathing reviews by the professional movie critics. After watching this movie it was clear that they were just as wrong as they were with "My Big Fat Greek Wedding" and all the other comedies they hated and the public loved. If you have ever seen a Eurovison Song Contest, you will love it. I recall watching on TV as ABBA won with Waterloo. This movie captures the songs and the spirit of the competition. I loved the parts about Iceland and their elves. Do yourself a favor and just watch and enjoy it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: JAJA DINK DONK!!!! AWESOME, BEST MOVIE THIS YEAR
Review_body: First i under estimated before watch, FROM BEGINNING THIS MOVIE VERY ENTERTAINMENT ME, THE MUSIC IS GREAT, IM ENJOY ALL JOKING, CINEMATOGRAPHY very good, Im totally enjoy all this movie. THIS MOVIE winning my heart
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: A couple of hours of entertainment in which you walk away with a smile.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This film is big on heart. It's long, too long, but if you make it to the end you'll be glad you did. The finale is worth the wait. It's no Anchorman, but the gags and the music make it a silly fun two hours.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: In scene is worth seeing the movie
Review_body: The scene where all the contestant sing together his worth seeing the entire movie ... especially if Eurovision was part of your youth...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I thought I'd hate it...I didn't!
Review_body: Sunday afternoon, glass of wine...what film? Found this on Netflix, expected to hate it, found myself laughing out loud then crying, and willing Iceland to win, it was a lovely film, really enjoyed it, not serious and a great afternoon watch. Got a bit of a crush on Lemtov...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Best movie in forever, no one should rate this EVER LESS THAN 8.
Review_body: I recommend this to all my friends, with tons of satisfied people. Usually I am more critical, but I love it, and how it makes me feel. I have watched this movie at least 20 times so far, and still find parts that make me smile or laugh in a 'serious world in a serious time'. A movie for everyone! Writing is fabulous, so many little funny parts..."camel toe never goes out of style". Watching it now again right now. Enjoy everyone!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: PG-13 Hollywood romcom that is neither romantic nor funny
Review_body: There are actually some interesting plot ideas and the cinematography is wonderful, but that's about the best I can say about this movie. The first major problem is that it's hard to take seriously two American actors pretending to be Icelandic and speaking with an Icelandic accent. Will Ferrell was just an awful choice for the role; he's too old, he doesn't have any natural musical talent (neither does Rachel) and he doesn't come off as a credible pretend-musician. On top of that, there isn't any chemistry between him and Rachel McAdams (think about what made A Star is Born so successful). It would have worked much better had they picked an Icelandic duo that are actually musicians, but then it wouldn't be a Will Ferrell movie.More importantly, the movie simply fails at delivering any laughs. There were literally only two scenes where I was genuinely amused, one involving the Ja Ja Ding Dong guy, and another where Will knocks down a portable toilet. It's somewhat hard to comprehend how an actor like Will can be so entertaining in some films (Anchorman, Old Scool, Step Brothers) and so unfunny in others, but I think it has much to do with his narrow comedic range. Will is usually at his funniest when he plays the wild and selfish manchild, which is nothing like his character in this film.To sum it up in one sentence, Eurovision Song Contest is a forgettable PG-13 Hollywood romcom that is neither romantic nor funny.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: We got the best movie about Eurovision Song Contest
Review_body: 2020 didn't bring us any Eurovision Song Contest but we got the best movie about the event that completed us this otherwise sad year. Eurovision always brings us joy as this movie did. Its a happy, crazy and wonderful movie with a touch of love that brings the story to a wonderful ending. Will Farell captured many of the feelings and oddities that we often associate Eurovision with. Big love to the crew who did a great job with this movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is just a fun movie. Loved the music! Feel good movie that was silly in a great way with a heartwarming ending.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I think it's a tad bit offensive, but who am I to say? Apparently, many people, including Icelanders thought it was funny so it does seem to a me thing. But I honestly think I'm over Will Ferrel and need to take a break from him for a while. But I guess that is just me.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Such a fun, entertaining movie. It's a cheeky homage created by people who obviously love the crazy spectacle that is the Eurovision Song Contest. Will and Rachel are hilarious and so is Dan Stevens as the Russian contestant. And, most importantly for a movie about a singing competition, the musical performances are fantastic.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Why do Americans feel the need to be in everything, comedy is weak and there are some aspects that don't coincide to the actual truth, don't waste your time and also i don't get it why this has so many things excellent reviews
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Will Ferrell it's time to call it a day. I couldn't get through 20 minutes. And Rachael my Adams was no help the could of picked a funny actress for a comedy. Terrible writing acting all
Of it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
From start to the Finnish or finish, I found this film to be pure Eurovision. Camp, cute and creative.
All the right ingredients with good v evil, will they won't they and an unexpected ending.
I've not laughed out loud watching a film like this for a very long time. I'll have to watch it again and again.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I'm not one to throw myself on a movie with Will Ferrell in it, but this one surprised me by how good it was. And there are some great one-liners. And the song at the end..... wow! You have to watch it to believe how moving it is.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It is exactly the movie you're imagining, but the music is better than you think it will be. It takes a sort of suspension of cynicism to appreciate the Eurovision Song Contest, and once you've done that, you'll find a number of catchy songs. The final number somehow manages to be poignant and wistful while still feeling exactly like a model Eurovision song.I'm positive I'll watch this movie many more times in the coming years, and all the while I'll be humming along.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Great songs, one very good scene....and that's about it
Review_body: I wasn't expecting a lot from this film, after all I have come used to the silly humour often Will Ferrell puts on his performances. However, I have to admit this film let me down quite a bit, not only because most of the jokes didn't land or because is too long, but for the simple fact that the story, style and structure is all over the place, seriously is like having in a film instead of 3 acts have 6, that is not unusual whatsoever, the problem is that 3 of these 6 acts felt like a tiring third act that left no impact. On top of that the two leads Lars and Sigrit, I understand they want them to make them funny in a bit bizarre way and thanks to the Ferrell and McAdams experience it feels they try way too hard, but I am afraid they come up way too unlikable. I don't hate this film, in fact I would rather watch this that let's say "The Greatest Showman" as the songs and the Eurovision part of the film are quite well done, I could find myself listen to them on spotify, but this review is for the film and not the songs. So I would give this one a pass.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A couple of hours of pure, silly escapism
Review_body:
Is this movie cheesy? With some plot holes? Yes and yes.
Did it offer me and my family a couple of wonderfully silly hours with laughs, cringes and the sort of songs that only Eurovision can offer? Yes, yes and yes!
Will Ferrell (whom I'm not normally a fan of) was great as the Eurovision-obsessed Lars, Rachel McAdam was sweet as the talented but naive Sigrit, and Dan Stevens was a revelation as Alex, the '100% not gay' Russian. I know neither Rachel nor Dan sang their own songs, but it was pretty good lip-synching!
With minimal bad language, no violence (apart from the hamster wheel and the baddy getting knifed by the elves) and no nudity (though there were a few slightly risqué references to Will Farrell's 'ding dong'), this was a film we could enjoy as a family and came away joyfully singing 'Ja Ja Ding Dong' (which my daughter (unsuccessfully) tried to put on my phone as a ringtone).
Ignore the critics. If you approach this in the same way as you would Eurovision itself, you'll have a blast.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I am writing this as someone who runs hot and cold on Will Ferrell - sometimes I love his work and other stuff falls a bit flat for me. But I actually watched this movie TWICE because I thought it was cute. I liked the sweet relationship between Lars (Will Ferrell) and Sigrit (Rachel McAdams), I enjoyed that Alexander Lemtov (Dan Stevens) and Mita Xenakis (Melissanthi Mahut) had just enough complexity to them to make them interesting and sympathetic characters, and enjoyed the timeliness and unexpectedness of some plot twists. Pierce Brosnan and Mikael Persbrandt are always great, and the supporting cast also made the movie fun. A great movie to watch when you don't want to think too deeply and just want something to make you forget your troubles for a while...Ja Ja, Ding Dong!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: In typical Will Farrell fashion he plays the immature obtuse buffoon that somehow comes through despite himself. Rachel McAdams did a great job and carried the film's straight man (woman) role. The supporting cast was good as well.As someone who had never seen Eurovision, any little inaccuracies or creative license didn't matter - in some ways it's meant to be irreverent - though one BBC music reporter found dissecting it's inaccuracies worthwhile so if you are a stickler for accuracy and details you might cringe a bit. It's a goofy movie - loaded with little gags - perhaps not quite to the level of Elf - but anyone who usually enjoys a Will Farrell movie, will like it.The tempo of the production kept things moving along so it didn't feel like a 2 hour film. The music was goofy where it needed to be and half decent elsewhere. We've probably seen this all before in general but the familiarity is part of the appeal.As pure fun entertainment and no thinking, it's better than average but not an instant classic. Worth watching though - check it out!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: To me this would make a lot more sense if...
Review_body: ...Will Farrell's character was played by a 25 year old. I'm supposed to believe that that jerky father let his son live with him for 30+ years as an adult and is just getting around to kicking him out now??? And I'm supposed to believe that that pretty woman was trying to hump him for 30-40+ years after he became sexually mature and he just decided to remain a virgin all that time?!?! I'm straight and in love with this sexy teenager who's head over heels for me but maybe she'll be hotter in her 50's. Preposterous. Now if Will was supposed to be playing somebody much younger then maybe they could have slighted that to the audience somehow... because DUDE, your face looks old. Old and saggy and super wrinkly. All around a pretty good movie with some pretty decent songs. Not really all that rewatchable though.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Firstly, I hate Eurovision. The music is (generally) terribly and the voting is as fixed as a Russian General Election.That being said, this film was really good fun. The storyline took some time to kick in and the elves, well, let's just say there were some elves.I give this a solid 7/10 but don't think I would watch it again.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie was quite good, but perhaps surprisingly the only thing holding it back is Will Ferrell. He simply looked too old for the role in my and my gf's opinion, and we are only about a decade younger than mr Ferrell. The same difference he has with the character that played his dad. It looked a little silly. We both liked almost everything else about it. It was a comedy musical, well done, with likable characters. A feelgood movie mostly.The only thing we were expecting but didn't get, was raunchy homosexual jokes. We are talking about Will Ferrell in Eurovision after all. That was the second surprise: that a movie about the gay campfest that is Eurovision, that stars Will Ferrell, was kept almost completely above the board. This movie is imo completely safe to watch with children. And a pretty fun watch. You will not regret watching this.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie made me laugh and smile. It's a sweet and innocent comedy which we don't have enough of any more. Rachel McAdam shines as Sigrite, she should do more comedies. This was so refreshing to watch a fun wholesome movie which doesn't resort to cheap mean and raunchy humour. It takes class. Well done Will Ferrell.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Musical, magical, funny and romantic!! What a simply brilliant film!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Don't judge it by the cover, because it's really damn funny
Review_body: I gotta admit, I was reluctant to watch the movie when it popped out in my Netflix, but man, I didn't expect to laugh so much. It's funny, it's heartwarming, and it's quite insane, but I loved it. Don't expect a masterpiece, but trust me, Will Ferrell is in his element, and the songs are actually pretty good. Just do yourself a favor and watch it, you won't regret it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Suprisingly good and funny movie to pass your pandemic evening. I needed something like this, made me to realize how beautiful Iceland must be for vacation, we also have islands here in Greece and I imagine how life would be in a small secluded country like Iceland, if it wasn't the cold I would be there for vacation sooner. Ya ya, ding dong!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Wow. This movie was amazing from start to finish. It was funny and heartwarming all at once.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I watched because it has Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams. I don't know why I'm surprised when Rachel is funny. She's so natural at it. I liked the flip between funny and dramatic. Rachel is fantastic at it. Will Ferrell is his usual absurd hilarious hooligan self. Really, it's just a delight to watch these two play off of each other. It's an enjoyable ride.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
The movie is not funny nor serious. Its not like other Will Ferrel movies that linger between ridiculus and funny. On the other hand they try to make moving scenes or serious scenes which actually makes no sense at all.
Also the plot is simple and too predictable and uninteresting to watch.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Not funny, but the music was good
Review_body: Will Ferrell is pretty hit or miss in comedies and this was right in between. The jokes are pretty weak, but the songs alone made this watchable. Being not familiar with Eurovision, it was very interesting to learn about it as I watched. While there are some laughs for sure, the accents throughout are impossible to ignore. Both Will and Rachel would jump from Icelandic, to German, to Swedish, to sometimes just plain American accent. I enjoyed the story, but the corrupt city official subplot trying to randomly kill Will Ferrell in the end was completely unnecessary and added nothing. Which was followed up by a ghost warning him about the official, only for Will to say "oh we are good, I already killed him". As far as the music every song is catchy, and I've already got JaJa Ding Dong stuck in my families heads by playing it ad nauseam. I would definitely recommend this, it's a fun time all things considered.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: What a fabulous movie. It had me grinning from ear to ear and pulling out the Kleenex box. It touched my heart in many ways! Well done!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Thought it would be bad but....
Review_body: I thought it would be a terrible movie but i actually enjoyed it! It was a bit strange now and then but it was fun. Loved it that they used a few original eurovision candidates. And the ja ja ding dong song is stuck in my head now...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
This movie was great. Love the music.
Play yaya ding dong!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I love Will Farrell, but this movie was a huge bag of d**ks.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: You've gotta know what Eurovision is probably but this movie made me smile!! Great release timing this year we don't have it! Classic Ferrel!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Simply entertaining. Good music, nice acting. The story is quite predictable, but enjoyable. Many of the reviewers that gave 1-2 stars did not understand that they are not watching a Lars Von Trier's film but a comedy without Oscar-winning ambitions... and probably never saw ESC either. Worth watching.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: For anyone who likes movies with songs and just a good old film. I have never seen Eurovision really and still won't but I think this movie has completed for me . Great due with Rachel & Will and all the obvious :)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: How this is getting good ratings is beyond me, I don't think I laughed once. It could have been something really good but the writing is terrible and there aren't any jokes. The only redeeming aspect is all the musical performances. Save yourself 2 hours and watch anchorman again.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I wasn't convinced by the trailer, but I had trusted friends who convinced me to give it a shot and I'm so glad I did. This movie is silly, quirky, and over the top...but in a good way. It's surprisingly heartfelt and cute even with the silliness and the music is wonderful. I seriously cannot wait to watch it again.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Amazing, funny ,heat warming. Not only greatness of Will Ferrell shines through but with Rachel McAdams too both absolutely perfect. Some fantastic cameos too.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The best of Will and all the others
Review_body:
This film is an absolute hommage to the real thing, the Eurovision song contest, which we sadly had to miss. It is funny througout, with some new classics (obviously jaja ding dong being one of them). I have seen it 3 times now and I can not wait to see it again.
Will and Rachel are hilarious and somehow believable speaking pigeon English with 'icelandic' accents. The songs vary from bad, but that's also Eurovision, to amazing, Husavik is just a really good song... And some great local actors. Must mention Graham Norton and some of the real life song contest winners making cameos. And Dan Stevens playing a lovable villain (or does he?)
Go see it!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I like Will Ferrell and Rachael McAdams, so I naturally started watching when this popped up on my Netflix feed. And I was NOT disappointed. I watched the actual Eurovision once, the contest was cheesy, corny, lots of flashy stage background and backup dancing. And this movie was so true to that. With Iceland being the country where the singers are from, we got to see the beautiful Iceland as a bonus. It's a crazy comedy but not ridiculous. I laughed out loud a few times, which hasn't happened for a while for comedies. All in all, a great fun 2 hours, enjoyed it thoroughly.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Disappointing, really. Should have been much funnier, but wasn't. Sad.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I avoided this movie because it looked corny, way better than the trailer showed. Rachel mCadams reallly balances this movie out and at time it feels like a serious movie and not a comedy.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The only reason I watched this is because Dan Stevens was in it. I had low expectations as the Eurovision Song Contest is not something I enjoy. I really enjoyed it, it was lighthearted and, in times where the news channels are full of reports of hate and disease, a good escape into the fantasies of the Icelandic couple who - despite being naive no-hopers - aspired to win the contest. Dan Stevens did not disappoint as the 'eye candy' and Graham Norton lived up to his reputation as the acerbic commentator.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: No comedy, only PR for eurovision
Review_body:
There is almost no comedy in this movie. The joke rate is almost 1 joke per 30 minutes. Most of the time they just talk funny as a comedy.
This is clearly a PR movie for eurovision.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I did not even chuckle once
Review_body: I have moderately enjoyed Will Ferrell's movies in the past but this was mind blowing boring, silly and unfunny. And I say that when a good friend was a highly featured extra.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: LOVE! Fun, lighthearted, and comes with some catchy songs!
Review_body: The title says it all. Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams are perfect together! I'm an American and yet this movie left me feeling some serious Icelandic pride.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Very entertaining and deals with all modern cliches
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I usually enjoy Will Ferrell's movies, but this movie didn't take one little smile from me.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Really enjoyed the movie, so funny and definitely not predictable at all, thought it was going to be, but I was wrong.
I will be watching again at some point.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Ignore the mainstream critics who poo-poo this film, it's great fun.I'm not a massive Will Ferrell fan but it's clear he has a soft spot for Eurovision and the warmth of the annual event comes through with great performances and (maybe contrary to the real event) great songs.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Not what you'd expect from Ferrell
Review_body: If you're looking for a slapstick raunchy movie you'll be disappointed. There are plenty of comedic moments but this is more of an uplifting, heartwarming film. Corny to a degree, but appropriate for the protagonists as they are portrayed.The two main characters spend their lives working towards an outrageously unachievable goal. I appreciate their persistence, even if they are portrayed as a bit dim witted. The idea that following your passions will lead to happiness is a fine moral.More importantly, you need to realize the movie is more or less a musical. If you don't enjoy musicals you may be disappointed.The idea of Eurovision is to be a friendly, peace loving event between European nations. The way the competitors are able to be positive to each other is encouraging.I feel as if I've seen so many dark dramas these days. It's nice to watch a movie that's just trying to have some fun and feel good.You can't help but find yourself cheering on the protagonists. The final scenes leaves my heart aching. Realizing true happiness is found in those around you, it's a lesson hard learned by too many.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I absolutely LOVED!! This film. It had me in fits of laughter from the simple one liners to tears in a matter of minutes, this film really tugs on those heart strings while delivering the element of comedy and musicals, your crazy if you don't like this film.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: No redeeming qualities at all. Not funny, poor script, ropey acting. Avoid.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: American actors make a movie about a European phenomenon... Just doesn't work for me.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: A really lovely film that I can honestly say I enjoyed, which is rare in a film.. I felt happy watching it! The songs were amazing and the woman singer dubbing the lead was utterly amazing.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Great return to form for Will Ferrell.
Charming and funny throughout.
Great schtick from all actors.
Captures craziness of Eurovision without hamming it up which was surprising.
Obviously made with love.
I really cheered for Fire Saga and now believe in elves!
Fun kids will love and humour they won't get.
Dan Stevens is a standout as Russian Lion lol
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's really good. My wife cried several times and I actually loved it. He's made so many turkeys taht this was what I expected. Nikolai Baskov will be rolling in his non grave at this one. Especially the Lion of Love and the question "are you gay" which was answered with "there are no gay Russians". Most excellent!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Finally a great movie from Will Ferrell with Rachel McAdams in it. It gave a slight nostalgia from Blades of Glory. The songs performed were also amazing.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Yes yes yes! Don't listen to haters!
Review_body:
If you like Eurovision, your heart will be filled with laughter and happiness. This was so much fun! The music was catchy and fun. I highly highly recommend this film. It was just easy fun humor and it made me laugh alot.
Even cried at one point. Awesome! It felt good to return to the Eurovision world and at this point in time, that is better than anything I could imagine. So watch it, I don't understand why this isn't higher rated, because it truly is just a bundle of laughs. So watch it. I'll be watching it again soon.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Gets better every time I watch it!!
Review_body: So good! I refuse to watch normal Eurovision but I was keen to see this. I notice something new each time I watch it - up into double digits.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Dan Stevens as Russian Lemtov was perfect! In total this movie is so much fun! Music is done professionally, Eurovision style captured in full!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: OMG!!! What a great feel good movie.. The music is amazing!! Rachel McAdams doesn't disappoint.. By far my fav character.. The final song is worth watching the entire movie for!!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I think that the songwriters did a splendid job (good songs with the right amount of parody). I wish the movie was a bit funnier and logical. Some scenes were dying for a wittier joke (for Will Ferrell and Graham Norton, at least). It looks like some scenes were quite obviously inserted (for a reason) but not blended into the story well, characters's actions are not explained or they have a rather flat explanation. I really loved Rachel's acting. I think some foreshadowing was unnecessary (e.g. Rachel's scarf). The roles of Greek and Russian characters, I felt, needed to be less superficial (especially Dan Stevens's - I liked his acting). All in all, a fun movie, especially for those who missed Eurovision this year.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I love this movie! It makes me cry and it makes me laugh! The music is beautiful and the acting is perfect! I listen to the soundtrack for this movie on repeat!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will Ferrell has a type of humor that is definitely not for everyone. But if you like his humor, you will surely like this one, in my opinion one of his better works. Nevertheless, even if you don't like his humor, you might not have a few good laugh-out-loud moments, like I had, but it still probably is a pretty entertaining, sillly movie, worth the watch. Oh and wow, Rachel McAdams... What a damn voice, I did not know. My compliments!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Might be one of the weirdest movies I've watched but it was entertainingAs a Swede it was fun how many swedes were involved
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: 40% of this movie is music. 95% of the music is garbage. 60% of the movie is okay.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Not normally a Will Ferrell fan...
Review_body: This was a pretty good movie though. Good acting all around, a little bit of the normal Will Ferrell nonsense, but I really enjoyed it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Honestly, before i watched this i thought this was gonna be horrible - with bad screenplay and songs. It turns out to exceed my expectations. Screenplay is pretty good - Rachel Mcadams definitely plays a big part of it. Songs are mostly fine. "Husavik" is more than fine. It gives me goosebumps. I didn't expect such a wonderful song to be on something other than Disney musicals. The writing is kinda cheesy, same old thing with every encouraging autobiographical movie. But it's funny, so that evens out.All in all, not the best movie, but worth watching when you need some cheer-ups during the pandemic.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If you like Will Ferrell, you'll love this. It's really a fun feel good movie. Chill out and enjoy it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A nice movie with a wonderful ending
Review_body: Not every movie needs to be an Oscar winning epic. Sometimes during these dark times it enough to watch something funny and heartwarming.And that song at the end...wow
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Almost every aspect is awkward. Acting production quality audio mixing writing. Some laughs but not really worth the time investment.
The real star is the beauty of the island landscape.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Until this movie I had never heard of Eurovision. It was a fun movie and the music was catchy.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Great cast and superb plot development, enjoyed whole heartedly 😊
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: At first I thought this movie was a little bit too silly for my own taste, but giving it a go as I have personal history with Eurovision and I love the contest itself, I decided to move forward and man, I don't regret a second of it. It was funny, but at the same time the movie sent a deeper message on love, family bonds and courage. Over all it was a good movie, and for those that like Eurovision, it's going to be very fascinating!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A Mighty Wind + A Star is Born
Review_body: Super silly, super sweet.Made me me misty.Damn, Pierce Brosnan is a really good looking guy. I am not gay or bi, but it was kind of distracting how good looking he is.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: One of the few Will Ferrell movies with heart, think Stranger Than Fiction. Rachel McAdams was fantastic and the chemistry between the two characters were surprisingly great in the music was a lot of fun. Find myself laughing more than I thought I would
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This film is amazing. It captures the feeling of Eurovision beautifully. The acting and dialogues are spot-on, and Sigrid and Lars are portrayed really believably. Laughs and tears all around!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie is very cool and the characters are very deep in the role, I like all the songs, amazing.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will Ferrell can stop here knowing that no movie after this will ever compare.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As a die-hard Eurovision fan, I am glad that this didn't mock the contest as much as people speculated. It's good, but there are quite a few plot holes (eg when Lemtov says that no one likes UK, how did they win the previous year to host it this year)? It's funny at times, but some of them feel a bit out of place. However, Ferrell and McAdams make a very nice duo. The soundtrack is AMAZING as well.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Enjoyed it from start to finish, it was funny, entertaining and has a truly unique soundtrack with songs that stick with you.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Good : Will Ferrell Does It Again
Review_body: Hilarious . Lacks the quality script for a love story , but absolutely funny as hell. Don't want to give spoilers, but for a comedy you'll lose it laughing. Great movie If your in for simple yet smart humor.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A joyous, glitzy romp. Just the antidote for 2020
Review_body: This is such a guilty pleasure. Why and how does it work this well? The heart of it is so strong, I think. There is so much truthfulness in Ferrell's persistent dreamer who will go forward, no matter how much he is laughed at. McAdams is delightful and matches him perfectly. They are both such a pair of innocents and have you rooting for them right from the start. Dan Stevens is insanely good. Off the charts! I also loved Melissanthi Mahut (Mita) and thought she oozed charisma, matching Stevens pound for pound.The whole movie is a joyous, glitzy romp, just the antidote for 2020. I thought the music was cracking too and there's one particular song, beautifully presented by the gorgeous McAdams, that gave me genuine goose bumps.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The only thing pulling it down a teeny tiny bit is the Will Ferrel sock in the jumpsuit kinda stuff.. Everything else is marvellous. I love Sigrit, Rachel did a great job. Love the elves thing, and oh my god, you get hit right in the feels, and everyone just sits there watching, feeling proud for Iceland. It is really great, and its on my top 3 of go to feel good movies.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Never knew that Farrell could write a movie but hell did he deliver; great music, good humor and fantastic guest stars in the music performance
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Absolutely love everything about this movie. It's hilarious, the acting is amazing, the music is so upbeat and the story is so heartwarming.Yeah, the accent and accuracy of the culture isn't accurate but it's not meant to be. It's meant to be satirical and it totally accomplishes that!Also, Jaja Ding Dong LOL!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Just the distraction I needed during a pandemic
Review_body: I had my doubts about this movie, but decided to watch it based on the cast. So glad I did. It made me smile, tap my foot and just escape a little to a happy place during a terrible time in the world.Is it the most deftly acted, written and produced movie...no, no Oscar nominations, I'm pretty sure. But that's not the point.What it does offer to the audience is a bit of fun and escapism, and a bunch of good laughs and cringe-worthy moments. It also left me a little lighter in spirit, and It reminded me to take the world less seriously. This was just what I needed during a pandemic, rampant racism, a horrible government and climate change out of control. There's so much that is wrong, that a little right is helpful. While I can't control the crazy world, I can control what I watch and how it impacts me. I choose to enjoy it for what it is and smile.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I actually enjoyed it, its a soft warm bath of easy but comfortable humor. Love the balance between making fun of Europe and still making it somehow work ( as a Dutch guy ) I enjoyed this one.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: My expectations were low, I love Will Ferrel but his movies are often shallow and stupid and rarely touches you. This one is not deep and smart, that is not what I'm saying! But it is well made and has a lot of heart in it that balances the shallow and stupid quite good. Add on top of that the end performance by Rachel McAdams, the sweetest actress in all of Hollywood, and you suddenly find yourself cheering for a fictional Icelandic band in a fictional Eurovision contest in this feel good movie of crazy corona summer of 2020. Well done! Well done indeed!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A must see for any music fan with a sense of humour.
Review_body:
I am not a Will Ferrell fan. Yet I feel it was one of his best and I enjoyed it from start to finish. As a music fan and a huge musical comedy fan it ticked all the boxes.
I dont understand the low ratings with all these hugely impressed reviews. I agree with all. It captures the essence of Eurovision, showcases Iceland well and has laughs and love and funny songs to boot. A must see!! All actors did a fantastic job.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Not bad. At least i enjoyed it.
Review_body: Hollywood should learn from Netflix. That is how you make a repeatable watch movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Great ode to Eurovision and Scandinavia.
Review_body:
I was a bit scared at first. I believe many of us have an understanding of Ferrel's movies and how they are usually broken into two groups: the ones that are 'hit and miss' (The House, Semi-pro, The ladies man, Get hard etc.) and the ones that are hits (The Other Guys, Stepbrothers, Talladega Nights etc). For some this is a blurry line, for some this is the same type of movies, and for others (like me) each mean something very different and often something special too. So I was eager to see what category this movie falls into.Disclaimer:
It is important to point out that those that have been following Eurovision for years, often entire lifetimes, will see and identify with things that those who have never heard of let alone seen Eurovision will have trouble with understanding.
Also, I am Danish, and as many of my Scandinavian neighbors might agree with me, we have our own special connection with Eurovision. What is more, as the two main characters are Icelandic, it is naturally very easy for Scandinavians to identify with these characters and the cultures they portray.Review:
I was eager to see what type of Ferrel movie this is but other than that I had zero expectations going in. It was laugh out loud funny. It was a silly movie, just like any other Ferrel movie would be. However, it was, great ode to Scandinavians not taking themselves too serious, the Eurovision song contest, to the singer's choreography, songs, theme of songs, subject matter all clicked with how the actual Eurovision would go down. Believable participants and solid story that somehow neatly fits with what Eurovision is all about. Well worth a watch to any that has had Eurovision in their lives at one point or another.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Absolutely an amazing flick a must watch
Review_body:
After watching this movie it made my day ... Beautiful movie a must watch
For will farrels acting hilarious and sentimental !!
A 10 on 10 for this.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: After watching this film with my wife, I thought this was just a made up premise, no way it's real. Well, I read other reviews and then asked my neighbor from the UK, he confirmed with me that Eurovision is a real thing. It's like watching a super karokee contest, it's cheesey as heck but so entertaining.Rachel McAdams steals the show, she is so adorable and sweet throughout the movie, it's hard not to route for her. The movie is super funny and perfect for the Covid-19 world we currently live in, hopefully the major networks pick up the Eurovision broadcasts in the future so North America can join the fun.This movie will make Eurovision a global phenomenon that it deserves, many thanks to Will Ferrell.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Rachel McAdams must be exhausted, because she carried this whole movie!! If the movie would've focused more on her character and less and the regurgitated and unnecessary juvenile jokes of Will Ferrell this movie could have really been something of a gem. Unfortunately, that didn't happen, however it succeeded in making me want to watch the real Eurovision and travel to Iceland and Scotland. So I guess that's a plus.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I don't know where to begin. This film is incredibly bad. I wanted to like it, but after 10 minutes I had to switch off.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: It's a parody but it's also true
Review_body:
It's a parody but it's also true
great songs
Lots of real Eurovision artist
Thanks to all creators of this movie especial that there will be no Eurovision this year
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A ray of sunshine in the dismal year 2020
Review_body: This movie, although very silly is a ray of sunshine in this epically bad year of 2020. I haven't loved Will Ferrell this much since Elf. ( I like him but this was more youth friendly than most his movies) Rachel McAdams is always good and makes anyone smile. Pierce Brosnan still has it!! The cast was fun and if you need to laugh like we did ... this is the movie to do just that!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Rachel McAdams is brilliant in this - as she was in Aloha. Will Ferrell's humour can be challenging but in this is fabulous. My most watched movie in recent years. Still really makes me laugh after 5th viewing.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Better than i thought, could have been awesome
Review_body: As a fan of eurovision I was looking forward to this. The movie hits so many good notes and lacks in comedy with others. Problem i have is Will's character is not likeable and unbelievable a bit of an issue for a Will Ferrell movie. A different cast member for his part would be a good start. The comedy at times is on point and at others feels out of place adding nothing to the story (don't even ask about the cgi whales). Remove the spoof elements of comedy and this could have been a great movie.Worth a watch for the supporting cast and the mid movie music number filled will eurovision performers cameos.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: It has been some time since a movie made me laugh
Review_body:
It is a really big piece of comedy movie.
It genuinely made me laugh and have goose bumps throughout the movie. Oh!!! Just brilliant.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's perfect if you have nothing else to watch. In Greece we have a saying amerikaniá which basically means classic american movie and it perfectly describes this movie. The story doesn't make sense most of the time and is always super predictable, many of the jokes don't land, the actors are super awkward trying to speak English in an Icelandic accent and even the competition of the Eurovision is portrayed wrong in the movie ( for example the points are given in thr final not in the semis ) which makes the movie hard to watch even for the fans of the competition. Some of the past winners also make an appearance in the movie but it just so happens to be at the most awkward scene ever. Anyway, it's on netflix so it might make sense to watch it with the family if you have absolutely nothing else to watch. I've seen worse movies than this but you'll definitely forget all about it about 10 minutes after its over
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: What else can I ask for? Lots of loud laughs, funny, crazy, sweet moments, some singing and elves (which you never see but they are there)! And although I am not a fan of the real Eurovision I loved this! Will Ferell rocks!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Superfun, cheesy and i am entertained!
Review_body: It is just fun! I don't understand the low rating. It has great stage building. The songs are typical eurovision and guiltily enjoyable. Will Ferrel of course is watchable even embroidered in carpet. Bit besides that, it was truly a great comedy. I think one of the best i've seen in the last years, it even pulled my heart strings a bit there. Well done! Don't be so critical, just enjoy it in it's cheery glory.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Will Farrell is a powerhouse of absurdity coupled with a wonderfully whistfully witty performance from Rachel McAdams, finally landing a comic performance after a failed forced performance in 'Game Night'
The fact Ireland did not get the slightest nod considering they have won it more times than any country with 7 wins, are the only country to win 3 in a row, won 4 out of 5 in a run, and the only country to have a contestant win it twice... is the only drawback
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Adorable movie with a great soundtrack
Review_body: If you didn't like this movie, you probably don't have a heart. Was it the best movie of all time? No. Best Musical. No. Best Comedy. Nope. What did it have? HEART. It had heart and charisma and good music. For those of you dissing Will Ferrell, it's Will Ferrell.... what did you expect from his acting? He did co-write the movie though. And he did a great job capturing the contest, a love story, family conflict, and a true underdog story people actually care about. I thought it was delightful. The music was catchy. The last song was AMAZING. Rachel McAdams was on point. It's definitely the best movie I have seen in 2020. So let's give credit where it is due. Surprisingly great movie. 4 thumbs up (2 of those are elf thumbs). Just give it a chance and leave your expectations at the door.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will FerrelL....... Rachel Mc Adams .... THANK YOU!!!THIS MOVIE IS A REAL MIRACLE OF POSITIVE VIBRATIONS ON ANY LEVEL POSSIBLE !!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
This a small, charming movie. It looks like it was made with love for the Eurovision and really embraces the spirit of the event.
Much like the Eurovision, if you don't take to seriously and embrace it for what it is, you'll enjoy it.
Plus honestly, the songs are nice, kind of versions of the better ones you can find in the contest.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Refreshing, corny yet so true to the real thing!
Review_body:
Having lived through years of Eurovision I wasn't sure I could stand a movie about it. I loved it.
Haven't had a good easy laugh like this in a long time. Just put up you feet and enjoy.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Really not what I expected, but was pleasantly surprised. The songs were great, they really set the mood. There are many funny, cringy, lovely and sad scenes. It is a roller coaster. They should host the next eurovision in characters, I would watch it 100%.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The movie is alright. It has some really nice moments. Will Ferrel is always funny and Dan Steven brings alot to this movie that jokes about this somewhat strange European phenomenon that is Eurovision and some fun political punches to countries and people who doesn't accept that people are of different beliefs, sexualities, origins and more.Now its not amazing but hey its worth the watch. And they even use the cheap trick of music where a powerful song can wrap up most anything and whatever happened before it still feels quite alright afterwards. Cause the song Husavik is a really powerful ballad that could to be honest. maybe it should win the Eurovision.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is a typical Will Farrell film I guess; silly, funny, not so funny at times but thoroughly enjoyable and entertaining. It also captured the contest perfectly for me; I can't believe no one has done something like this before.I'm humming the Jaja Ding Dong song as I type; it is one of the stupid Eurovision type songs that gets in your head and won't go. But the song Sigrit sang in the actual competition is brilliant. Apart from being a funny film I actually found it quite moving and had a headache at the end from trying to control my emotions and not get laughed at by my wife for crying at a comedy film.It is a classic loser underdog who comes good in the end film. And a love story. And a comedy film. And a great observational film on the Eurovision; it captures the quirkiness of the competition brilliantly. I can also see why Icelandic folks would love it; I would if I was from Iceland. Made me want to go visit. And I will again be supporting them when they are next in the World Cup competition. I love an underdog who achieves great things.Bottom line is that I loved it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I am not a fan of the Eurovision contest per se and was pushed play by accident! As Bob Ross would say, it was a "Happy Accident" :-) It is SUCH a cool little movie!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Way better than i thought it would be
Review_body: I like Will Ferrell. He gives it his all in every performance whether a good script or bad. This movie surprised me. Started a little slow but i loved all the characters and the the last hour and a half was terrific.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Funny and unpredictable. Really enjoyed watching it. Finally someone made a movie of Eurovision and made fun of it in a really funny way. Respect to the film makers and all the actors - you did good job! Thank You!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The ultimate homage to the Eurivision
Review_body: I feel compelled to share how much I just loved this film. It felt like all the warm embraces form my childhood merged into one. Never have I felt so much pride for the wonderful and whacky traditions we have as Europeans. This was simply a feel good homage to the Eurovision. Too many people have tried to over intellectualise they're opinions on this film. The Eurovision is kitsch And lighthearted just like this film. I simply loved it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Much needed break from the world!!
Review_body: Loved this movie! We laughed and I may have teared up a little. So worth it. Its silly and its loveable and hilarious. The actors were all very good and the music was good I need all these songs on my phone!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I don't know whats wrong with the Script writers the actors were too much horrible this has not made me laugh the guy acted well in Get hard with Kelvin hart and not in this dump comedy movie
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie was absolutely awful. Not sure how or why this movie is rated above a 3. I had to fast forward through most of the movie. It sucked!!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was expecting the worst. But actually i enojoyed it. Loved the elves and Rachel Mcadams and Dan Stevens were fantastic. This comedy really gives you a feel good time. The songs were entertaining too.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Come on people, stop rating this like it should be some masterpiece. This delivered exactly what Eurovision fans wanted in this movie. Eurovision is corny, sometimes cringy and honestly an overproduced freak-show. But we love that. This is exactly what we need with the pandemic and cancelled song contests this year.I was afraid this movie would cater too much to an American audience but nope, they made this for Eurovision fans and it shows. For those unfamiliar with Eurovision: you should watch this, it has exactly the right vibes.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Not always a massive fan of will ferrell as his characters are a bit too zany but liked his character in this. There are plenty of small funny moments and the story is a good one. And I'm not one for loads of songs in movies but I really enjoyed them in this. I am very surprised at the fairly low score this has achieved. I would heartily recommend it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Not what I expected ...... but better!
And I officially love Iceland!....and
"little people"..shhhh =))
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If you are grown up with Eurovision song Contest , then sure You will ilke this mobile. Some parts Of the scenario is a bit silly but generally the Movie shows what Eurovision is. I remembered The time Turkey won this contest in 2003 and how happy we were 😀 I know it is stupid. But we were happy anyway 😀😀😀
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: So I am a fan of Will Ferrell and his silly humor. Whether it be like Anchorman or Step Brothers. I fully expected this movie to be similar.I was surprisingly incorrect!Don't get me wrong, there were quite a few silly parts throughout the movie. But overall this was a fun, enjoyable, and touching movie. The best way to categorize/describe this movie is an amalgam of Talledaga Nights/Wedding Crashers/Pitch Perfect. I watched it on a whim and I am glad I did!Being an American I knew nothing of the Eurovision Song Contest, but I still enjoyed learning a bit about it. The music, while a bit silly in its portrayal, was actually extremely good! The ending song was touching and brought out the tears. There were many laughs, a few cringeworthy moments, and some really moving scenes.Will Ferrell was very good, not great though. But Rachel McAdams and Dan Stevens were fantastic! McAdams was extremely funny and did very well lip syncing all the songs while Molly Sanden (who actually did the singing for Sigrit) was amazing! She has an incredible voice and she definitely deserves any attention gained from this movie! Pierce Brosnan was ok, and seemed a bit out of place. But overall I expected something that was silly and full of Will Ferrell's low brow humor (which I do love). But what I got was so much better and a movie that was extremely uplifting, which was even better during the dark days of the COVID-19 lockdown and the dumpster fire that is 2020.Definitely worth a watch, and I personally have now watched it for a fifth time. It was that good. 8/10 because of how touching and funny it was. Also the songs are addicting and added to the experience! -2 for the few outlandish parts and for a somewhat roaming plot.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I go into movies open minded and if the first few minutes doesn't capture my attention then, I can't stay focused. I thought this movie had my attention and was well written for a comedy. If you like Will Ferrell's sense of humor you'll enjoy this movie. Lastly, I thought Rachel McAdams did a really great job and continues to show her versatility in her craft! Will someone give her an Oscar already!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie falls in the category of not so funny stupid movies with weird characters. I tried to love it. Story line is good and it could have been funnier and much better if it were more serious without the usual Hollywood additions in movies ( a satanic band playing in eurovision, give be break! What's next? NAMBLA band?)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Offers much more than what is expected...it's not going to win any awards, but it's a fun movie that's more than worth the time it takes to watch. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a feel-good movie starring a couple of extremely talented actors.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Perfect for a fun movie night
Review_body: This movie is not perfect. But it is fun, warm, and it has a lot of catchy songs, especially Ja-Ja Ding-Dong! I loved it! 12 points to Will Ferrell.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Next best thing in a year without the joy that is Eurovision
Review_body: I love the Eurovision, and this was a lovely tribute to this beloved song contest, which really gets the spirit of this competition, while still being crazy enough to laugh out loud quite often.Sure, this was a cheesy and campy movie, but that's what Eurovision is. I loved almost every minute of it. Even the seemingly forced cameos by previous winners. I wasn't surprised to see that the American reviewers hate this movie, while most Europeans enjoyed it. Americans have much to learn.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Very simple but yet very quality movie
Review_body: If you want to watch something good but not complicated after the difficult day - that is the movie you are looking for.The scenario is simple where all the main moves could be easily predicted but the actors is playing very good and you just want to feel that simple story with them and share the happiness in the end. The operator work is also very good, through the whole movie there are marvellous scenes . And, the last but not least - the songs. They are really beautiful.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: When you expect crap, but get surprisingly addicted!
Review_body: I signed in it IMDB just to leave good rating for this movie, because the critics try to destroy it!! This movie is so silly, sweet, heartwarming, cheesy, and feel good, that most peeps I know watch it regularly several times! It really came on time to lift our spirits in pandemic. The acting is worth an award, the songs are addictive and touching. I think this movie will become cult in time, and many phrases and memes are already circling around! Good job!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
So bad its fantastic! When its all over there will be a big smile on you face.camp as!
Fantastic cast
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I love Eurovision and this was just Super fun movie with great music and great moments. I did not expect much, but it was actually so great. Caught the Eurovision spirit In a fantastic way! If you dont like that style Or know the cultyrw, you might not like the movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: A movie that makes you smile.....and feel optimist... Am must sse movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Eurovision is great! It's funny and heartwarming with an excellent set of catchy songs. It's also great to see a whole part of European culture that I was just not aware of. Definitely recommend to others!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A super fun movie, with completly unexpected plot twists
Review_body: This is the story of two people from Iceland who dreamed of winning the Eurovision Song Contest. It could be just yet another "overcoming the odds" story, but instead it is a wonderful experience in which completely unexpected surprises are always around the corner. I laughed, I cried, I was astonished, but... perhaps most of all, I had a really great time with this movie!It may not change your life, maybe you won't feel like watching it multiple times, but if you have two hours of your life and you want to watch something that will be a ton of fun, pick this movie. You won't be disappointed.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Never a dull moment with the fab Alexander Lemtov.
This proves that Dan Stevens can do anything. He's the main reason I finished the movie. Too bad he didn't get to sing his song, though..Oh, and of course the icelandic actor Ólafur Darri, I've always liked him.
Will and Rachel were cute with their weird accents.
The music is awesome!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I've not been a fan of Will's recent work I have seen. Anchorman was one of my favourite films for laughs and this is almost up there. The Eurovision productions were very well done and true to life, and I loved the humour, laughing out loud at some points. The film reminded me of one of the funniest episodes of Father Ted, having a similar Eurovision theme. Both lead actors are great.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Plenty of laughs and leaves you with a warm feeling by the end.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As a swede, spoon fed on eurovision (yes, I watched ABBA win back in the 1970s!) I was thoroughly disappointed watching this movie. There are a few giggles, but on the whole it's terribly disappointing and most of all boring.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's definitelly worth your time! Songs are amazing.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Didn't have much hope for this but it has to be one of my favourite films the past couple of years. It was so well written. They had Eurovision down to a tee. I'm not a Will Farrell fan but he did a superb job with this film. The finale song is brilliant. The costumes of Eurovision were perfect.During these crazy times this is a real feel good film with laugh out loud moments. Like Eurovision don't take it seriously. Brilliant.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Father Ted did it better.For a comedy, I laughed very little. But overall, it's a surprisingly endearing story.Lots of unpleasant or cheap jokes that get quite tiring. Nowhere near enough of the genuine, unfiltered lunacy of real-life Eurovision. (Where are my baking grannies, singing horses and other nutty acts???)I have questions about the fairies, but I'm just gonna accept what I saw...However, all that aside, the film tackles the themes of blind determination and admitting being wrong, THEN DOING SOMETHING ABOUT IT - which aren't things that come up too often in this kind of film.If Will Ferrel didn't join in the final performance song, I would have given a 6 or 7, because I really felt like that stomped all over the meaningfulness of the previous half hour of an already over-long film.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: "My therapist asked me if I liked it and I just sighed."
Review_body: Quote by my friend with whom I watched this. It perfectly encapsulates my opinion about this film.It was neither serious enough to arouse any proper emotions nor wild enough to be iconic. Just a string of events and way too much of that Will Ferret guy. It hinged on tropes I thought we as a society in 2020 were well past and every scene felt like an ad-lipped SNL sketch. So much so that even the marvellous Rachel McAdams acted as though she was either reading of hastily written placards or painfully distracted by trying to find something funny to say.The only saving grace was Dan Stevens. Please make a spin off with Russia and Greece being a MLM/WLW solidarity power couple. And don't have an American write it.ps the music was also not half bad.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I wasn't expecting much from this film and the first half hour I nearly turned it off but we stuck it out and I'm glad we did. This movie there is nothing particularly innovative or groundbreaking here but the usual Will Ferrell antics still make me laugh. The demeaning portrayal of the Americans was hysterical. Silly, unrefined, no fascinating plot line, predictable, but charming, folksy, and funny. Worth a watch if you like goofy comedies.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Go on, ignore poor reviews, this is a feel good factor film.
Review_body: Hilarious story of Icelandic attempts of success in Eurovision, written by and starring Will Ferrell. I particularly enjoy his characters strong opinions of Americans, irony at it's purest. Great music, great performances and a very enjoyable film with some genuine, laugh out loud moments. Enjoy :-)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Not only will this film make you laugh from start to finish, and not only is the acting by Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams well deserving of an Oscar, but the score in this film is original and actually quite catchy. Such a creative and unique story. I loved it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Who knew this was a thing
Review_body: I have to be honest to some ignorance here...I had never heard of Eurovision before this movie. I have now not only watched this movie but watched videos of every winner in the history of the contest.This movie may not win a lot of awards but it is a triumph. It is funny, touching, and genuine.Ferrell and McAdams deliver solid if somewhat atypical performances particularly McAdams leaving behind her somewhat stoic character choices in the past to deliver a much more whimsical character.Dan Stevens is really great as a Russian contestant and Demi Lovato has a pretty funny role as well.The song-along scene that features a smattering of former Eurovision acts is worth the time watching the movie all on its own. The final song by McAdams (blended with the voice of Molly Sanden) is spectacular.I may not have been aware of Eurovision before, but now I can't wait for the return in 2021.I also came away with a profound new appreciation of Iceland. I hope to visit this spectacular place populated by a unique people who are both proud and able to handle a little lampooning.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I am such a huge Eurovision fan and was worried this movie would do it a disservice - it didn't. The main characters and cameo roles are brilliant and I loved it from start to finish.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: An enjoyable family movie, with heart and laughter.
Review_body: I don't normally write reviews, but this movie deserves a lot better rating than the 1s (What!?!?). My 10 is to balance out these negative reviews :)2020 has been a disaster - COVID, problems around the world, and worst of all, 95% of Hollywood releases so far have been diabolical.I feel this movie has a lot of heart and deserve better rating. Great fun, great laugh, and brings back the missing ESC for this year. I'm glad I have watched this....twice so far!!Just grab some take-away, get together with your usual ESC buddies and have a great movie night!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I finally have a favourite Will Ferrell film! I watch his others and have enjoyed most of them, but they're a watch once, get a meme or two from them, and that's really it. This though... I am a BIG Eurovision fan and this just made up for it not being on this year. It was filmed so well, from the songs, backdrops, dances and camera angles it WAS like watching Eurovision (especially with the added touch of Graham Norton!). Sure there were things that weren't accurate to the real contest (like how the hell did the UK host the thing? We never win! And why were we in the Semi's when we auto go to the final) but it's a film and they needed some license to do certain things. I forgive them.My husband who will sit and watch Eurovision just to make fun of it (hey at least he watches it with me!) actually said that he had to keep reminding himself that it WASN'T the contest when the performances were on, the camera work, the staging were that accurate.I was left with a HUGE smile on my face (and Volcano Man stuck in my head) for hours after watching this. This is definitely going to be on again and again in my house - I think it would be an awesome film to snuggle up and watch with a hot chocolate in the winter
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I found it hilarious for some reason!
Review_body: It was very very stupid but somehow it worked extremely well! Highly suggest getting baked or drinking throughout but it was so ridiculous it was great! I haven't laughed out loud to a film in a while haha. Loved all the Icelandic locations and music and little cultural touches! Does half the country really believe in elves? I'm googling it now... Ciao!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Touching and funny. Much better than I expected
Review_body: A funny and touching I was expecting the usual trite and purile nonsense and whilst I was not disappointed this film transcended my expectations. Amusing, entertaining, with occasional forays into the familiiar offering of baudy comedy and yet it remained consistently poignant touching and funny. If you were not already a fan of Iceland after seeing their heroic supporters at Euro, you will be after watching this gem that appealed not only to myself but to my teenage age kids too.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As a Eurovision fan, you often struggle to know when you can reveal such a secret with new people. If you're a Fan you love everything about it, if you're a part time watcher, you remember the silliness but forget the sublime!On hearing the announcement I felt the same trepidation. But this film manages in 2 hours to show exactly what it is I love about Eurovision.From the moment we hear the first bar of Waterloo, to seeing the smile on the sad young boy's face, to seeing the Duo stepping onto the stage for their first performance, you are filled with Hope and a desire to see them succeed.The film takes you on the ups and downs as you would expect in a very similar way to Blades of Glory does. Every chance they have to succeed they fluff it all whilst being laughed at. Then you get to the very end, when they get it right and he mutters what will become immortal words, "Eurovision is much more than a competition, The music is not a contest, and the perfect song isn't the winning song, but a song that comes from the heart!"It is Bonkers and Beautiful and I absolutely loved it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This film is exactly what you want it to be. I'm delighted to see that some Icelanders liked it too.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Silly, campy, goofy, feel good movie!
Review_body:
Firstly, anyone rating this film less than a 7 just doesn't get what Eurovision is all about.
The movie is a silly, campy, goofy, feel good experience, exactly like the song contest.It's not perfect, but it's great fun. The story is fairly obvious, but Will Ferrell has fun playing his usual goofy character, and Rachel McAdams and Dan Stevens provide great support.The only award this movie might get a nomination for is the original songs, which hit all of the right Eurovision notes. The song writers have done a great job in capturing the essence of Eurovision.Overall, don't take it seriously, and its very enjoyable.
Loved the ending too, very emotional!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Perfect movie for the Eurovision fans!
Review_body: After watching this movie I felt like Eurovision wasn't canceled after all. If you're fan you will love everything, the reference to the contest, culture references, sing along moments, believable love story. I never new I could love a Will Farrell movie this much, thank you Will for making a movie so true to its source! And thank you Will Farell's wife for introducing Eurovision to him :) Perfect summer movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Great Movie - Perfectly Recreates and Captures the Spirit of the Eurovision
Review_body: I was a little skeptic about a Will Ferrel movie, but it turned out to be a great feel good movie. A romantic comedy that perfectly recreates and captures the spirit of the Eurovision Song Contest with a beautiful soundtrack and a great Icelandic landscape. The performances of Rachel McAdams and Dan Stevens are awesome.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga
