Review_body: I had to turn this movie off halfway through, it was so boring and just weird. I wanted to like it because I like Rachel McAdams and Will Ferrell but I just couldn't get in to it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: And I don't even like Eurovision...
Review_body:
But I absolutely loved this movie!
It wasn't at all what I expected. I though it would just be a big laugh. Yes, it is funny, but it is crazy, sweet, moving.... a real love declaration to Eurovision - and perhaps I should give the contest a chance next year?Great songs, funny songs, and "Ja ja ding dong" got me. I can't stop singing it in my head! HahahahaFilm wise it is not a 10, but it deserves a higher score on MDB than 6,5. So I will give it a 10, to balance those who gave it a 1.Will and Rachel are amazing! Love Fire Saga!
(And Molly Sandén, who actually sang all Sigrid's songs)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Standard Movie but What a Lovely song
Review_body: OK, right to the point. The movie itself is just plain. No plot twist, and standard humor by my taste. But for the songs. What the hell man. So many beautiful song here. Especially the last song. My gawd, my tears are overflowing right there. That alone makes 10/10.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: From a fan of Eurovision....very disappointing
Review_body:
I was very excited to see this movie, because as an European, I grew up watching Eurovision and get excited for the show every year. Of course this year, with the lack of the show, this felt like it could be a fun thing to watch instead.
I was really disappointed with the lack of meaning to this movie. It's all kind of a joke and I can appreciate that to some degree. However, I didn't care about the characters at all. It was all just very...meh in the end. I also just don't get this kind of comedy, so maybe that's on me. It also weirdly didn't feel at all European. I know this is a Hollywood movie but, you'd think they would have made more effort to make it authentic and I don't know...have a point to it?
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I thought I was well thought out so good beautiful honestly it make me feel good it's a feel good watch for sure.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Loved the story, the acting and the music.
Very catchy with emotional pulls.
Great scenery as well.
Will and Rachel just rocked it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If you want a good, solid comedy then this is it.Daft, but funny, and some real good music.Best of Will in years
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: So offensive to the Icelandic and European population
Review_body: Typical that American Hollywood have this perception of Europe as dumb people with no intellect. So so offensive as a person from Iceland. Considering they have banned a classic like gone with the wind for showing how black people were oppressed but they have the arrogance to make this movie and promote it which insults the whole country of Iceland and Europe. An absolute disgrace.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: If you love Eurovision you'll love it
Review_body: Great movie for any Eurovision lovers out there. Very silly (but wouldn't expect anything else from Will Ferrell) but entertaining and the songs are great. Rachel McAdams And Dan Stevens very good too. Made me laugh and sing along definitely worth a watch.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Instantly a Eurovision classic - is it too soon to watch again?
Review_body: As a huge Eurovision fan, this movie was everything I hoped it would be and more! The songs are so Eurovision and would be believable as genuine entries to the real contest. The song Husavik gives me goosebumps every time I listen.The humour was funny and silly but the film has so much heart as well which really surprised me. I'm not sure if you have to be a true Eurovision fan to really feel that this film does go deeper than what's on the surface. We didn't get a contest this year, this more than makes up for it, but we did get a special on the BBC (and across the world!) where the hosts were virtually speaking to this years entries and past contestants. This programmme really moved me and it was really heartwarming to see Europe come together through this crisis, and this film gave me the same feeling knowing Eurovision fans all around the world would most likely be checking this movie out as a replacement for a show this year. If there was a perfect time for this film, it's now!The only thing missing in the film was the postcards!! They could have done something so cool with these so I wish they'd been included but either way it's still a 10/10 from me!The low scores really baffle me, you have to take this film for what it is. You're not sitting down to Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, this is some lighthearted, heartwarming fun. I think you might have to be a boring or very serious person not to enjoy this or at least crack a smile....sorry...Thank you so much Will Ferrell!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Eurovision is all about cheese, both the music and performances. This film captured the soul of the whole thing perfectly. The soundtrack is fantastic, Pierce Brosnan is fantastically bad, Will Ferrell does what he does, and Rachel McAdams was great. Admittedly Ólafur Darri steals the show, but this is a fun and silly romp through all that is Eurovision.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Let yourself go and laugh and feel
Review_body: With the way the world is right now this is exactly the movie everyone needs. You'll laugh you'll sing you might even cry I did. I'm a musician and I loved this movie. Will Ferrell is back on his game.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I've watched this film every day since it's release. I am a HUGE Eurovision fan and have been for as long as I can remember - I am also a fan of Will Ferrell - this film has absolutely everything I ever wanted and more. It had so many familiar Eurovision faces, it poked fun at all the things we all poke fun about - such as getting a dig in about Russia, everyone hating the U.K. - there was a man in a wheel, scary mask wearing rockers, Graham making snarky comments and it was just as cheesy and fun as I expect Eurovision to be. Don't get me wrong - if you don't like Eurovision, Will Ferrell and you're expecting a film with an intricate plot line and a clever twist this film is not for you - but if you just wanna have fun and listen to some proper cheesy euro-pop tunes with a romantic, lovely story underneath then this is for you. It's just cheered me up so much in a time that's been pretty grim for everyone and if I could rate it higher I would! 12 points from me!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If you want an easy watch to put a smile on your face while giving you goose bumps this is it. So bad it's good!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was surprised at how funny this was. With these "types" of movies, you always expect the really bad and lame jokes and you either love or hate it. I usually roll my eyes through them. But this one... genuinely hilarious. Good jokes and well thought out. Loved it and I think it deserves a higher rating.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Out of respect for Will ferrel a 6. But defenitely lower. A music film... ok. But to call it a comedy... no ma'am
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I am not a fan of Eurovision as a song contest,but this movie is brilliant! Fantastic cree, funny jokes and, well, beautiful music and views. Author of the story got the idea of the Eurovision song contest and created a gem.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: When you watch a movie with Will Ferrel, you often go into it, thinking it will be nothing but an entertaining comedy. This, however, is an absolutely amazing experience of comedy, romance, music and beautiful story. Most of the songs are written specifically for this movie, and are really gorgeously sung by various artists, and Ferrel himself.Definitely worth a watch, or two!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: So fun, so emotional, great actors
Review_body: The movie has also a nice message, never give up on your dreams. And the true love is sometimes in front of you. Overwhelmed!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: This was sooo fun and so REAL!
Review_body: Watch it and you will understand Eurovision song contest if you are not familiar with this contest. This is the best comedy of 2020!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Good story, cool songs and overall fun to watch. The scenes in Iceland and the Eurovision stage were impressive. Learning that Eurovision existed and seeing all the artists performing was and added bonus.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: If you love Eurovision your love this
Review_body: Really loved this film, every song could have been entered for real. The final song in my opinion is as good as Never Enough from The Greatest Showman. Loads of cameos from past Eurovision winners. Beautiful locations in Iceland and Edinburgh. Only faults they didn't follow the Eurovision judging properly, and the event wouldn't have been held in Scotland as the UK never win these days.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I've waited all my life for a Eurovision Song Contest movie!
Review_body: I was in shock when I heard that someone FINALLY made a movie about Eurovision Song Contest and literally RAN to Netflix to watch it. I LOVE Eurovision Song Contest. Will Farrell did such justice to the contest and I absolutely loved Rachel McAdams. Such a happy feel good movie that I highly recommend to anyone that want to a feel good movie. I love that more people know will know about Eurovision Song Contest!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Bit like pitch perfect. A fun film. Don't go in expecting too much and you'll enjoy it. Some nice singing
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Not without typical Will Ferrell movie flaws, but a very enjoyable ride throughout. Rachel McAdams is whimsical without being wearing, and so, so sweet, I really loved her in this. Dan Stevens is great, and Graham Norton as the Eurovision commentator is a perfect fit as well. Lots of big laughs, dumb humour (in the best way possible), and fun music, this is light and funny and uplifting.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The essence of a 'feel good' movie.
Review_body: If you're looking for some brainless feel good content, this movie is the way to go! Not only is it produced by Netflix, which stands for a good production quality, the music used is also stupidly fun and accurate for Eurovision. The movie has a lot of cameos of pretty big celebs, including Demi Lovato. If you enjoy Eurovision, this movie will be a first class treat for you.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: My love for this movie is growing wide and long!
Review_body: I'd rate this an 11/10 if given the opportunity. I was laughing almost nonstop the entire film. Great songs. Reminded me kind of like a more adult Disney movie. Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams are a dynamic duo. I swell and burst when I see what they've become!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Lots of Fun, from not a Will Ferrel fan
Review_body: So I generally don't like Will Ferrell movies, they make me cringe. However this one was a blast! Funny, Sweet, Over the top music and musical productions. Especially from the quarantine couch this was perfect entertainment. It made me happy, sad, and want to sing and dance. Loved it. Great performances from Rachel McAdams, Demi Lovato, Pierce Brosnan, and actually Will Ferrell. Makes me want to start watching Eurovision.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Had everything for everyone Music, Comedy, Romance and little Adventure .. Well done Will Ferrell & Rachel McAdams they beautiful together.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I started watching this movie and I admit that I expected I would zone out after about 10-20 minutes.
How wrong was I. This turned out to be a great feel good movie. This is not going to go home with many Oscar awards but that was never the purpose I assume. Spot on Netflix. Will, Rachel and co. Perhaps when Iceland wins Eurovision we will get a sequel.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Fell in love with Iceland and Rachel McAdams
Review_body: A pleasantly surprising, beautiful movie... As a spectator of Eurovision for many years, I knew I had to watch it when I saw the trailer. Although the story seems to revolve around the glamour of Eurovision, there are subtle beautiful messages of love... for people and for hometowns... I'm a Willfan, so of course I loved watching the ever-goofy Will. Pierce Brosnan was solid, but my heart goes to Rachel, oh you cute lovely lady. Can you be any cuter? Why oh why? And lastly, I now have to go visit Iceland, once the flights are back to normal. Amazing Iceland scenery in this movie... Oh oh did I say lastly? I have nothing against people of America, but your system and governors suck...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A Will Ferrell film that didn't suck...
Review_body: ...for which I give Rachel McAdams and the supporting cast all the credit. By now we recognize the buffoonish character that Ferrell plays in every movie. What really carries this flick is the charm that McAdams exudes in every scene. IMHO, McAdams is a seriously underrated actress and her ability to make you forget Ferrell's potty humor showcases it beautifully. Now not every joke lands but there are some good bits that buoy you beyond the cringe-inducing moments. There is a good deal of fun throughout and some songs contestants sing in the contest are actually quite catchy. If you're looking for something to put on in the background while doing other things, you could find far worse than this fluffy Netflix original.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Have 3 drinks and just enjoy the silliness
Review_body: One of Will Ferrell better movies in years, but i had a few a drinks and i enjoyed it. I recommend Jack Daniels and Pepsi max. its silly but had a few good jokes in it. don't watch sober as you it will not think its great...... maybe my life will be better if i was tipsy more. only one way to find out
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: At first i looks like an ordinary com full of clishès,but starting to watch, it really caught me and made my day filling me with hope. If you are living in a hot country during pandemi, you will feel the cold wishing to be living in Iceland which is away from the problems of the rest of the world.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A must fun movie to watch...
Review_body: To be honest when i started watching the movie i didn t think later i would rate it with a 10..but it really was a great fun movie to watch...great actors,nice story and great eurovusion music...i thought it would be just a silly eurovision parody but it is a tribute to iceland and eurovision itself..
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I am a great Eurovision fan, It starts in March/April when the frist song is released until May when the actual contest starts al that time I am in the Eurovision modus hahahaha. This year Covid-19 ruind everything, finally after 44 years the Netherlands wins the contest ruind...but then this film came and made a lot right.
Chickenlady from Israël france austria and many more where in the movie.
Lordi (the guys and girls with the masks)they where Crazy and was the winner of 2006 .Loved the movie
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was not expecting much but I really enjoyed this.. plenty of laugh out loud moments; some great scenic shots, entertaining songs and I even shed a tear or two... so glad I watched this.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: We didn't expect much while choosing this movie on Netflix. But Rachel McAdams' charm & the story's simplicity just melted our hearts. The movie is ended but the melody of Jaja Dingdong & Husavik still lingers on, to remind us that happiness comes from simple little things in life.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Full of laughs, love, music, and happiness; this is a wonderfully entertaining movie! With Rom-Com styling, the movie is a ton of fun. It's an enjoyable satire, drawing awareness to a production that most North Americans are unfamiliar with. If you're like me, it may even bring a tear to your eye! Based on the lesser reviews, I guess some people expected an experience similar to "Schindler's list." This isn't that, nor is it trying to be. For those who simply want to kill two hours, this is definitely worth your time. Great job, Netflix!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will Ferrell and Rachael Mcaddams, you are amazing on screen! I really love this magical movie you gave to us! Much love and ALOHA to you and everyone that helped bring this to the screen;) thank you from the bottom of my heart! Awesome:)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I don't know if I've simply grown out of Will Ferrell's brand of comedy but this movie is not awful by any stretch but the Ferrell and McAdams dynamic just isn't believable. I understand silliness is to be expected but this was just too much silliness with not enough funny mixed in. I actually think if they made it with just a bit more of a serious dramatic tone, it would have worked better.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I wasn't sure what to expect from this movie... but boy am I HAPPY I've watched it. Not only am I listening to "Husavik" 100 times a day, but I really want to go back to Iceland. I forgot how beautiful it was. I can't remember the last movie that made me this emotional... Such a feel good romantic movie with a nostalgic feeling!
Loved it. 10/10
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: With everyone being so down with Coronavirus netflix has been a saviour at home and finding this film I never expected much. After watching film my family found it fun and uplifting and now cant get the bloody songs out of our heads. Need to release songs on the charts.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A beautiful mess of a movie that most ESC-fans will enjoy
Review_body:
I'll try and keep this short.
I liked this movie very much. It's very noticeable how much fun the cast had while doing this movie, and it's super contagious.Overall, the movie is not the most faithful adaptation of the ESC, and you should know that going in to it.
But most of the songs sound like they could appear in the ESC and their staging is very faithful to how Eurovision usually looks, and I'll admit that the last time Fire Saga sung (you know which song) it actually hooked me. I'd love to buy the soundtrack of this movie.Yet, it is not without its faults. The movie is riddled with weird cuts, deus ex machinas and plot holes, and the third act is utterly insane.
But then again, so is the ESC, and that is what we all love about this show. The cringeworthy hosts and numbers, the ridiculous middle acts etc. - and it is kind of poetic how the movie portrays that in a way, intended or not.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A fun movie, despite Ferrell's one note performance
Review_body: I enjoyed the movie, especially having watched bits of Eurovision over the years. It was fun to see many actors of various backgrounds take part in this comedy. McAdams' character was believable and quirky, and I enjoyed her performance as usual. Ferrell's, however, was the same character he plays in the majority of his films. He is better in a supporting role or a writer than as a lead actor.Overall, I recommend the movie, as it did make me laugh with a number of good lines, characters and interesting/silly sub-plots.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Like others said, not a deep or smart movie. It's just fun, funny, feel good, and the singing scenes are great. They captured euro pop perfectly. If you don't know much about European cultures, you might not get the parallels and jokes in the movie. Just be open minded and watch this weird and funny movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Puts you in an awesome mood!
Review_body: What did i just watch?! I LOVED IT! I really expected it to be kind of dumb,which it is in its own way, but you can't help but enjoy it from the beginning to end.Such a feel good movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I mean the movie is not bad but it just doesn't sit right with me that Americans are making a movie about Eurovision. Yeah they're making fun at Americans and whatever but at the end of the day the lead actors are American/ canadian and the producer is American. Idk I just don't like that they need to get involved in literally everything.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: An absolute GEM of a movie
Review_body: This movie will make you laugh, cry and tugs your heart. The music, the location and great cast makes me want to watch the movie again and again. One thing real & true is when Lars jokes around with the Americans, he meant it. I've experienced that when backpacking in Europe before. This movie should be a classic!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: All the negative reviews should be ignored. Amazing movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I didn't go in to this movie with high hopes, but I was so surprised to see how great it was! As someone who watches the eurovision every year, I think it captured just how fun and cheesy it is, also the added humour and romance plot makes it an all round great film. Hopefully Americans will watch this and understand why we love Eurovision so much. Definitely needed due to the cancellation of the song contest this year!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will Farrel once again perfectly pulls off the king of stupid. Combined with Rachel McAdams they make a funny, albeit slightly awkward combo. If you like Will Farrel's humour then you'll get a lot of good laughs in.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Bad humour, bad acting, bad script. Will Ferell again has the role of a big baby.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I'm not a Will Ferrell fan, so I start watching this film with zero expectative. But from the beginning i felt i was in front of something big. The quality of the visuals, the colors, the screenplay make me notice that this was something unique. I love it when dialogues are real although it's obviously a comedy you can see yourself in that situation, if you are a musician, or at least believe the story and that's what movies are all about. I think Ferrell did a great job, nothing more and nothing less, just the right amount of acting. He did a great job in the serious moments and I loved that. I also think that the casting, in general, was great. Every actor did a great job, every part was belieavable. Loved the character of the Russian singer, well played. Supervb movie, hope they win recognition with an award.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: LOVED this film! So funny and heartwarming with really catchy songs! All round excellent performances from the cast, already watched this film twice!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Can't believe I teared up towards the end - great fun look at what is the great Eurovision Song Contest. Good story and not a total trash comedy by Ferrell for once. Have a hanky handy
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Fantastic and Will Ferrell what a Star
Review_body: If you love it camp and funny if you love al thing Eurovisionn and love to party and a sing along then this is for you.Will Ferrell and the whole cast are fantasticWell and cleverly observed by Will on the institution tha we all love, and by his weriting of the film Will too is a huge fan.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Harmless fun, some good laughs, well done, Ja Ja Ding Dong!
Review_body: Always hard to find a good Netflix film without planning ahead. After giving up on "Funny Girl" 30 minutes into that show, we landed on Eurovision. We had just been joking about Will Ferrell's "Old School" movie earlier that day, so we decided to give this one a go (had not heard about it before).We enjoyed it. Some sentimality, outrageous comedy, and OK, some scenes that I think were failures - but all in all, a pleasant 1.5 hours after a long day outside.We plan on performing Ja Ja Ding Dong in front of our friends now.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: People are being too harsh on this. It was a very good idea for a comedy and just when Will Ferrell was starting to irritate me he pulls me back in with this one!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: More Than Funnily Meets the Eye
Review_body: Starting to see this film, I never thought I would have so much to say about such a relatively unimportant piece of cinematography.Where to start?Perhaps by Will Farrell, the comedian I always so much want to like but that somehow, in my view, always falls short of "quite getting there".I was afraid this would just be another vehicle for his mostly crass humor but was pleasantly surprised to see him well tamed and restricted to the boundaries of effective physical and blue comedy while delivering a very pleasant performance.But the true great achievements of this film, the ones that led me to write this short appraisal reside elsewhere.For starters, it demonstrates that it is possible to make effective comedy without being insulting to anyone.The gentleness encapsulated in the effective satire of both ESC and Iceland clearly show that, far from ridiculing the country or the event, the writers intent was to make amusing but also sweet evocations of both and, I must say, they achieve it plenty.In a way, it is amazing how Canadians and Americans captured so well the way ESC resonates here, in Europe, and how incredibly friendly and engaging Icelanders are.Secondly, being that the ESC has become a huge thing among the LGBT community and political correctness being what it is in our day and age, there was the potential of overplaying that vector, maybe even slide into the "proselitistic" side of things.This was effectively avoided while, at the same time, performing a huge service to said community.The only message about the subject contained in the movie is a tremendous powerful one, one that truly makes us all further realize, interiorize and consolidate how absurd, anachronic and devastating some approaches to the matter can be.All-in-all, a great little movie, one that grows on you and, if the intent of the ESC organizers by helping in this production was to further expand the worldwide appeal of the contest, I think they hit the bull's eye.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Great movie with catchy music. The "song a long" was one of the best mashups created in movies. The original song at the end is fantastic. The leads are likeable and you're happy watching it and it leaves you feeling happy when it ends.
This is the perfect example of how clueless and irrelevant most movie "Critics" and experts are.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Eurovision just got brought back - Fire Saga!
Review_body: Covid robbed us of our yearly glam fest of fun and silliness. And Will Farrell brought it right in back. This is deeply silly, funny, cringe worthy and at times pretty moving. And some great songs too. You HAVE to watch it if you genuinely missed Eurovision this year. It has codpieces, elves, explosions, extravagant Russians and lovely Iceland and Edinburgh. Watch it OK?
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A silly, fun and delightfully sweet movie. Worth the watch
Review_body: I'm giving Eurovision Song Contest an 8 because although it was intended as a comedy, it turned out to be a very sweet story that made me tear up at the end. It had its classic Will Ferrell moments which made me burst out laughing, but it also catered to my emotions and brought a warmth that was truly lovely and enjoyable to watch. There was a great combination of kindness and comedy from both of the main characters.And finally, what is important to mention, is how amazing the soundtrack is in this film. The original score along with the original songs were the icing on the cake.I really think this film deserves at least a 7.5 rating.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: People need to stop taking movies so seriously. It may be an artform, but that doesn't every piece needs to be serious. This movie is intended to be a fun, goofy movie, and it accomplishes that goal.The music is great, and very catchy. The plot is goofy, and the chemistry is superb. Honestly, I think this was the best movie of 2020.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I put this off for a while and finally watched it tonight. It was so fun! I hate "The Voice" and my wife makes me watch "Dancing with the Stars" whenever it is on. I hate reality TV shows but this isn't that. This is a fun romp which features Rachel McAdams being absolutely adorable and carrying the story to a majestic finale. Watch it with your wife after the depressing evening news and you will be glad you did. This is not about the contest but is about the love you find around you. I promise you will find yourself engaged with something you didn't expect to like.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Wasn't expecting too much from it ... but was SO pleasantly surprised by an amazing cast, entertaining and emotional movie.
Laugher all the way.
Goosebumps at the end.
What more do you want?!?!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Quirky, colorful, uncensored humour. Great snapshot of our joint culture.Very entertaining, funny, great music. Maybe a best Will Farrell feature ever.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Was expecting some trashy american interpertation of eurovision but as far as netflix films go it was decent
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was pleasantly surprised. Its a fun time! Plus the music was pretty. Dont let the bad reviews get you down, it's cute and funny. And Rachel McAdams makes a great pop star!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Horrible, but has some redeeming moments
Review_body: This movie is like a knock off version of Pitch Perfect. It is predictable and Tbh Will Ferrell is so old now. There were some wtf moments that made me laugh, but majority of the time it made me cringe. The humor is a hit or miss. Also the insults towards Americans were just plain bad, but so true. Despite all the cons in the movie, the soundtrack was amazing. The songs were catchy and upbeat that makes anyone fall in love with music.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This film is light-hearted and puts a smile on your face. Is it an easy watch...yes. Is it a classic...no. Will Ferrell plays a slightly different role to his usual films but if you don't like Will Ferrell then don't watch it! Rachel Mcadams is superb and the music is actually really good.Some laughs and even a few tears! Worth a watch! 8/10
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Brilliant Film 🍿 The Song "Double Trouble"This Song Is So Catchy 👌👍👌👍👌Got it on repeat as Really Like It , think Cos it's EuroDance pop music
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Being a lifelong fan of Eurovision. I can safely say this is worth the watch. Cameos galore, and a great musical score. As my missus said - VOLCANO MAN! Enough said.Watch it and be entertained.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: This did not work for me at all
Review_body: Maybe I missed the whole point of the movie by expecting a light-hearted comedy about a trashy song contest? If not that, then what was this movie supposed to be? I can't figure it out. Judging by the amount of positive reviews on here, a lot of people like this movie - and good for them! But for me, this is a huge disappointment. Eurovision on its own is fun and silly, so the movie about it should be fun and silly too, right? Nope, it's boring and empty, and if not for Rachel McAdams, whom I adore, I would have quit the movie at the half-hour mark.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The music is both funny and good. As a Skandinavian i loved how they captured the essence of us. And the Eurovision songs/dances was incredible like how they actually are! Love love loved it
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Went into this with low expectations and was very pleasantly surprised. Had a lot of great moments and overall left me impressed. Didn't take itself too seriously while still being able to have you going with the movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Had to give it a ten
Review_body: Seeing all these people quitting after 20 minutes with one star reviews is really dissapointing. Happy to give this. 10/10 for all the good moments. Great feel good movie to make this pandemic a bit more bearable.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Honestly I wasn't expecting much but I really loved it. I found it charming, funny and touching, everything I needed right now. I have to say I have always been enchanted by Iceland and that didn't disappoint - it made me wish I lived there. The acting was great and that cast and characters were varied and not one dimensional which was another pleasant surprise. The entertainment was great too! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Laughed so hard on this movie
Review_body: This film is everything to me. I hardly laugh at comedies anymore but when that wheel went loose I laughed for the entire scene. It is the best comedy I've seen this year and a on top it has a heart warming story behind it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I'm afraid it's the worst movie I've ever seen. Such a shame I had to see European countries to be represented in such a poor manner; Eurovision provides a ton of material to make actually fun portrayals of the contestant counties...Thought the concept of the movie has potential, but damn the execution part just went all wrong.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Absolutely Horrid- Will Ferrells worst film by a large margin
Review_body: I am not European and not familiar with the Eurovision so maybe I don't "get it".. but I feel like even if I did I would not like this movie. Some scenes are just gut wrenchingly bad and I cringed several times while watching. There were a couple parts toward the end that made me chuckle but not laugh out loud funny.. I was hoping for more of a "Blades of Glory" type film that you know going into it is going to be stupid but still has it's funny moments. This was just atrociously bad and lacked all of the funny moments you'd expect from a Will Ferrell film.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Second hour is good, but hard to figure out what's the core of the first hour, seems just like a big tourism ads for Iceland and Europe. in my opinion, no matter what background a movie has adopted, the key of storytelling should focus on the complexity between characters that connects with the backgroud, for example, Ferrary vs Ford, we barely know the sophistication of F1 racing but the movie really didn't talk about F1 racing much. It's really unnecessary to film so many content about the contest which is easily accessable on internet. and you can notice that some emotional scene was cut too short, maybe because too many useless view and Eurovision content.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Amazing performances, very funny, i laughed, i cried, i had Fun
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Whether you enjoy this film or not depends entirely on how you feel about Will Ferrel because he does what he does in every film - plays a developmentally-arrested man-child. He's like AC/DC - it works so keep doing it - nobody wants to see AC/DC doing an unplugged session or a jazz album.Personally I find him hilarious so I loved the film. Plot-wise, despite being totally formulaic, it somehow still managed to ramble. You could tell what was going to happen and what the ending would be but none of that mattered because Will Ferrel's hilarious. Rachel McAdams is excellent and a perfect match for Ferrel's 'naive dreamer' shtick - romantic fools that you can't help warming to.If you like Will Ferrel, you'll like this film. Simple as that.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Just watched this and it is what it is. If you know anything about the Eurovision Song Contest you'll probably enjoy this. My partner and I laughed out loud during the semi-final debacle, especially with Graham Norton's commentary. Lots of loud bouncy pop music. An easy watch for a rainy afternoon
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Laughed really at loud a lot
Review_body: Will Ferrell has done it again! This movie is one of the best I've seen of him. Great story, a lot of hidden winks to his other movies and a lot of shaming all sorts of countries. America and the wall, Russia and their homophobia and Iceland and their believe in elfs. I laughed so hard about different characters. The cast is really great and the acting couldnt done better. A lot of surprises, entertainment and weirdness. A great ode to the Eurovision!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Eurovision being cancelled is not the worst thing, but this is
Review_body:
Ive been a fan of the ESC since 2008 and I have a good understanding of what Eurovision is. Once I heard this movie was coming out I got very excited, until I found out will Ferrell was appearing in it, and as the main character... I was expecting a big amount of screaming nonsense by Ferrell for most movie and boy, was I right... Pretty much he is in all of the scenes, hoarding the screen time with dull conversations that don't go anywhere. I felt really cringey the whole movie.. But that's not the worst,
there is more.. I believe the way xenophobia is exploited in this movie is quite big, the main Icelandic character screams (no shocking there) at Americans and telling them to go back to their country.. Now, I dont know anyone from Iceland but I'm guessing they are not particularly filled with hate towatds tourists.. I'm giving a 2 out of 10, only for 2 particular reasons: the sing along from former contestants was actually fun and enjoyable, (I wish they would have made thus a musical type of movie instead) and the 2nd reason : the songs and performance from a few countries were really cool to hear, specially the swedish one.. kudos to them... Now, going back to the main actors of this movie: I wish anybody else would have taken the Male role, Ferrell didn't convince me not even one in any of his multiples repetitive scenes that he was Icelandic or an Eurovision performer.. and Rachel, I wish they could have use her in a way to address the impossible love story between the Russian performer and Kevin Swain, now, that story caught my eye right away, but we didn't hear most of it.. overall a great idea and mediocre results..
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Fans of Will Ferrel will love this film. This movie is really for those who have seen singing competition shows and love when the spotlight falls on Will Ferrel as he delivers own brand of comedic styling. This film is full of bits that poke fun at Iceland for the sake of fun. Also amazing camera work to capture the beauty of the country.I truly enjoyed the use of Icelandic lore throughout the film and feel that these were the funniest bits alongside the performances of mostly fictitious pop songs.A heartwarming message pulses throughout the film as well. The nudity warning also is just for a couple statues, so the humor does not get too inappropriate. What an amusing RomCom.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I agree with some comments, first part of the movie is a bit bizarre but as soon as they get to the Eurovision contest it becomes a different movie, full of feel good moments and beautiful. The music and the lyrics are amazing.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: A must for every European who watches Eurovision! And especially in 2020 - the year we didn't get a chance to watch the most over-the-top and entertaining music show of the year! It was funny, light and perfectly embodied the soul, artists and drama of the real ESC! I didn't expect to like it as much as I did!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Great film, not a musical but some great songs in it
Review_body: Will ferrell is excellent as usual, but the parallels with blades of glory as he can't get there on time, were making me think does this happen in all his movies.The film itself is excellent, I don't watch euro vision for a number of years, but of course I recognized some of the contestants certain parts of the filmRachel McAdams is excellent as Wills unrequited love interest and she makes me want to go to Iceland, her accent is very nice as well.I loved all the songs in the movie and especially the final song Rachel (My Marianne) sings.. frankly i'm interested to see what songs she does next, as that one makes us all think of "home" especially when we are far from it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie is incredibly funny and entertaining because of the superb talents of Dan Stevens. He steals the show!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As far as I'm concerned, Rachel McAdams is the movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A movie that pays tribute to Iceland and Eurovision
Review_body: Iceland is a small and isolated country in the middle of the Atlantic and we the Icelandic people have many traditions that may seem strange to other people.For this reason I find that we Icelanders are many times made fun of in pop culture. We eat shark that is nasty höhö. So tired of this guys seriously.This movie does not make fun of Iceland it pays tribute to Iceland. It uses many famous Icelandic actors and there are loads of small references to Icelandic things that only people how have been to Iceland would pick up on.A part from all that the movie is great. Will Ferrel is hilarious, Rachel McAdams is hilarious. The Jaja Ding dong guy is hilarious. Hearing Pierce Brosnan try and talk Icelandic is hilarious.10/10 No problem. Must watch!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Not the best, not the worst.
Review_body: I expected to hate it, but actually found it somewhat enjoyable in parts.It's no classic, it's not even close to the best of Will Ferrell's works, but for some casual viewing you could do worse.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Will become almost a cult movie for some of us
Review_body: I will start by admitting that I never liked Ferrell (at all), but after this movie he has earned my respect! The movie is relaxed, funny, cozy... And fuuull of details for Eurovision lovers. I have followed the contest for a long time and this movie was just purely Eurovision, and I can imagine purely Iceland too. It made me feel the Icelanders. The bad ratings come for sure from people who doesn't follow the show, since they re missing a lot of details. Looooved the end song, especially the part in Icelandic!!! And I loved that the festival was hosted in my beloved Edinburgh. I had a blast from begining to end. And so did my 6 year old!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Absolutely hilarious from start to finish. Forget the critics reviews; this will fall under the category of a cult classic in a few years - one of those films that's so stupid that it's brilliant.The storyline isn't a bad one, it wouldn't be out of place in a serious romantic film; but throw in the wackiness of Will Ferrell, add a touch of Eurovision (complete with cameos from Graham Norton, plus former winners Conchita Wurst, Netta, and the Portuguese guy who's name escapes me) and it's just a constant string of laughs.Be warned though; the songs are catchy, they'll stick in your head (watch out for Double Trouble; in my head for 5 days afterwards).Alexa... PLAY JAJA DING DONG!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: This was actually a good movie
Review_body: I'm not going to lie, I didn't think this movie would be good. The trailer confused me and I didn't know what I was going to watch. I ended up watching it with my sister and it was hilarious! We were laughing so hard! It was hilarious but also adorable. I would 100% watch this movie again with friends and family. Sometimes comedies can include inappropriate scenes but this one didn't. It did include some dirty jokes and showed a statue of a naked guy but besides that it didn't show anything bad. I really enjoyed this movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Heads up, Eastern block ended in 90
Review_body: Writers clearly lack the knowledge of the fact that there is no such thing as Eastern block anymore. Comments like that today are used to show supremacy. The movie is childish and tries to use political issues in comedy, like turning the Russian singer gay and taking all the trans, gay, black etc issues into another low point. I'm not usually sensitive, but this just took it too far. It gets 3 stars for including Rachel McAdams and Pierce Brosnan
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As a european, I loved this! So funny! Very much like, and ever better than the real Eurovision. Great songs that will stick to your head! Recommend for a good laugh
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Possibly the worst film I have ever watched. Poor acting, poor script and desperately unfunny.
That said, its worst crime is the outright racist depiction of Iceland and the Icelandic people. I have visited Iceland and the people there do not speak with those ridiculous accents which made them sound like half-wits. Nor is Iceland some backward 3rd world country (Farrell's character amazed by a mini bar in a run down Scottish hotel that he thought was the height of luxury). The hotels in Iceland I've stayed in have been far superior than any I've stayed in in New York.
Avoid this rubbish.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
This and Eurovision: Europe Shine A Light cheered me up this yearThe characters were great
The Actors really cared about their roles
The cameos was on point
The plot was good
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Who knew!?! The perfect antidote for 2020!
Review_body: Sometimes we discover a movie apparently made by first timers that bubbles over with enthusiasm and loving care. This is one of those, and more surprisingly, not fueled by ingenues, but by film veterans. The fabulous costumes, stunning scenery, great singing, heartfelt acting, and strong script are very well done. This is one to watch every year, but you'll never forget your introduction to Volcano Man, JaJa Ding Dong, Lion of Love, and the Song-A-Long!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Feel good movie for a world going through a tough time
Review_body: I have a couple of go to movies that I watch when I need a bit of cheering up, but haven't added a new movie to the list in years--until now. I LOVE THIS MOVIE! Will Farrell barely even bugged me. Rachel was adorable and fantastic (The elves hate us!) and Dan Stevens was amazing. Loved seeing Pierce Brosnan looking so handsome. Never in my life have I ever wanted to immediately re-watch a film, but I did! And now to go research Eurovision!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I had low expectations, but I needn't have. This was a joy from start to finish. So many great Eurovision references and hilarious performances from Ferrel and McAdams. Give in to it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Will Ferrell from bad to worse
Review_body:
I'm a fan of Will Ferrell who acted in some tough comedies like "Step Brothers" and "The other guys",but with "Holmes & Watson" and "Eurovision" is going from bad to worse..It seems that Netflix doesn't really want to make a real good movie on its own,although using good actors.
The script is like it is written by a 10 years old kid,Just some smiles not really laugh.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Eurovision is the craziest event of the year. I've been watching it and commenting on it for years. Some of the songs launched here are iconic. Didn't know what to expect from this movie, with Hollywood involved. I must admit - it was decent. Loved to see the guest appearances of several Eurovision winners.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Start with the laughter and end with heart and tears.
Review_body: This movie really took me by surprise. It is not a silly Will Farrell movie. Eurovision has a little bit of romance, little bit of laughs, lots of songs and not a mean bone anywhere.Imagine "La La Land" but with humor and better songs. Lots and lots of heart. The final song will get nominated, if not, win the best Oscar song.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Film can not decide either to be parody or tribute to song contest so it feels ... lukewarm. So much parody potential wasted ... Film, obviously made by Americans, playing jokes on behalf of bizarre European show, they don't know well and sadly stick with few spikes, not exploring obvious ones ("crazy" fans, voting in french, show kitchen ...) For me, it was pain to watch as film has few promising moments which were never connected into enjoyable experience.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is a very nice film for the whole family. Ferrell is funny as always playing clumsy Lars but in my opinion he plays the most important supporting role, bacause Rachel MacAdams and the Eurovision song contest itself are the 2 stars of this movie. The atmosphere of the songcontest is perfectly reproduced. The music and performances are beautiful and Rachel is sweet, beautiful and sings like an angel. The music in the movie is beautiful. Many of the songs that are covered could really make it to the final of Eurosong. HUSAVIK will never win the real Eurovision songcontest, but an Oscar for best original song would be deserved.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A typical Will Ferrel Comedy that will make you smile
Review_body:
I will be honest I was quite slow to watch this one when my friend suggested it, however when I saw the cast of Adams, Ferrel and Brosnan, I said I'd give it a go.Watch this movie with an open mind, and you will enjoy it!
Wil Ferrel does a great job at giving us that classic Terrel comedy he is known for. While the move could have been a half hour shorter, several scenes certainly will bring a smile to youre face.All in all, its a decent, feel good movie that will have you laughing! Would recommend
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Don't go into it with high expectations, this is not "The Other Guys" or "Stepbrothers" but it's an entertaining film which is funny and has a surprisingly nice story. And to top it off, it has a great cast. If you have a spare hour and a half I would definitely recommend it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
After seeing the reasonably high rating on IMDB for this film, I figured I was in for a Will Ferrell comedy up there with Anchorman (which really grew on me quite a while after first seeing it), with a lot of laugh-out-loud moments. After watching it though, I feel that the high reviews must have been due to a Eurovision fan thing. I'm not really a fan of Eurovision at all so I watched this without any real investment in that aspect of the story. There were a few moments that were amusing but I felt that there was a long patch in the middle of this film that felt really un-funny and awkward to me. I was contemplating turning this off halfway though as I was embarrassed for having chosen to watch this with my family and everyone was starting to look at me and question my choice. This was sitting on a 2/10 for me but then thankfully
the film picked up with some comedy highlights and better pacing toward the end. I think if this film had been trimmed to a 90 minute run time, tightening up the story, it would have been substantially better. If you were a Eurovision fan, you may have appreciated the finer details more than I did.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is much better than I expected. It's very funny and touching at the same time. Makes me want to visit Iceland!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Funny, relatable and heart warming. This movie is funny but made from heart.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Such fun - the spirit of Eurovision
Review_body:
Joy to watch - but I don't know if it makes sense to anyone who hasn't seen Eurovision.
And typical Will Farrell comedy.
I can't believe Man's Zelmerowis not in it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Not sure what my expectations were going into this movie, but I know I didn't expect to spend time on a review afterwards and give it 9/10! This is a warm, funny movie that takes hold of you and brings you on a wonderful and amazingly entertaining ride throughout its 2 hour plus runtime.Eurovision is huge in my home country of Sweden but I've never been one of the competition's biggest fans, quite the opposite. This movie reminded me of what the competition is about; fun, over-the-top extravaganza and silliness, but also a lot of heart. Me and my wife laughed, teared up multiple times and we absolutely loved the whole thing!The music (the MUSIC!!) is exceptionally well written and performed and fits the setting perfectly. I'm listening to the soundtrack as I'm writing this... And this from a guy who normally listens to techno and house and avoids current pop music and eurovision like the plague. Congratulations Ferrell and gang, you really delivered something special here.Lots of love :)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is one of those films that is fun to watch only because of how terrible it is. It simply is in the, "so bad, it's good" category. Nevertheless, as comedies go these days, I can't but help recommending this one.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: This movie really grows on you the more you watch it.
Review_body: I was initially disappointed as I love when Will Ferrell has no leash, and allowed to riff and improv in all of his glorious comic absurdity. This movie is more of a slow burn. It has some lighter comedic absurdity but what it lacks in that, it more than makes up for in a fascinating culture rarely seen. There are so many little subtle lines and dynamics that are comic genius, but not in the often loud over the top antics Will Ferrell is known for. Rachel McAdams nailed her role, as well as Dan Stevens playing the utterly masterful role of Lemtov. So much great music. It did a great job of capturing the quirky characters both in Iceland and the Eurovision contest without disrespecting either. If anyone took a beating it was the American frat guys ha. A great cameo by Demi Lovato. Molly Sanden from Sweden providing the incredible singing voice for Rachel McAdams. The last song notes were hit i did not know existed. It made me laugh, it made me cry. What more can you ask for. Best Will Ferrell movie in a while who co wrote the screenplay.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie is a perfect representation of how insane the whole spectacle of Eurovision actually is, and since I am from Sweden I tell you the truth..! The movie was funny and heartwarming, just a great "fell-good" movie! Watch it on a rainy day and don't trust the haters!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I can't believe how much I like this
Review_body: I don't really post reviews but this is absolutely hilarious. Predictable and typical, but the music is both shockingly good while sounding exactly like Eurovision. And the acting is fantastic.. every single person nails itI can't believe this is so good
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Amazing story and very light movie to enjoy from!Love is all we need!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: When I saw over two hours long for a comedy like this I was expecting to give up after 10 minutes but this came together surprisingly well, well put together, some unexpected laughs. The 2 hours actually flew by. You may have to love Eurovision, as I do, to really like it and 'get' parts of it. It also felt like a good Eurovision fix in a Eurovision- free year.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: As an Icelander i loved it and laughed my ass off
Review_body: As many know Icelanders are very proud, so when I heard that Will Ferrell was making this movie I was very sceptical. But another unknown secret about Icelanders, we have a big humour about our self and what Ferrel did or his crew was really respectfully study the Icelandic culture and mood aroun Eurovision, even enough that there are some inside jokes there for Icelanders and our naighbour sweden. I am and Icelander that lives in Norway and has a Swedish boyfriend that hates eurovision, but he loved this movie, we both did.. its done in a respectful manner and honering the culture of eurovision. Its a hit in Iceland and "jaja ding dong" is playing in every pub be ause we think its hilarious!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: THANK YOU NETFLIX! THANK YOU EUROVISION!
Review_body: THIS FILM IS WHAT THE WORLD NEEDS NOW!!!! As an American, always from America, just LOVED this film. I believe the film was positive towards ESC & is every ESC fan dream come true. We did not have ESC this year, but we had this film! Music track is EXCELLENT loved the songs. For die hard fans of ESC, there were some triggers for them (7 onstage for Sweden-limit is 6, Spain, Germany UK in semi-finals - 4 major contributors are automatic for final), the score board, competition held in Scotland, etc.) Also one liners that are quick to catch (the comment "nobody likes the UK", Americans asking if it is like 'the Voice', etc.). Trivia in film that only ESC fans can appreciate, the piano used was Duncan's, Pierce Brosnan watching ABBA sing Waterloo, a song he sang 2008 in Mamma Mia, Dan Stevens stating, "be my guest" (he played Beast in stage of Beauty & the Beast hence the song Be My Guest), also he resembles George Michael of WHAM! whom he mentions in the film (WHAM! manager went on to manage Russian boy group SMASH!! which did covers of 'Faith' & 'Last Christmas' of which SERGEY LAZAREV participated ESC 2016/ 2019) etc. Graham Norton could have been way more snarky like he normally is, seems he toned it down for this! loved all the cameos from Jon Ola Sand to Salvador, Demi Lovato and the Party Scene was the BEST EVER!!! Thank You, Netflix!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was really looking forward to watch it and it was worse it.I love eurovision, no matter how silly it sounds.So this movie had everything: humor, tears 😢, good laugh 😆 and just joy of watching it.So if you are like me fun of eurovision than watch it🙃🥂
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Sometimes the music makes the movie. Tears?
Review_body: This was WAY better than expected. Sometimes the music makes the movie. <3 I actually started tearing up towards the end! Only one other movie did that. Serious. Music has a purpose. To set a mood. This struck a chord with me. Definitely worth watching in my humble opinion.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie has got heart and the actors nail their performances - if you know and love all the kitsch associated with the Eurovision Song Contest, you'll love it
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Ahh Iceland - Probably not his sister..
Review_body:
Great fun, good music and we got Ya Ya Din Dong!
This is the Best iso movie yet.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Ignore the progressional reviews, they're probably American
Review_body:
Really solid, as usual the Americans seems to miss the point of there being nothing wrong with a normal small town life.
Also missing the point of the story following the real world Eurovision which they could brush up on with some out of America knowledge. We still love you, but I want to live where the whales can live cause they're gentle people.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: So much better than you'd think of a Will Ferrell comedy
Review_body: Definitely worth watching. It has one amazing cast too besides Will.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Any how so many Eurovision people around why didn't they told the producers that Spain goes to the final directly and so does not have to compete at the semifinals !!
England does not get any points cause ''everybody hates it '' and yet the competition took place in Scotland. Wow
Why is americanized the movie about the greatest Song competition in the world. After one song finishes they have only couple of minutes to get the stage prepared for the next song but hey for the American way and the usual cheering of the public, they have allowed the couple to stay kissed and even explained his dream to win the Eurovision Song Contest
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: ... In a loving and a funny way 💕. Great work from Will Ferrell 👍 If you love the silliness and the music of ESC you will like this movie. So fun with lots of familiar faces from the Eurovision Song Contest.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: It's corny, but oh so Eurovisiony you just got to love it
Review_body:
Fun film about Eurovision, love and elves. Laughed several times and loved the music, the former Eurovision winners cameos, and the elves. Dan Stevens was brilliant in this, "he/him pronomen" 😂.
If you don't like Eurovision, this film may not be for you.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I wanted to give the movie a few less stars but..
Review_body: The movie is really enjoyable and the best eurovision show i watched in years. I wanted to give it 7 stars but the movie has some hearth in it and i had to give it a 10.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Being a 'nil point' UK'er I found this film extremely funny despite the location inconsistencies. Thank you so much Will Ferrell for staying true to the Eurovision vibe. I will never be able to look at Dan Stevens in the same way again.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Pure gem and a lot of fun for eurovision fans....U.S. audience probably wont get it though
Review_body: Absolutely enjoyed it,was a great gap fill for the event that never happened.I dont dont do musical films but this was an exception...Songalong was brilliant(not a spoiler)....parting words...YA YA DING DONG!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Speorg note! Romania gives 12 points to... Iceland!
Review_body:
I was literally feeling a bit down with all this lockdown happening, feeling unmotivated and not excited about doing anything.But when I opened Netflix and saw that there's an Eurovision movie with Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams I felt like there is hope. :)
It really made my night - the story is good, the Icelandic scenery unrivalled, the songs are great (the last song with that Speorg note could easily win Eurovision), the commentary from Graham Norton is super funny and as good as it is in real life.Is it a cinematic masterpiece? No
Could the writing be better? Yes
Was it entertaining? Absolutely!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Americans hate it, Europeans love it!
Review_body:
Let's be realistic, the movie is not a perfect 10, but it's 7.5 at least. Making fun of Icelandic stereotypes is spot on and I mean it in the most honest and humble way with no disrespect. I expected more stupid jokes and even more bizarre events happening when it comes to Will Farrell, but this is perfect mix of fun and absurd moments balanced with emotional peaks which few comedies can offer.
And yeah, the songs are universally great and they will stick in your head and this is coming from a guy who gets off on hardcore.
This movie is making fun of national stereotypes, and apparently judging by the comments and reviews only Americans can't take a joke while the rest of the world enjoyed being roasted throughout the movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Clearly made with a huge amount of love and affection, this delivers a decent amount of laughs and gentle smile throughout.Unfortunately, much like the competition itself, its overlong. There isn't enough here to fill the 2 hour+ run time without it feeling like a bit of a stretch, it's a pity as at 85/90 minutes this could have been a smash.The evident enthusiasm of everyone involved builds enough goodwill for a mark slightly above average but it's hard to escape the feeling that it could, and probably should, have been better.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Eurovision, Will Ferrell, catchy daft music, synchronised whales. All the makings for a damn fine guilty pleasure. 🎶Ja ja ding dong🎶
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: This film made me bang my head on the corner of my table.
Review_body: After sixty minutes of awkward acting, a predictable narrative, and jokes which didn't land, I got bored and went to the kitchen to make breakfast. Walking back into the lounge I tripped and fell head first into the corner of my coffee table. The pain I endured was by far more enjoyable than watching this film.Regretfully, I continued to watch the second half to see how it ended. It was so bad that I contemplated, purposefully running headfirst into my coffee table, in the hopes it might erase the two hours of my life I spent watching this so-called comedy.Don't waste your time.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Was a really good film. Funny, witty and a good storyline. Would definitely recommend to watch it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Maybe it's not worth a 7, but i'm a sucker for Will Ferrel.... It's got a cute story, kind of cheesy but still solid. And gotta say, Pierce Brosnan... Damn that old dude looks good #No homo
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Great movie
Greaylt songs
And
Great laughs
Worth watching just ignore the critics
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Haven't laughed so much in a long time
Review_body:
I stumbled across this movie one cold winter afternoon, knowing nothing about it, and even though I am not a Will Ferrell fan (in fact most of the time I really can't stand him), I hit the play button. I was excited to realise Rachel McAdams was in it, as she's one of my favourite actresses of all time. It just got a whole lot more interesting.
I was only minutes into the movie when I found myself laughing. A lot. At first I thought it was the accents (okay, that probably had a lot to do with it) but this unlikely pair, the way they conversed and the clumsy relationship just made for fun times and lighthearted viewing. Add to that a whole bunch of catchy original songs. I have not enjoyed a movie this much in a long time, and am actually really surprised it's a Netflix movie as most of them are very B grade.
Definitely add it to your watchlist!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Wasn't as bad as it could be...
Review_body:
It's a good movie for Friday evening sipping G&T when there's nothing else to do... Nothing more but on the other hand - nothing less... Beautiful Island landscapes, strange Eurovision contest + Ja ja ding dong...
PS. My wife felt asleep 30 minutes ago so maybe it was less than good afterall... PS2.The end song was pretty pleasant though...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
While this film was lacking in the hysterical comedy sketch's, the actors and storyline kept me engaged from start to finish. Don't get me wrong, you won't find a movie starring Will Ferrell that doesn't have you laughing throughout. However, this movie kept you interested in different ways despite being incredibly silly.
What I did not expect was for the songs to be actually good. Granted, it's impossible to take Will Ferrell singing seriously, but the music in this movie was a actually good. Especially the finale song in the Eurovision contest performed by Rachel McAdams.
Any movie that you mix a lovable Will Ferrell with a stunning Rachel McAdams, you are bound to have success no matter the story. This movie does not compare to the Likes of Step Brothers or Talladega nights, but unlike those it is considerably cleaner and perfect for a Netflix movie night. 6/10 (solid for a goofy comedy) would recommend!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Nice surprise, warm and and a good feel movie.
Review_body: This was more than expected. A very heartfelt, warm and a goofy funny movie. Pure joy all the way, made me smile and left a good feeling. Thank you, just what I need in these strange times.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Makes me want to visit iceland
Review_body: Funny movie, surprisingly great music. Very replayable
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Great fun - the spirit of Eurovision and with a few good tunes thrown in!
Review_body: If you want some escapist fun look no further. Encapsulates the spirit of Eurovision. Worth watching for Dan Steven fabulously camp Russian oligarch / singer alone.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Rachael McAdams is a great singer
In this movie but it's 2 hours of Will Ferrell with a bad accent. This could be an easy hour long movie. Nothing warrants this run time. It's not a musical. It's barely a comedy. Even action movies stress this run time.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I had low expectations for this movie. Has a hard time (in general) with films with Will Farrell, but in this movie he is good and together with Rachel McAdam creates charming characters that you quickly love. A charming and cozy movie that together with the incredibly beautiful views of Iceland exceeded my expectations!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Wonderful, uplifting and such a relief from our odd world
Review_body: I wasn't expecting much from this but was thoroughly overjoyed to be proved wrong. It captured the essence of Eurovision perfectly and it was lovely to see previous entrants have cameos. I've been to Iceland 3 times, but have never visited Husavik. I definitely will next time.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I really loved it!
It really filled up 2 hours! And not a moment was i bored! I love eurovision and i really love this movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is worth watching just for Dan Stevens's portrayal of the Russian entrant, Alexander - brilliant acting and worthy of an award. Iceland's Final song is fantastic and I've already saved it in my Spotify playlist - another reason to watch the movie. One of the best lines in the movie for me was about elves taking things too far... had me & my friend in stitches.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Loved the cheesy humor and the song where out og this world.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Everything I wanted from a Eurovision movie and then some.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Perfectly paced love-letter to the campy craziness that is Eurovision.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: More than your typical Will Ferrel movie
Review_body: I wanted to give this movie a 7.5, so thought an 8 would be what I would settle on. Better than I thought it would be! Classic Will Ferrel movie but with more maturity. The characters while still outlandish, are better developed and much more believable compared to his past movies. It helps that it's set around a music contest with pop stars who have big personalities and eccentricities. Definitely a feel good movie ( my boyfriend and I cried a few times lol). The sets and wardrobe are beautiful, and the music is great and well written. All of the acting was spot on. After Holmes and Watson, this movie is refreshing and surprising!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I felt some of the jokes ran a bit long/were a bit much and I have no idea why Sigrit would want Lars as he treated her like crap the whole time but, it was more than worth it to see Dan Stevens as the Russian contestant. He created an amazing character!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: What a wonderful life it could be
Review_body: Best vocals, best screen play, best of all bests. Thank everyone who put this movie together. It was well received and needed in our time of need being at home, most of our time due to the covid 19. Really took me out of reality and into their dream of winning the EuroVision contest. All performances were good, some even better and some the best ever. Will Ferrell & Rachael McAdams were a perfect match for this performance. I see this show up for many awards for 2020. Best Picture I've seen this year!!!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: So much fun, even though I've never seen the Eurovision Song Contest
Review_body: I LOVED THIS MOVIE. It was funny and heart-warming, and the visuals and the music were excellent! I have never seen the Eurovision Song Contest because I live in Canada, but that only meant that I didn't recognize the cameos by real contestants. And I'm not a Will Ferrell fan, so I was afraid the humour might be a little lowbrow for my taste (yes, I know I'm a snob), but I shouldn't have worried. My only quibbles are (1) Ferrell looked too old for the part and (2) I didn't think Pierce Brosnan's role was well-written.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I really enjoyed watching the movie, assured laughter and some tears for the most sensitive ones like me :)
I noticed a lot is the American way of seeing the world less than itself and in this case Europe and Russia.
I loved the visual and sound effects. The Eurovision interpretation was interpreted although different, it was fun and inspiring.
Recommends seeing it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Do it. It was corny but oh so good.
Will Ferrell always delivers, sort of like Ben Stiller, silly but satisfying.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's everything you can expect from a movie about the Eurovision contest. It's wierd, funny and very musical.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I don't know what i expected from this movie but it wasn't this.
This movie is a true feel good movie in every sense. It leaves you in a great and uplifted mood with a large touch of inspiration. This is a must watch if you want some lighthearted fun, love and smiles. We need a sequel.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga
