Review_body: What a treat for Eurovision fans. Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams work so well together. The music is typical of Eurovision and the song Husavik is perfect.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Silly funny comedy (we've watch twice already 🤣)
Review_body: Great for a Friday night film with drinks. Make sure to sing along with great songs such as 'JahJah Ding Dong'. Loved it
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: What's not to love about this feel-good film? I love the ESC and I adore both lead actors. Not to mention the soundtrack and Dan Stevens' performance! So different from Downton Abbey, so funny! They also approached the contest with humor but respect. Bravo!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
At just over 2 hours, this runs about half the length of the Eurovision Grand Final these days, but it is a complete joy to watch.
Will Ferrell has certainly captured the glam, glitz and splendour of it all.
A little fan service has been provided half way through which should get the Eurovision fans buzzing even if they loathe this movie.
To me, this makes up for losing the contest in 2020 and roll on 2021 where hopefully Fire Saga will be special guests at the Grand Final.Big shout out to Glasgow Airport, Glasgow's SEC Hydro and the city of Edinburgh for looking so beautiful alongside Iceland in this worthy flick.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Can't get better Songfest publicity than this haha!
Review_body: I think many will want to go to Iceland after watching this and will watch the Songfest if they don't know it yet. Perfect reflection of the real thing with some light humor and even ended up stirring some emotional corner of my eye. Very entertaining.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As a Songfestival lover I really loved this movie :)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The Critics think this is ess aitch one tea
Review_body:
They don't get it, I don't believe any of them have seen the ESC. This film captures the kitsch, the emotion, the voting! Lol
Watch it with an open mind and an open heart,
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Man, when I wrnt into this movie the only thought I had was "Another Will Ferrell comedy. A few laughs but stupid overall." I did not expect to cry, the movie has something a lot of Will's work lack. Heart. You really feel the character's struggle and motivations. They feel.... Real. The movie sacrifices some laughs for a genuine story and I loved it. It still has those dumb humor moments, but they are rarer than before. Hooefully there will be more like this. It captures really well what Eurovision is all about and it works as a good replacement for the canceled show this year.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The trailer shows it will be a typical Will F. flick but oh boy no... it's just super duper fun. Loved the music and especially the end.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Total feel good movie. Very Scandinavian. Love it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Give this movie a chance, it will positively surprise you!
Review_body: I avoided this movie for six months because I thought they will make fun of Eurovision in an ugly American way and instead they made fun of it in a beautiful European way. This movie will make Europeans prouder of their Eurovision heritage and will introduce this competition to the rest of the world. Don't listen to the critics, it's heartwarming and funny and you shouldn't miss it. Giving it an 8 because I don't like Will Ferrell.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Super sweet and a feel-good movie all around
Review_body: I've watched it several times now. They were the cutest couple of people I've ever seen! Super adorable. It was funny as well but I think it is more of a feel-good movie than a straight up comedy. I was surprised with the low rating because everyone I talked to about the movie said they loved it.I'm familiar with the Eurovision contest and I'm not really a fan but I was worried that this movie would be making fun of it. It is a well loved competition in Europe so I thought it would be pretty rude to insult all of Europe. But I thought it was pretty accurate and was in good taste.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Born and raised in Sweden I've seen countless of Eurovision finals. This is more or less spot on in the portraying of the show!Will Ferrell has done a great job here, and the lovestory between him and Rachel McAdams characters are a fun touch.And, to all Americans who doesn't know about this phenomenon, there is a little dance scene where winners and contestants from the last year's Eurovision contests is in and it is amazing!Bonus points to My Marianne (Molly Sandén) who does the singing for Rachel McAdams. What a star she is!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I am so sorry for the rest of the world...
Review_body: I am European and up until a point I was loving eurovision! Unfortunately, the last years has become a bit too much for me so, I stopped really following the event.I was always nostalgic about the moments when all of my family was sitting down to watch the eurovision song contest and I was sure that I will never relive it...BUT.... THIS MOVIE MADE ME FEEL LIKE A CHILD AGAIN!I watched the movie, and while it is a 2+ hours movie, I just couldn't have enough!!! The jokes, the songs, the Icelandic touch... The Greek, the Russian... Everything worked perfectly together!I truly believe that this movie will become a classic and from now on everyone will watch it the same day as the original eurovision song contest! It will become a Pan-european tradition! Let's do it my fellow Europeans!!!!Thank you so much for the feelings and the laughs!From me 12 points!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Will Ferrel Back to his Best.
Review_body: This is easily Will Ferrel's best film in years. It's feel-good, silly at times, pulls your heartstrings. Just watch it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Go in with the right mindset
Review_body: This movie is not for everyone, but people who love a goofy Will Ferrell movie, or love the Eurovision will also really like this movie. There are some good laughs in there, but also some beautiful songs (not expected).
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Second bad movie on the bounce
Review_body: Think will ferrell is loosing it, boring and poorly done
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The premise of this movie was an episode of Father Ted in the '90's. Almost exactly the same story. I'm a fan of Will Ferrell but I was surprised that the movie ripped off Father Ted so blatantly. Instead of Iceland it's Ireland in the BBC show.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If you love Eurovision, you can't not love this! It's so so wonderful and couldn't love it more! Can only think that the poor reviews are from non-Eurovision fans!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It was a pleasant surprise. Great music. Movie to rewatch several times.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Very entertaining, great music, amazing voices. Filled the gap of the cancelled contest this year. Funny for the fans.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: No matter your Country, it's Inspirational! Oscar Worthy!
Review_body: Will Ferrell's best movie yet! Rachel McAdams is pure gold in this. The comedic charm is spot on! Perhaps the best song ever to describe your home...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Only half way through but Dan Stevens has already stolen it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: By all means watch - but nah
Review_body: I'm a long time fan of the Eurovision Song Contest, and it's nice of Will Ferrell to make a movie about it. But it really is a bad movie. I liked seeing the previous participants (of recent years) and he got the gist of the contest down. However, the story was a bit to far fetched for me and it didn't do much for me humour-wise. I guess that's just me not really enjoying Mr. Ferrells type of comedy. I did laugh, but mainly it was hard to watch and a good half an hour to long.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Did enjoy this but as a Eurovision fan, I have to admit that there were some Eurovision inaccuracies that slightly wound me up. Specifically the leader board in the semi final. It included some of 'The Big Five' countries (UK, Spain, Italy, France, Germany) as competing in the semi-final when they are all automatically entered into the final. I have to admit, it did annoy me a little bit. Otherwise I did enjoy the film. The songs were the type that you usually see in Eurovision. Graham Norton was his usual sarcastic self. His commentary is the best part of Eurovision every year and he was a great addition to the film.Overall it wasn't a bad film. Sweet and full of heart. Enjoyed, just slightly annoyed by inaccuracies as already stated.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: This movie has heart (and Sandén's lungs)
Review_body:
While this movie had a couple scenes I may or may not have fast forwarded through, it had heart, and the final song made me quite emotional.
The climax and denouement definitely made up for some boring or uncomfortable scenes in the second half of the movie.
Also, Graham Norton was amazing as always.
Also, as someone who studies and appreciates folklore, the Elves were a nice, albeit goofy, touch.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Soft humour, captured alot of the eurovison magic. Music was very good and ending brilliant. Definitely one of my favorite Will Ferral movies.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I'm not sure if we watched the same movie as everyone else. Maybe it could have been funny, but Rachel McAdams?? She has never and will never make me laugh.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The story was good and the movie was quite funny, a few goosebump moments here and there and a really good job with the Icelandic folklore and quite well done with talking the Icelandic even though not all of it is understandable, coming from an Icelander. (Not from Húsavík though)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is one of the funniest movies I've seen this year. Obviously you need to be familiar with Eurovision contest to really get this movie but if you are and you love comedies than you won't be disappointed. There is a pretty few songs that I must say are stupid but so catchy you won't be able to get them out of your head. I highly recommend this movie to anyone who likes a good laugh. Will Farrel and Rachel McAdams delivered great performances!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I have to say the first half of the film felt a bit slow and only mildly entertaining but, as a lover of Eurovision, from the moment they attend the party with the other acts onward it really took on the Eurovision feel and became a real love story to Eurovision.For those who don't like Eurovision I am not sure whether this film will hold a lot for you other than a few entertaining lines.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: That is how you make a feel good comedy
Review_body: Me and my wife loved the movie. It was great fun and really captured the European Song Contest quite well. The heartwarming humor was uplifting.More of this type of movie, please.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Had some initial doubts, but gave it a go and do not regret. Plenty of funny, cringy and touching moments. Recommend!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Demi Lovato (Katiana) saved the movie. Even though she appears a few times, she was one of the best characters in it. And her song is the best one in the soundtrack - "In The Mirror"
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Expected it to suck tremendously. Never been so happy to be wrong.
Review_body: I expected this movie to be another unfunny Will Ferrell movie that tries to hard like we've seen of late with films like Holmes & Watson. From the start, though, I could tell this one was different and it was actually really good. By the end, I realized this movie was amazing and like the characters themselves, I was left stunned at the end.Rachel McAdams delivered a near flawless performance and I'd argue she's never shined as much as she does in this film. I won't spoil it but the last song of this movie is on a whole nother level and tugged at the heartstrings while also leaving me speechless.This movie was emotional, funny, touching, uplifting, and just an all around pleasure to watch. I love, love, loved this movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Icelandic Pitch Perfect for the Win
Review_body: Rachel McAdams and Will Ferrell are the duo I didn't know I needed in my life. Absolutely loved it! It was a great comedy that didn't take itself too seriously. Liked it way more than I thought I would and definitely will watch it again.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is a good fun film, like the contest itself it is not to be taken seriously. My only gripes are, The Hydro being used as Edinburgh, when it is in Glasgow, it basically means everyone from the Glasgow will hate the film! And half the film is set in Scotland yet not once local accent was heard! Oh and the most far fetched thing is The Eurovision Song Contest being hosted here, yes I'm from Scotland, the host city is not a random pick, it is held by the previous years winner, come on it's been 23 years since the UK last won it and back then they were still part of Europe and there was no political grievances!!! Other than that worth a wee watch for the jokes and the fun!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Kitch as the real Eurovision. Nice screenplay, good vibe movie and Abba songs on it! A must see it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I had high hopes but low expectations for this movie. I love Rachel McAdams and Will Ferrell, but sometimes movies like this can go to far. I'll admit to not being a big fan of the fake accents throughout, but I got over it. In the end, I thoroughly enjoyed the movie and had many laughs. The over-the-top elements were perfectly dispersed and fit well with the theme. As an American who has lived in Holland for the past fifteen years and grown to enjoy watching Eurovision every year, I loved it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Seeing Will Ferrell I automatically thought it would be a silly fun comedy but even though there are some good laughs this movie is much more than that. Felt like tearing up at the end and the music is beautiful. Make sure to watch!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is one of the best Will Ferrell movies and, this is not just a comedy. This is a movie about overwhelming decadence/snobism/attitude that one has the world under his/her feet on the one side, and true people on the other side. Uniqueness, free of any kind of flawlessness, even free of any claim to be a winner, wins. Thank you, Will.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: From the heart of a true fan
Review_body: Will Ferrell is one of greatest comedic actors of my generation and I would watch him sand drywall for 90 minutes. In fact, I would gladly trade that watch experience to the experience I had watching this movie. We all love Will, so maybe we just save the millions of dollars needed to create these movies with him and have Netflix just film him building a bird house for his back yard or checking his emails for 90 minutes. We'll watch it just the same.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Ray of light in a very dark times
Review_body: This movie reminded me how to laugh again. We live in a time when everything is shaking and colapse. This beautifull movie reminded me why we need actors, singers, show buise.... cause they r making us to forget everything and live and hope.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is a comedy, but it actually doesnt have that many great jokes and in that part is average at best. But the humor built around the Eurovision and its style is great. Also interesting are the actual winners of last contests that cameo in the fim. The songs in the movie are actually pretty good, a combination of original songs made for this movie and past hits. If a soundteack came out, I would gladly listen to it while driving somewhere or having a sit down party at home with friends after watching the movie together. In that sence it is a unique movie that may develop a cult following.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Was blown away with this movie. Funny.. sweet.. beautifully done. I don't know how will Ferrell is in this because I don't usually enjoy his stuff outside of blades of glory... But wow.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Cannot understand the negative reviews this film is appsolutly brilliant it will make you laugh make you cry the best feel good movie of 2020 Will and Rachel are just amazing, I love Icelands culture and this film complaments it, please don't be put of the negitive reviews is an epic of massive proportions
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Americans thinking they know all about European culture..
Review_body: Why do Americans think it's okay to make a movie.. about the most European thing in the world? All American actors, American writers, American directors? It would be one thing if you didn't notice the lack of European culture knowledge, but this... is utter trash. If anything this is cultural appropriation lol
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: When I first saw that there was a movie going to be made about Eurovision, I was mad and felt like they were probably going to ruin my favorite event of the year. But I had to watch it and I was very surprised. It was fun, silly and heartwarming. Which is exactly what Eurovision is supposed to be. Also: there were so many cameos of former contestants!! Overall I thought the movie was great and it actually did Eurovision justice!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Why was everything so Norwegian?
It was rather weird, everything from the Norwegian sweaters to the silly Norwegian accent.Apart from being overwhelmingly Norwegian it was entertaining from time to time.1/10 because of the extreme lack of respect.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I Loved this film
As a Brit I love this film, great humour, just like why we watch the Eurovision in the first place.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: You have managed to capture the spirit of what is Eurovision Song Contest. I just love the details with known ESC profiles and the fact that Sweden always get great points and is mostly always in the lead. I adore the music in this Movie and it is definitely in the greatness league with The Greatest Showman.Amazing! Molly Sandens Voice is breath taking and so is all acting.10/10 from a True Eurovision Fan who's heart healed a lot hearing "Welcome to the Eurovision Song Contest 2020" from someone this year.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Really disappointed with this. Not anywhere near as funny as any of his other films (and I love them all). I feel sad writing this but I thought it was going to be like blades of glory/Eurovision . Dan Stevens was probably the best thing about it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The acting was painfully bad, directing was all through sub par and as far as production goes, it was a pure disaster. Apart from a couple of times where I actually smiled with the movie, I spent most of the time smiling nervously at it, wishing I could hide my face from the shame. It does have a few forgiving features that make me beleave that it could have been a decent movie. Unfortunately those features drowned in sloppy craftsmanship and the movie sank heavily to the bottom.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Very funny and thanks from Iceland
Review_body: Watched the film with a group of Icelanders and one American and we were laughing hysterically throughout the film. The songs very accurately and in a funny way mimic the typical Euro-vision Song Contest music. They make fun of Icelanders and other Europeans in a very stereotypical and a bit inaccurate manner, but it is funny as hell, and I think almost all Icelanders will only find it funny and not at all be insulted. Recommended to all that love Eurovision and have the sense of humor to get somewhat ridiculed for it ;-)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Some things were funny (mostly Dan Stevens and the cameos from old Eurovision-Winners) but mostly just a lot of missed potential. For example whats with the bad accents? And don't appreciate the big age difference between the two leads. I realize that it's not supposed to be realistic, but this script is too much.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was hoping for a funny Will and Rachel movie. What I got was all that and more. Beautiful Icelandic scenery and people, funny as hell and omg that song at the end.. bawled my eyes out! Oh, and since I'm Canadian I loved the American jokes!!🤣
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I am obsessed with this movie. My
Fiancé and I love every second of this film. I want to play the sound track at my wedding. The cast was brilliant. I didn't even know that Eurovision was a thing until I saw this! I'm so happy I watched this movie. It was funny and I cried and I loved it. Thanks movie maker team for making this movie.
The end
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I love this film. It made me laugh and learn! I purchased the soundtrack and listen all the time. The story is heartwarming and funny. Makes me want to visit Iceland.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The premise was intriguing but the movie overall was better than expected and had more depth than other recent Will Ferrell movies. Familiar Will Ferrell comedy with some other styles but it also had much more touching story and beautiful ending that briefly touched on and related to our cultural roots and heritage we have as different nations.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I have never watched the Eurovision Song Contest but it makes me want to watch it now. All the characters were good and the plot was entertaining. I don't know how people didn't like this movie it was amazing and so funny. It's a great watch and you won't regret it. The main actors and supporting actors were all entertaining and I'll definitely be rewatching it soon!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: If you love Eurovision you'll love this
Review_body: Fantastic movie laughed throughout! Songs were fantastic,performances spot on.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Not being a Will Farrell fan, I really didn't want to watch this.
My husband put it on and before you could say 'Eurovision ' I was hooked.
Cheesy storey, great music and a happy ending.
Definitely gets my vote
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The Jaja Dingdong, Volcano Man, Mascarade are the songs that keeps running to my head! Done watching it for 4x. Hahaha! So funny.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I'm an American fan so I may be biased...
Review_body: I and my family enjoyed this film. It's not a deep film and it relies on some familiar tropes....yet it's mostly light and funny.If you have been a faithful watcher over the decades there are some fun references / Easter eggs and the films catches much of the fun goofiness of this annual crazy wonderful spectacle. It even works in the (in)famous scoring that the faithful love and hate in this show.Both the familiar and the unfamiliar in my family enjoyed this film.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Perfect mixed of fun and fact
Review_body: If you.love eurovision you will love this. Cant believe the BBC news app has not rated this film. I thought it was fab.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Just a great feel good film
Review_body: I initially saw the critic reviews and thought 'oh what a shame, I won't watch it' .... but I am so glad I did.What a great film, very catchy tunes that get stuck in your head ( JaJa DingDong is a classic) and the cast were great. We have decided this will be a cult film and this will be our lockdown family favourite . If you love the actual Eurovision Contest with all its wackiness then this film does it justice. Chill out and have fun watching .
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The best film i have seen in a while. Thank you Will Ferrel for a great show.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Lighthearted comedy that shows a lot of different aspects of an under appreciated country (even if it pokes fun at some of its stereotypes).
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's funny, it's lovable, it's just great. The songs gave me goosebumps quite a few times. I really liked it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie makes you laugh and it makes you cry, what more could you ask for? It's a masterpiece in my book.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As my first review on IMDB, I couldn't have picked a better film. This movie was fantastic. My wife loved it, as did my children. The story was fresh, the scenery was amazing. A light-hearted comedy that can bring tears and smiles in the same scene. I think it made the Icelandic nation look like they should prepare for a tourism explosion, and from what I hear, it's already one of the top tourist destinations. The film was made with lots of silliness and heart. Ferrell and McAdams were an awesome pair. At no point did I want to stop watching.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I great to see an actor doing something completely different and nailing a good accent. The style and feel of the edit makes you feel that your definitely somewhere far off in Europe haha! Very fresh and fun movie would recommend to any one.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: perfect pick me up for these times
Review_body:
You either get Eurovision or you don't (the real thing that is).
As the say in the film, it's so much more than just winning. If you're expecting serious oscar winning stuff you will be disappointed but if you just want to have you spirits lifted with some good old fashioned silliness then this is an absolute tonic especially in these difficult times and especially if you miss Eurovision. This is the kind of film you will definitely return to and watch again - I'm already penciling it in for Christmas and next year's Eurovision night. It's silly, it's fun, it doesn't take itself seriously and most of all it's uplifting - a real feel-gooder (just like the real thing in fact).
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Amazing love story about elf's and feries together with wine (of course)
Review_body:
Thorough out magic autumn evening, along with the see foud (squeeds and wine), we have enjoyed the wonder this movie eluminated to us. We have enjoyed their costumes a lot, and their infantile, but beautiful, love story inspired by their hometown in Iceland.
Russian character was therific spice in this love romance, and Greek performer (Mita I believe) was a cherry ona top of a pie.
Still, if don't cherish this review, please, for your own good, take a look at the movie!!!
However, if stil not, you are a perfect candidate to visit Psihoterapija i Psihologija Instagram profile.
KP
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The story is predictable (to a degree), but still very entertaining and the music is excellent. I've gone back to listen to all the music multiple times.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Best comedy I've seen for a while
Review_body: Very funny in parts and the best comedy I've seen for a few years.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
It was fun in Eurovision way.
There's few inconsistencies.
1. People would not laugh at the chosen artists if the rest of the competitors would have died in an explosion.
2. Husavik is located in the northernmost part of Iceland, which takes around a day to get there by bus, and around an hour to get to Reykjavik Airport, from which Lars would need to transfer to Keflavik Airport - which is around 40min if travel.
3. Flight to Edinburgh takes around 2:30hrs
4. Icelandair doesn't fly to Edinburgh, but Glasgow,
5. To commute from Glasgow to Edinburgh takes around 1hr
6. Lars would have not make it to get to the contest considering that he left Husavik in the afternoon
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I really enjoyed this film. It takes a gentle, warm-hearted poke at the Eurovision Song Contest. Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams are terrific as the Icelandic contestants who win our hearts. For me, the stand out performance was Dan Stevens as the outlandish Russian contestant, Alexander Lemtov. Totally brilliant. A great fun film and just the ticket on a damp, dark, winter evening.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Great movie...really touching and emotional...I loved it...And I would certainly suggest it to others...And it has lot of beautifully written original songs...hope they create a sequel to this movie..🖤🖤
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I don't see how whether you are a Eurovision fan or not has any bearing on your view of this. I cant stand the event myself and avoid it at all costs, but I don't like figure skating either, but I loved Blades of Glory. This was tosh, though.
let's see ...
Perfomer gets stuck in stage equipment: Spinal Tap (obviously!) and Pitch Perfect
Catty competitors disrespecting the heroic leads: Pitch Perfect again
Performer arriving late after ridiculous/epic struggle to get to the venue: Blades of Glory!!
Even the politician who plots to lose (because it's too expensive to host - winners have to host next year's event) was seen on an episode of Father Ted.
Decent song at the end, though (a la Frozen!)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I didn't have much hope for this movie, but was hooked in the first 10 minutes. Classic Will Ferrill, super fun songs and characters. Exactly what's needed to distract from the goings on in the world.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
If you are familiar with the contest - you would laugh from time to time. But be prepared - they are mocking everyone. And yes, it is still a stupid comedy - it is a rough parody, but it is pretty nice characters there. I really loved how they tried to express the core of the nations participants types in a comic way, of course.
I don't think this film will suit to those who don't follow Eurovision contest, so it is kind of narrowing it's target audience, but still, totally worth my time.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: A younger male lead would have worked better. The anti-American tinge, doesn't add to the humor. A little thought to the story could have produced a very funny movie. But I guess that is a little to much to ask for. Otherwise, It was watchable and contained a likable supporting cast.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Good, but not made for Eurofans
Review_body: I watched this movie as a very big Eurovision fan, and my expectations were pretty low. Even though, the film ended up better than I expected. Ok, it's a parody, but it clearly shows, that it is directed by non-Europeans, and it isn't for Eurofans. The scene of singing together with the Eurovision stars at Alexander's party was the best scene of the film.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
If you find the Real Eurovision Hilarious then this is for you.
Watch it in the right frame of mind and you'll crack up.
Loved it !!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Wonderful actors and beautiful Icelandic landscapes. A 10 for 10!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Very Strange but strangely funny. Very Eurovision!
Review_body: Very Strange but strangely funny. Very Eurovision!Worth a view.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Fun and cute movie. You really need to have grown up with Eurovision to appreciate the level of detail they have put into this movie. A good Friday night movie and the last song, make sure to keep watching for that song. Amazing!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Volcano Man, He's got my melting heart
Review_body:
As a self confessed Eurovision loving family, we were awaiting this with anticipation and a little worry that it could be cruel, but I was aware Will Farrell was a fab or it. This shows, but is funny, moving, goofy. And really captures the essence of Eurovision. But I don't think you need to be a Eurovision fan to love this.
Great cameos, great sound track. We have already had multiple viewings. Thanks to Netflix and will Farrell for this utter gem
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Let's be clear it's never been for me. BUT my kids love it and I grew up with it! My country has won it a lot of times so theres a hint. This movie made me very nostalgic especially during the current times I miss my cooky crazy European friends!! Where we all get nuts, we sent a turkey ffs! Let's hope we'll have it again next year! Enjoy as a irrelevant fun movie see you all next year!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: They got this part SERIOUSLY wrong.
Review_body: The funniest part of Fire Saga was when they implied that the UK had won Eurovision the year before.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: You would know if you know what Eurovision is all about! Brilliant!
Review_body: As someone who has been watching Eurovision every year, witnessing the enormous effort and money every country put to shine out as 'original', which is sooo unbelievable and can more often than not seem quite foolish, yet somehow charming and exciting, I would say this movie was spot on in terms of representing this exact spirit of the contest. I genuinely enjoyed every minute of it - laughed and cried. Also, having the opportunity to live in Iceland for a bit, I know most people there take this contest with quite an excitement, which makes the movie even better for choosing exactly Iceland as the main focus. Absolutely loved it!! And on top of that, since the actual Eurovision contest sadly got cancelled this year, this movie really made it up for that, at least to me.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I believe people will find this film rather enjoyable when watching it for fun or out of boredom.However there are a lot of parts of the film where it seems to disconnect itself and then scramble back together to try and get the film into a more enjoyable one.There are many repayable, funny moments where you laugh at loud, but sometimes you wish it wouldn't play out for so long.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Wasn't expecting it to be very good, but in fact was pleasantly surprised! Yes, it probably is longer than it needed to be, but there were lots of laugh-out-loud moments and many of the Eurovision details were spot on. Americans might not get it (which is somewhat implied at several points!)
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Honestly, how are we expected to believe a Eurovision held in Edinburgh? For that to happen the UK would have to be the winner the previous year, which we all know is impossible.Also, not a single Irish flag in the crowd? COME ON?!?
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Colorful, funny and easy to watch. I loved the songs. It's so good to watch something that is not dark or sad for once. We need more movies like this nowadays.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This really is better than i expected and its even better if you know eurovision well enough XD its nice to see it in a movie, good concept. a bit too cringy but it works
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie is representing Eurovision like he really is from the beginning to the final scene. Full with surprises and originality.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: This is nothing short of terrible
Review_body: Maybe this is better if you're more familiar with actual Eurovision but from an American perspective, this movie is an overstretched, half-assed attempt at comedy. Virtually no actual jokes landed, script had no chance to succeed. Please don't waste your time watching this
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I found myself laughing the whole time and smiling at the end. Maybe I just needed something like this right now. Did not disappoint.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: It's a movie and it's hard to follow...
Review_body: So, the movie... it's not a good call for a chill movie and that pass like it's nothing, I would be lying if I said that... it's tough and unfair, somethings are kinda disrespectful for me. Like, Songvakeppnin is one of the strongest national finals and it's said like a 'joke final for TV', it's not a nice thing.But well, somehow (no spoilers here) they made it to Eurovision in Scotland, I would love to see that again, and it was 50 minutes of the movie when I actually started caring about how it would end, then I stopped again knowing the rules and how unreal they are in the movie. But well... it all a long, LONG, a little horrible and you wanna quit, road to the end. But it ends and it's nice, some way I enjoyed the end and how it was treated.Also, Demi participation is irrelevant and it's like a cameo, nothing interesting.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Love the humor about Eurovision, how big role Húsavík is in this film (real town in Iceland), the true belives of Icelander in Elfs are amazing part of this film and funny.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Will you never seize to amaze me!
Review_body:
I've never felt compelled to write a review or comment on any movie or video. But this movie was outstanding! Yes it was silly but it was also filled with so many emotions. Rachel is absolutely stunning and makes you feel the love, heartache and what true devotion is. She gave me chills multiple times!
Olafur is such an a**hole but in the best of ways. Would still love to share a beer shoe with him! And then there was Will. I have all but one of his movies, I even have his SNL skits and I'm a huge fan. But what you created this time was magical and I think one of your best performances. The rest of the cast was so on point as well, especially Pierce. Thank you to everyone in the making of this film for bringing that story to life.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Don't expect Will Farrell to be funny in his usual way. Jokes don't land, and it is all a bit bizarre.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Best Will Ferrell's movie since step brothers... If you like his work, its a great opportunity to see him doing what He does best...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: An affectionate celebration of Eurovision camp
Review_body: Loved it, loved it, loved it! If you think this film is a bit silly, corny, camp, or ridiculous...you'd be right! But that is Eurovision all over. The Eurovision Song Contest is one of my highlights of the year, and shows how we Europeans can have a laugh at ourselves (and Americans!) but also celebrates music, diversity and love. And it's partially set in my home town of Edinburgh...what more could you ask for?!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As a Swede a movie about Eurovision is such a fantastic idea. But in the end it's not about a song contest. It's about what really matters in life. Love. This movie is funny, heartwarming and smart all in one package. Just see it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If you love Eurovision you'll love this film. It's daft and camp - sound familiar? I was so invested I even cried at one bit near the end. Highly recommend!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Great film and watched with the family. Yes we enjoy Eurovision every year but as a movie fan this really ticked the boxes. Don't understand all of the poor reviews by the experts?
Great songs and humour throughout."PLAY JAJA DING DONG!!"
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is definitely what the world needed!! I didn't have high hopes and wow was I supposed! Job well done.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Amazing film, a great way to showcase the beauty of Eurovision
Review_body:
Let me just start off by saying, I hate Will Ferrell but I am a huge fan of Eurovision. The movie was so great, Ferrell didnt even bother me like he normally does haha.
I was very worried hearing about this movie because I thought it would mock Eurovision and not showcase what it's really about. However, it did the opposite!!It was so fun! Many funny moments and great cast. Also, there are many cameos by Eurovision stars so if you're a fan, it'll make the movie even better!!Not sure if Americans who are unaware of Eurovision will fully understand the film but it'll certainly peak their interest!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The genuine atmosphere of Eurovision contest
Review_body: Unfortunately in 2020 the contest was cancelled regarding pandemic hazard, but the movie help's to recall atmosphere and feeling of supporting favourite contesters. The movie had my curiosity since Netflix premier's newsletter. In first five minutes it had my attention. I was afraid movie could be too goofy, but it wasn't a case. The movie has good structure, logical chain and easy to watch and follow, what makes it good choice for Saturday night. A lot of nice Eurovision style songs performances can be seen in the movie, aswell previous Eurovion contesters. Stock up with pop corn the movie will not let you down!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I loved this. Wonderfully silly with some real singing talent on show. Will Ferrell always makes me laugh and is fantastic in his role. Rachel McAdams is very funny too - which was unexpected - and compliments him well. The whole cast is great and you can tell that everyone had a blast making the movie! They have captured the Eurovision song contest perfectly not to mention some of the beauty of Iceland. A real treat if you're in the mood for some guilty pleasure.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Will Ferrell captured the true essence of Eurovision - long but brilliant. Douze points!
Review_body:
This is the thing, if you are not a Eurovision fan then you probably won't enjoy this movie as much. There are certain skits and bits in the movie that will only be funny to someone that has been following the Eurovision Song Contest and understand the true greatness of this show. Will Ferrel has been thinking about making this movie for 20 years, and he loves this show. He didn't just decide to make this movie because he needed the extra cash (although I'm sure he doesn't mind that either)
Yes, the movie is a bit long, but its nothing compared to how long the televised Eurovision Song Contest is, which is close to 4 hours and that's just the finals. I am a true Eurovision fan myself, and I loved the movie. Have a glass of tall champagne and watch the movie when you are in a good mood, just like one would be before the real Eurovision finals. I give this movie 12 points - douze points.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Lemtov's character is the only funny thing on this movie. Will Ferrell jumped the shark a long time ago. He simply isn't funny, therefore has to try incredibly hard and unlike Adam Sandler, hasn't realized that comedies are about the ensemble cast, not the individual (especially Ferrell whose delivery may have worked early in his career, but is no longer the case).
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I wish I could give more stars
Review_body: I did not know what to expect when going in, and I got completely swept off my feet. I thought it would be some cheesy comedic romcom, but it was so much more than that. The way (Northern) Europe, the USA and of course the Eurovision Song Contest are parodied, it had me in tears several times. I still cannot stop laughing when I think of the two whales jumping from the water. The story is not only funny, but also sweet and endearing. At first I thought it was silly the movie was portrayed by Americans (the two main characters), but it's exactly what makes it hilarious.I also liked the fact that Russia got called out for its anti-LGBT+ stance.I watched it with my friends and we had so much fun. The next day we were still rewatching clips. And I will definitely watch it again!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: At first I wouldn't even have contemplated about watching the movie knowing that Will Farell is starring in it. So far I've never managed to sit through to the end of his most recent films. For a comedian he simply isn't funny. But what he does play well is the role of an idiot. Anyway, after watching a dutch tv reporter (I'm Dutch) said that he'd never seen such a bad movie, as a big Eurovision fan I wanted to see for myself if that was true.And it's not. The movie isn't that bad. It actually, when Sigrit sings her song in the finale, brought tears in my eyes. The title of the movie says it all: Eurovision Songcontest and if you're a Eurovision fan this movie us a must see. And Will Farell? The role of idiot becomes him. The star of the movie though is the "end-song". I"d watched the movie two times in two days and will probably watch it even a couple of times more, only to hear the "sing along" song and the end song again...........
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Loved the music. Loved the story. Loved the chemistry between the actors. Loved the ending.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I wasn't expecting match the trailers this days all look the same and typical just try to get your attention, I am happy that this movie went beyond the trailer. This is definitely my favorite movie this year so far.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Dan Stevens' start into a glorious comedy career
Review_body: Like all the other reviewers here I also have to state that I am not a fan of Will Ferrell. Since the guy mainly makes movies that are best viewed after ingesting loads of alcohol, Eurovision is a pleasant exception. Ok it is the standard love story/struggle format, but very well executed in the Eurovision Song Content Context (see what I did there?). As an Eve Online player I can recognise the Icelandic accent, so it was pretty easy to spot the odd Swede, but overall it did not matter. I guess as long as everyone speaks funny it's perceived as Icelandic.Dan Stevens is the highlight of this movie in the portrayal of a gay Russian (purely fictional as there are no gays in Russia of course). From his bio here on imdb he seems the typical classical actor, but his accent and manners were spot on. Also nice to see all the Eurovision cameos and of course the "stupid americans" who do not understand this cultural phenomenon at all. As a dutchman who did not get to go to the event in Holland this year, the movie makes up for a lot.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A Designated Survivor entering an Eurovision Contest
Review_body: This movie is really hilarious. I love it! The genre is mixed, you can find Adventure, Musical, Comedy, Mystery, Action, Drama in this movie. The songs were catchy and funny at the same time (yes, Volcanic Protector Man). The singalong are EPIC. The mystery aspect was also good surprisingly. The adventure in beautiful landscapes of Iceland reminds me of Walter Mitty movie. The actors are amazing and very talented. This movie is a must watch!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Genuine, lighthearted, and Beautiful. What more could you want!
Review_body: I read the critic reviews and entered this movie expecting an unfunny Will Ferrell movie with no redeeming qualities. I left understanding that for all critics are, they're just people, and sometimes they have more bias than they do taste. This movie was excellent. It had lighthearted humor that anyone can understand, it represented the beauty of a small town in Iceland, it also didn't follow generic romcom villain story lines, which proved refreshing. Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams proved to be top tier actors, as their chemistry onscreen and their physical commitment to match the singing were fluid and in sync. All together when combined with inter-country banter, the movie proved a fun, passionate, and enjoyable experience. By the end you'll be rooting for the good guys too! I recommend it to anyone and everyone!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: In typical Will Farrell fashion, they raised the roof.
Review_body: Will Farrell comes out of his bedroom in his latest role playing scenario that we are caught up into at whirlwind speed. As a lover of European music, I've watched a lot of Eurovision for a 30 yr old American. And Will nails it. I had the strangest sensation that this was like a sequel to the notebook for Rachel McAdams, she threw herself into this role in a delightfully complex way that plays really well off Ferrell's typically 2d comedic character which works amazingly well. Like, I actually connected with a will Ferrell character for once. And his dad was a stunningly well written character as well. Plus the numerous Eurovision contestant cameos and inside jokes are delightful.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Made an account just to write this review as I saw it only had a low rating. A really great fun, easy, humourous film. I loved the cheesyness that is Eurovision, my American husband didn't believe Eurovision was a real life contest so few quick YouTube videos later he quickly got the gist and could identify with how 'out-there' and cheesy the performances really are. Loved Graham Norton hosting it as he usually does, great nostalgia listening to his Eurovision commentary and as English person I absolutely loved the little UK jibe "0 points"! Favorite quote 'the elves went to far!' only wish we would've heard a 'nil pois'. All in all, LOVED IT! Thanks so much Rachel McAdams, Will Farrell, Pierce Brosnan and everyone else for bringing some humour into 2020.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Whilst the movie itself is bit tacky, the music is extraordinary good.The movie has really nice scenes of Iceland and I'm waiting Húsavík to become a tourist attraction just based on the movie and the scenery shown.The movie features all my favorite Icelandic actors too.Vel gert!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: great fun and entertainment like a movie should be!!
Review_body:
This movie is just a rare joy to experience and should be successful due to its unique and fiercely nationalistic subject matter, fun locations and brilliant actors. Any pierce Brosnan makes a movie worth watching but with a very believable Rachel McAdams and Dan Stevens coupled with enjoyable music throughout, it is elevated even more.
Will Ferrell may be a tad too old for this role but his relentless anti American quips made up for it.
Its a great story about following your dreams and that knowing that other people may not be very smart and shouldn't rule your destiny.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Honestly I watched the whole film to see them flesh out the Volcano Man production, which never materialized. Even after seeing the film, that little clip is the part of it with the most production value.The best part of it was the dumbed down introduction to the Eurovision world. The plot and love story were just awful. It really could've used some editing.Go into it expecting light fluff and you'll enjoy it.I just can't stand Will Ferrell.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
As a die-hard eurovisonary k have to say I thoroughly enjoyed this film. It was camo, funny and waaaaaaaaay over the top. Everything you could want from Eurovison. Just sit back, don't think about it and enjoy the magic
The songs are (camp) brilliant in their own right
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Super movie, especially if you're familiar with this contest
Review_body:
I was very sceptical, but loved it so much.
Although I would rather see another, slightly younger actor, the script is really fun.
Too bad there was no competition this year because of covid-19.
This movie was a nice replacement.
And now I want to visit Iceland too.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: If you Love Eurovision you'll live this
Review_body: Will back at his best.Gay. European . Eurovision fan . It's the one for you !Feel good , fun , Mcadams voice fantasticOnly critic Ireland should have played a bigger part
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As an Icelander, I don't understand why people would be "offended" for how this movie portrays Eurovision and Iceland. Will Ferrell did an amazing work and was HILARIOUS! This movie had me laughing and crying the whole time. It really captured the Icelandic spirit when it comes to Eurovision, and the "insest" jokes....well we are a small nation and we make fun of it as well. All in all, this is a beautiful, funny and (semi) accurate movie when it comes to Iceland and Eurovision! Definitely made up for the cancelation of Eurovision 2020.......which Iceland should have won btw!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I'm an American who's been living in Europe for 15 years and had never heard of Eurovision before moving here. I now watch it each year and think it's hilariously kitschy, spectacular, and, every now and then, there's even a great song. This film brilliantly captures all of those elements of Eurovision in a film that's both extremely funny and moving. The song "Husavik" is genuinely great and there are some other fabulous musical moments as well, such as the "songalong". I suspect that most of the bad ratings come from Americans who've never seen Eurovision before and probably haven't ever been to the Nordic countries, so don't have a sense of what's funny about the characterizations of both. I don't say that with arrogance - I also didn't know before I moved here! In any case, I hope Americans will give this gem of a film a chance. It was clearly made with love and Will Ferrell took a risk making a film about a country he must have known most Americans have no interest in. Probably the most fun I've had watching a film this year, and I watch a lot. . .
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The song performances were spot on and well performed. The movie ran about a half hour too long but overall all I enjoyed it as much as "Talladega Nights."
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Yes it's goof-tastic but worth the watch.
Well researched with a couple of Eurovision gaffs.
To the uninitiated The Eurovision Song Contest is a Europe-wide song contest (erm that recently included Australia) and everyone votes. ABBA found fame from it.Anyway...It's true that some Icelandic people believe in the little people!! A friend was there twice and confirmed this!
It's a little bit like Mama Mia on a budget!
If your stuck for a movie, watch this little gem.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Loved this film, captured the essence, the excentricity and the passion of Eurovision. Volcano Man for me would be 12 points every day.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is the worst "movie" ever! What a waste of money. Bad jokes, bad acting, terrible screenplay. Comments about americans and Paris are absolutely out of place. It's not funny at all. It's desperating, hard to see it till the end. Actually I think it's the WORST way to promote Eurovision.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Caught a feeling that is hard to describe
Review_body:
It's not often that I see a Movie that is as recognizable as Eurovision. It captures the whole business with ESC. Not by far the best Movie I've seen, but incredibly accurate when it comes to the whole feeling about ESC.
Many Icelanders probably think they have made fun of their country, but no...
Will Ferrell and CO have captured the phenomenon Eurovision Song Contest 100% and the Music is absolutely cruel.
Many of the songs had easily won ESC...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Such an enjoyable film critics seem to be way off the mark these days in not being able to identify what kind of films we want to see.
Will Ferrell does an excellent job writing and producing this gem with comedy met with a heart felt storyline. A Lighthearted fun watch.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If this movie came out any other time before this Pandemic, I'm not sure if it would have been so well received or appreciated as much. In America, at least I am, we are looking for an escape to all the horrible news everyday. We also have extra time on our hands to appreciate and research other cultures. I had no knowledge of Eurovision Song Contest and what a big deal it is in Europe. They have their share of talented singers and some that would only be appreciated in Europe. But a Big thank you to Will Farrell, Rachel McAdams for educating us on this part of European culture and giving us a little escapism. And some of the songs are very catchy too. Hope to sing "JaJa Ding dong""at the next Beer Garden or Octoberfest!! Just watch it and give it a chance!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Honestly, I was excited to watch it. It wasn't a flop from the start, they got most of the stereotypes right, the songs were good and I wish they left out the cliché that's been around for over a decade, where two main characters have to fall in love by the end of the movie. Overall, I think it could have been done with a funny duo, perhaps just friends, that actually got to WIN the Eurovision with a spectacular song, even though no one believed in them. Didn't laugh. Not once.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Would be a 9 if there were ANY diversity
Review_body: Loads to love about this film. Rachel McAdams is brilliant and barely recognizable because of her character. Will Ferrell was hilarious. Such a funny mix.Sadly there are ONLY white people in the movie. And about 1/3 at least of the film is set in Europe (so the excuse can't be that 'non-whites don't live in Iceland'). There is one act where there is a light-skinned black lead singer so he's on screen maybe 30 seconds. And the only other appearance was a black band that the announcer made fun of for "crying for no apparent reason".Inexcusable.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: First saw the trailer and it did not seem funny and felt like it was going to be disrespectful to Eurovision. We saw it anyway.Was surprised that it was funny and a delighfull parody of Eurovision. I realise it may seem a bit ridiculous, but some of the songs may do very well on Eurosong.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I had my doubts before watching the movie. I thought it would be a lot of bad acting and boring.Oh boy I was wrong! I have watched it three times the past five days. Such a funny and weird movie at the same time. I also like all the surprises and funny twists happening all the time...Watch it, you will not regret it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Captures in an odd way the feeling of Icelandic connection to Eurovision
Review_body: It was a great movie for an Icelandic to watch... captures some feeling and insight to Eurovision and our passion for Eurovision. Really fun movie to watch... great job Ferrel and co.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I simply can't understand all the poor reviews and scores of 5 or less that this film is getting. It's simply a fun, unpretentious & light hearted look at the Eurovision competition. I mean seriously people......Let me qualify my comments....my first ever review and it's for a Will Ferrell movie haha..I'm a movie buff who has enjoyed cinema for 40 odd years, and this was simply a great enjoyable easy ride, that was not meant to be taken as seriously as others have obviously done...I honestly had minimal expectations for what I was about to watch, but Ferrell and McAdams' 1st foray into the musical genre had me pleasantly surprised - in fact I absolutely loved it.
Although Eurovision Fire Saga doesn't take itself too seriously, it still delivers a very good solid storyline, a strong underlying message about life and love and topped off with a fantastic sound track that will have you blaring the speakers at all hours on repeat.....For those who enjoy Eurovision, for those who enjoy some great catchy music and for anyone that enjoys barracking for the underdogs then this is the film for you.
Its so good, I hope they make a sequel....
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The worst movie I have seen in my entire life
Review_body: I have created an IMDb account only to write this review, because this movie was so horrifyingly terrible. I have never, ever seen something this *bad*. They hired all the bad but famous actors, took all offensive stereotypes, the stupidest clichés, a lot of money, and created this mess which I can't even express how bad it was. Please, for your own sake, don't waste 2 hours of your life on this. It was so bad I will need a week to recover from this. TERRIBLE!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The more times you watch this film the better it gets. Recommend for literally everyone, it made me laugh until I cried. Some serious comedy genius went into this script
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I actually hate the Eurovision Song Contest but loved this movie. It is a great parody of the contest. But it is also a great feelgood movie with a big heart and feeling.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: For all who are missing Eurovision this year
Review_body: Amazing, funny, classical Will. Loved it 100%. No politics, great humor and catchy songs. Will rewatch it several times.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Should've said; dont VOTE cause it's not live!
Review_body:
It was better than every eurovision contest ever!
I expected a shallow netflix movie again, but it wasnt. If you ever watched eurovision, I think it really captured the feeling of it and I risk to say that even went futher! It also really get the essense of Europe too. I would love if Euro contests would be that level! 😊 It is a great fun movie, with lots of euro trash songs!! Better than mamma mia!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Will Ferrel and Rachel McAdams are hilarious in this lovely comedy about Eurovision
Review_body: I had such fun watching this movie! As someone who has grown up watching Eurovision and witnessed its gradual decline into a tacky, cheesy music festival (lol), I must say that this film manages to capture all its cliches flawlessly in a very funny, light-hearted way. Will Ferrel and Rachel McAdams' performances are hilarious too and the Icelandic locations a wonder to watch. Great music too. If you're in for a laugh, don't miss it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Surprisingly this movie has a LOT of jokes about penises. Even the most popular song from this movie "Jaja Ding Dong" is just a dick joke. The movie made me laugh like once. Lion of Love was good I guess.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I can only imagine that all of these 10/10 ratings are part of an elaborate Eurovision/Icelandic PR campaign?This is a dreadful film.Avoid.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Really enjoyable movie. i went through many emotions watching it. and as we didnt get the eurovision this year, the movie came in perfect time.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I must say, I was very sceptical at first. A bunch of Americans making a movie about Eurovision, you got to be kidding me, right? But despite all my prejudices, I gave it a try... And I must admit: I LOVED it.When I was a child I grew up with Eurovision. It was tradition to watch the shows with the family and friends: to laugh at the silly costumes, to mock the corny jokes of the presenters, to hate the act of your own country (but also be absolutely furious if they didn't go to the finals) and to predict which neighbouring countries are voting for each other. But all this makes it Eurovision, it makes it a great experience with lots of fun and laughter. It's something by and for Europeans (and Australia ofcourse). So when we heard Americans are making a movie about our silly songcontest, we protest!... BUT. It was done with a lot of respect for Eurovision. They threw in inside jokes for Europeans, the songs were actually really catchy (and could totally be for Eurovision) and a few familiar faces were present (like Alexander Rybak, Conchita Wurst, Loreen,... Even Graham Norton was there, with his typical sassy comments).I enjoyed every minute of this movie, gave me a lot of nostalgia and even brought a tear in my eye with the song of Sigrit. Rachel McAdams was really great and lovely in this, but Dan Stevens was the star for me. I loved how at the start we think Alexander is the villain of this story, while he's actually a great character and a big sweetheart.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will Farrell writes and acts in a film which is very emotionally driven at times, then at the next moment utterly, and hilariously, ridiculous! Added to this terrific tale of an underdog fictional Icelandic entry to the Euro-vision competition are some excellent and hysterical performances from Farrell himself as well as a standout role from Dan Stevens, who really ramps up the camp! Most notable is Rachel McAdam's utterly irresistible charm and quirk that keeps the movie grounded amidst all of the silliness. The music sequences are masterfully interwoven in to the narrative and the comedy is just the right level of over the top that the satire comes across very subtle, making you admire the film instead of just laughing at its absurdity. Overall a perfect movie to watch to uplift your spirits as you will be cheering along to the legendary Lars and Sigrit and their "Fire Saga."
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: exceptionally funny, emotional and great cinematography
Review_body: Rarely do I review movies, but The Story of Fire Saga deserves full credits.It is obvious Netflix didn't spare any expense when making this movie. Filming locations around the world and great cinematography. Really really funny, great script. Anyone who has seen Eurovision in the past will see the uncanny resemblance, mixed with a healthy dose of sarcasm.What is really great that the film is built on Will Farrell's personal background, being married to a Swedish wife and having been introduced and captivated by the Eurovision phenomenon many years ago. He has well researched this movie and was backstage from beginning to the end of a real Eurovision festival in 2018 I believe.Highly recommended, fairly family friendly (with some occasional swearing, genital calling and some gender fluidity but all fairly harmless).
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's possibly the worst movie I've ever seen. Unfunny, badly acted & badly written. Best thing in it was BronHom. All the 8, 9 and 10 reviews must have been payed for. Didn't laugh once and it made me feel bad for the usually excellent Rachel McAdams.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Fire Saga brings joy to the world!
Review_body:
This film is totally fantastic - got a pastiche if Eurovision - my Soul is filled with joy - the film
Studies the passion for Eurovision - I lived in Greece for 10 years and in Europe Eurovision is mega - Will Ferrell's study of the competition conveys it all - I watched it 4 times first weekend - it's a classic and totally wonderful!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A Film That Makes You Feel All The Feels -Just like Music!
Review_body: Sometimes a film comes along at the right time, to put a smile on your face, to put life and love into perceptive.I lost my mother and father this year who loved Eurovision, played music together, and the joy it brought to our family. This film brought back my happy memories, and produced new ones. Thank you for making this film.The songs are beyond great, art in itself, and there's moments of magic and fun. It's the simple things that touch an audience, and this film made me laugh and cry all at once. Well-Done- Ya Ya Ding Dong! --My Home town.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will Ferell and Rachel McAdams always be remembered as the winners of the unheld Eurovision Song Contest 2020. Aprecciated such a wonderful stuff brought us.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Good laughs along the movie... Just a happy feeling kinda movie that do not demand to much to be enyojed, It the right amount of sarcastic to me :-D
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: THANKS TO WILL FERRELL'S SWEDISH WIFE WHO INTRODUCED HIM TO THE EUROVISION SONG CONTEST:)
Review_body: Beyond my expectations, it's a wonderful film which truly reflected the enthusiasm and passion of the Eurovision audiences, who were excited by the spirit of competition throughout the Europe, days even months before the final day.I can say that it is a very nostalgic movie; it took me all the way to my childhood memories. Absurd dance choreographies, interesting, exaggerated costumes, the firm belief that the contestants must perform their songs in English in order to win, but nevertheless, they salute their fellow citizens by sprinkling few words into the lyrics in their native languages while singing their songs... These are all the details that you can capture if you are familiar with Eurovision Song Contest. Clearly Will Ferrell did his job very well and he did extensive research before even he shot the movie.Will Ferrell is always a good comedian and has shown it in his previous work however the biggest surprise for me was that Rachel McAdams' acting performance was superb in a comedy genre and the two were a great duo.I loved the side characters as well like the decent, self-adoring and possibly gay Russian guy (even though there isn't any homosexuality in Russia!?!), loving and caring Icelanders, good hearted naïve American tourists etc.In these pessimistic depressive pandemic days I am glad that I watched this film. It made my day!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I have seen this movie 20 times since it came out! There isn't much left to say...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Anyone who knows me know that I'm not an ESC fan, very much because I'm not into the kind of music that appears there every year. I'm more into metal and alternative rock.Therefore I was highly sceptical from the outset about this movie when my friends insisted we would watch it. It felt like it would be 2 hours of cheesy fan fiction that would be hard to stomach. However, I'm surprised how enjoyable it was.Funny of course, but most of all that it was produced with an unexpected depth and it gives you a warm feeling. But sure, at times the tempo of the film gets quite uneven and some scenes can be a drag to watch. But the positive sides outweigh the bad ones. The "Husavik" song gives the film a beautiful climax and every time I listen to it, it gives me goosebumps. To be fair, Will Ferrell is not the one who carries the movie. It's mostly thanks to Rachel McAdams and Dan Stevens that it gets as good as it gets. Pierce Brosnan didn't leave a deep impression on me, quite flat performance. Graham Norton's participation gave the movie some extra spice.So, all in all I feel generous enough to give this flick 7 out of 10.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Eurovision spot on and a genuinely funny movie!
Review_body: This is a feel good movie on a topic that likely most people in Europe and Australia know well. The Eurovision song contest in all of its kitchiness and bad acts is something that unites many of us and all of this is captured well in this movie. The story is funny, the acting good and the sing-a-long scene fantastic with many well known real Eurovision performers present :)! I am amazed that Will Farell has captured all of this so well not being raised with this annual event since 1956! This move is much better than what critics claim and great fun!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I love this film. Its so easy to watch. It's funny, interesting and even moving at times. It's got some great cameo roles and is a perfect Sunday afternoon film when you don't want to think to much. You can just sit back and enjoy. It's also very well cast. I like will ferrel and this is him allover. (I realise he wrote it). Rachel mcadams is always nice to see 😉
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I often find myself scrolling to find something light and fun to watch and this movie was both. I laughed and cried and the songs are great!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Now look, I'm not some holier than thou fancy film reviewer person who thinks that the only films are good have to be directed in france by a 90 year old renowned artist, and I like a lot of stuff that would be considered borderline low brow, bad humour, and as a final note many Will Ferrell films are great and he certainly can be funny. HOWEVER, this just wasn't one of those movies. I couldn't bare to sit through the entire thing as I just completely lost interest. Between two characters I didn't like speaking in very simple ways (hehe icelandic people silly dumb simpleton they speak simple because english bad) there wasn't really much I cared about, nothing to make you want to see what happened in the end; I think the major problem was that I genuinely couldn't care less about what happened to our main protagonists.
There's loads of films that can be very much enjoyable even if they're bad because you laugh at it rather than with it, but this was one of the first times I've felt so perfectly balanced in the middle: Not good enough to be genuinely enjoyable, but not bad enough to be a fun silly time, just miserable.
I can't really put into words why I'm so put off by how unfunny this was but you just gotta take my word for it, cheers.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Ja Ja Ding Dong! My love for this film is big and review will be long!
Review_body: This is seriously Will Ferrell's best film. Makes me want to go to a Eurovision contest and then visit Iceland..if locals will accept me! The unique competition displays talented artists chosen to represent the different countries in Europe. We follow Lars and Siegret who have the lifelong dream of performing in the Eurovision contest. By the power of the Elves they are sent to represent Iceland.
