The comedic performances and mishaps, along with the development of each character throughout this film is satisfying all the way until the end. Siegret's song was absolutely stunning and powerful. I appreciate this film even more for having a happy and complete conclusion.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: When I started to watch this movie I smugly knew I was on the railway of a comedy train, just waiting to jump off the tracks with a big laugh... But damn it hit me from the other direction and made this movie one in a million. The ending is one of the best endings in a comedy movie and would not be possible without Will Ferrell, such a great actor, also Rachel McAdams was the perfect sidekick.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Love love loved it! Amazing how this 'American' movie captured the spirit of the Eurovision song contest so well. Cineography very good. The music is sometimes corny sometimes wonderful! Thank you Will Rachel Dan and all the others for your wonderful performance! Please show it on the big screen next year when hopefully we will have the Eurovision songcontest 2021!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will is great when he can do a funny voice and wear ridiculous outfits. He's over the top and it was hilarious. Some very funny bits. Some run too long.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I am not a huge fan of Will Ferrell, and he acted about as expected in this film here; maybe slightly better than expected. And I've never seen Eurovision (though I've seen a few music contests). And yet - I really enjoyed this film - the acting, singing, story, etc. There were some potential red flags that popped up, but, fortunately, most didn't go the direction that would make them bad and/or into an actual red flag.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Listen guys... I watched thousands of movies.. One nearly every Day.. Every genra... Nolan Tarantino Van Sant Kubrick Rossini Hitchcock Leone Appatow Sandler... Corean Movies, Movies German Movies Indian movies... I am french and its been 10 years since ive first gone on IMDB... Never registered on it say something about a movie, i was just watching what People had to say about them.
But tonight, ive watched this movie and right after sent to IMDB, as usual, to see what People thought of it... And there it is ! À 6.5 rating... I coulndt resist this time i had to say something... Come oooon guys whats wrong with you !!! Do you have that feeling that once in a while, when we watch a movie, we have the chance to witness something magical happening, something that we call Emotion. You know when you laugh, when you cry, when you have that stupid smile tharyStoryt wont disappear during thé whole movie.
Well thats what happens With Eurovision The Story Of Fire Saga.
Remember Notting Hill ? Love Actually ? Walter Mitty ? These movies that for some are random and for other are classics filled with heart laughs and Emotion that you can watch over and over. Well, if you are like me, Eurovision will be one of those movies.
Its a 10! Or 11, you choose. Ferrell is awesome, and what to say about McAdams performance... Is she the one singing in the movie ? If yes, damn...i will check on Google right away and then watch this movie again!!!Cheers
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I've watched this once a week since it came out because I can't get enough! It's so heartwarming and incredibly charming. The music is so good and not just because it's catchy! Ya Ya Ding Dong is forever stuck in my head haha. I just love this movie!!! We need more like it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I loved it as a eurovision fan
Review_body: Just saying the songs and the jokes are amazing. The movie doesn´t get bored i loved it
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: A funny portrait of Eurovision that made me laugh and miss it even more. Husavik song could be really a potential winning song for Eurovision

Review_body: This is great. Loads of crazy twists and stuff. emotional.

Review_body: Worst movie I ever saw. Very low budget for Rachel McAdams and Will Ferrell. I was surprised they took on these roles. Are they in desperate need for money? The acting was horrible. It seemed like their accents were making fun of those in Iceland.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It has captured the exact eurovision feeling. Full of dumb funny jokes. But accurate too. I Don't like to watch the eurovision but i actually liked the performaces in the Movie. Nice ending song. Enjoyed watching. I expected this Movie would be garbage. But very happy i watched it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I thought I was gonna watch just another Will Ferrell movie with his usual nonsense. It certainly did start that way and I felt it was poking fun at Iceland but it was a complete sudden turnaround with surprises. It was clearly the opposite as the story went on. The town people themselves thought they were weird. So it wasn't making fun of Iceland people to me. I was like why am I getting teary eyed watching a Will Ferrel movie wishing I was Icelandic for a sec. Coming from U.S. I hope to visit Iceland again in the future...JaJa Ding dong!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I am not a huge fan of blockbuster comedies. Half the time the script is sloppy and the final edit ruins the delivery of the best jokes- two things that are painfully present for the first half of this film. However, none of it is glaring and can be overlooked. But if you are a stickler for effortless and seamless storytelling then I have a suspicion you'll turn this off in the first thirty minutes. No matter what, you'll laugh. The humor is clever and the two leads, Ferrell and McAdams, are incredible together, with the latter delivering a nuanced, believable, over-the-top character that Ferrell struggles to land every now and then on his end. The ending satisfyingly ties together the loose ends from the first half with surprising emotional weight- I won't lie I teared up but that's to be expected. Ideal for families with mature kids, middle school and up, and for any fan of comedies.
Lastly, it was refreshing to see a foreign-set comedy that equally laid into the United States, especially when the leads are Americans playing Icelanders in a tongue-in-cheek caricature.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Without Will Ferrel&Pierce Brosnan this movie would bomb
Review_body:
This movie sucks. Script is formulaic. Rachel Mcadams can't act through a paper bag & a lot of the music is truly horrible.On the positive side the girl that sings Rachel Mcadams
songs is Molly Sanden. Molly is an amazing Sprano. The film has funny parts & Will Ferrel sells this movie. Daniel Stevens plays the Russian guy who is extremely funny & does such s great job playing an Eastern European. The movie would've bern way way better with another actress other than Mcadams & really terrible music.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Either you love it or hate it... he will be the next "Woody Allen" of this century for sure!! Per my perspective... awesome movie, loved it, no spoilers, only mentioning that "end song should have been Volcano Man!".
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Yes at some points it's cringe, and yes some additions to the plot are unnecessary (e.g. ghost of Katiana, Terrible CGI.), but I came away from this film absolutely in love with Iceland, Europe and their music! Being British, especially with brexit... this film resonated with me so much and made me miss what being European is all about. So to the writers, thank you for a lighthearted, yet deeply impactful masterpiece!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A film to watch at this current time
Review_body: Taken in context, given the topic and the current world we are in, this film delivers on a number of levels. From basic, remote small town to delivering a professional Eurovision performance. You can't help but sing along with the songs as the movie takes you through the story. Well done!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It is a kind and lovely comedy.All the haters are sad people.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I loved the soundtrack, the ridiculousness of Will Farrell, and the touching story. It was a great escape from a hard year with the pandemic.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A 10/10 from someone who doesn't usually love Will Ferrell-films
Review_body: I am normally not a huge Will Ferrell film fan, with a few notable exceptions, this definitely being one of them. As a Swede who has watched Eurovision every year growing up I think this movie was spot on, and I actually started an account just so I could give this movie a 10/10***, because it made me really happy. "The elves went too far" has become a standard catch frase in my household and I have to say that Alexander Lemtov is definitely on my top five things to ever come out of Eurovision. Lion of Love was brilliant and if every guy who brought a drunk girl home just gave her an elaborate braided hair creation the world would be a much better place.Thank you Will Ferrel for this wonderful film!*** I'm usually against giving full marks to a film, because there is always room for improvement, but the 6.5 average is an insult.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Best Ferrell film - laughed a ridiculous amount
Review_body: This really is my perfect, favourite film. Equally funny, tuneful (Jaja ding dong/ husavik/ double trouble/ Lion of Love) and with thoughtfulness, I have watched this film over 10 times and still love it every time.Give this a go... it's brilliant. Trust me!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: It wasn't bad but it wasn't good
Review_body: I didn't laugh once, it wasn't so bad that it was a waste but I would have chosen a different movie if I had the opportunity, if your looking for something to watch this isn't it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The most American movie you will ever see
Review_body: This is the most American movie you will ever see, especially because Will Ferrell is the most american actor there is. It is badly shot, really bad acting and you can clearly see the bad acting throughout everything. This movie is painfully unfunny. Props for using a swedish singer for McAdam's vocals, although weird since this is supposed to be the song sent to ESC from Iceland. This was made to be a satire, but was so unfunny and cringy that I'd rather it'd been made as a serious movie.From a swedish person that regrets she watched this.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Hands down one of the best musical movies ever written.
Review_body: Anyone who is expecting a generic Will Farrell comedy, be prepared to be gobsmacked. One of the most heartfelt & inspirational movies in the last decade. An amazing soundtrack by savan kotecha carries this movies amazing acting by talents Will Farrell, Rachel McAdams, Dan Stevens & Pierce Brosnan.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Amazingly it manages to capture the spirit of Eurovision and Iceland. It made me laugh out loud and gave me goosebumps at the same time. 12 points from Iceland!!!

A modern day take on The Lizzie McGuire Movie

Review_body: Watched it several times. The movie is pure fun, with excellent songs.

Review_body: Really enjoyed this, the music is good. If you love Eurovision you'll love this.... And there are some familiar faces!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A comforting and heartfelt tribute to dreamers.
Review_body: No, this movie is not a gut-busting comedy.No, this movie is not high-minded "cinema".No, this movie isn't fast-paced.No, this movie isn't a cascade of visual delights.But this is a great movie, with a simple but engaging plot, gentle yet memorable jokes, and awesome original music.The casting is spot on, and offers the audience a chance to see many familiar faces in fun and different roles. For fans of Downton Abbey, seeing Dan Stevens in this movie was a hilarious delight all its own. Same with Pierce Brosnan. Rachel McAdams lends the movie her typical depth, authenticity and general loveliness. Discovering Will Ferrell's mild but real singing talent was another fun surprise.In a time when we expect SO much from our entertainment, the simplicity of this movie is refreshing. In a world of metaverses, endless sequels and remakes, this movie doesn't feel like it came out of the same meat-grinder. And for that I truly love it. The world right now is harsh. And I found the contrasting harmlessness of this movie to be both soothing and entertaining. Perhaps movie critics don't struggle with anxiety like the rest of us, but sometimes we need media that we know is going to be kind to us. That's what this movie is. It's easy to watch, the plot is not overly complicated or unexpected, and the violent moments are quickly overshadowed by the cuteness of Ferrell and McAdams.My final point is about inclusion. The song-a-long scene is a masterwork of displaying a true rainbow of talented individuals, and I give the makers a lot of credit for intentionally doing that. Ferrell and other producers could have hired a bunch of Hollywood people for the sequence, but they gave the roles to real Eurovision competitors. And that's cool. Nowadays you don't actually need talent to be famous. You don't even need to be a good singer to be cast in musicals now (looking at you, Meryl Streep). So the fact that Ferrel & Co chose to include people who are the real deal I think adds a lot of integrity to the movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: If you are a hardcore Eurovison fan it's an absolute winner!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Maybe it is because I'm sitting in my home a lot these days, but I have to say this is a solid well made movie. Granted I predicted the end half way through the movie, that does not diminish in any way how powerful the movie's climax was. Love it or hate hit Will Ferrell was his goofy self, while Rachel McAdams gives a solid emotional performance. The music was great and helps elevate this movie much higher than its punching weight. All in all, it was a great diversion in these troubling times. Thank you for making me forget just for a moment all the flatulence 2020 has given us.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was not expecting much from this movie. Being an Icelander and very familiar with the eurovision vibe I found it very entertaining. I had heard that it made Icelandic people look like stupid mole people but hey that was the whole point of the movie. Silly characters with a ridiculous story line 😂. But they made it work and caught the eurovision atmosphere in a really funny way with some added sweetness to it. A feel good movie for sure. Well done!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: What more could you ask for?!
Review_body: Rarely do I ever want to watch a movie again once I've already watched it. To me this movie has it all. Beautiful locations and scenery, captivating and wonderful music, superb casting and acting. I can tell a lot of thought went into the writing and directing of this movie. I have always loved Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams. The love story between them in this movie was so sweet and real. It is now my new favorite movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Brilliantly beautiful and light hearted film from start to finish. Excellent cast who deliver a flawless and funny performance. A very typical underdog story in essence but woven with the most Eurovision soundtrack possible with excellent cameos from previous Eurovision stars. In a year where we have missed Eurovision due to COVID-19 this made the film all that bit more loveable to watch.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: What makes a nice and enjoyable movie? Perfect 4k pictures, great songs, wonderfull voice and play of Rachel Mc Adams (you cannot not fall inlove with her), excellent play from Will Ferrell and even Pierce Brosmann although he has only a second role, descent amount of 1st degree humor, all built around a predictive but consistent scenario. Among the tons of useless movies that there is from Netflix this one deserves to not be forgotten.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I will be shortFor anyone not familiar with Eurovision this will be a very average movieFor anyone loving Eurovision this is a must see
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I don't usually write reviews but I feel like I need to write something not necessarily about the movie but about how I feel now after I've watched it ... So heads up ! :)Like practically everything in life is relative so are emotions and how we perceive certain things revolves around them. Any other time I would rate this movie badly and try to point out sarcastically and with cynicism all its faults but after these hard times for many I too have changed and the message of the movie and the fact that everything we perceive revolves around emotions the solution to the great puzzle are positive emotions. And I don't mean about shallow hedonistic urges but something more than that. And the ultimate positive emotion is LOVE ! Love for others, ones close to us and for the common man who we don't know. I know this message and review is sappy, and that for many who already know and understand this I have only invented hot water, but for those who are not sure about life and are confused and frightened I implore you to discard that fear and concentrate on love and everything will turn out fine.Tomorrow I will prolly cringe on this review but I hope it will help me remember how I felt now and try to remember this message.Eurovision is in a few days, it's a cheesy competition, but as Will Ferrel said in everything around us there is something more than it meets the eye at first.Hope this review helps someone.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Thank you Will Farell. We did not get a song contest this year but you gave us the best Eurovision I have ever seen! As an elf loving Icelanders I loved the silly humor and the end song brought me to tears. Rachel was adorable as ever.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Don't expect a Basic Ferrell comedy, wait for it!!!
Review_body: Everyone needs to watch this!! Best Will Ferrell flick since whatever you consider his last best one was (haha, I still love all his stuff, but for real, this one..) Be aware, it begins as more of a drama with comedic elements, not your basic Ferrell outing, and then picks up on every level and all the buildup pays off. Rachel McAdams is excellent and really gives the film the heart it excels with. Dan Stevens is excellent, funny but also has a real charisma and charm to what could be a one dimensional character. It's basically Pitch Perfect meets Norsemen meets Blades of Glory. Such a feel-good, underdog film that somehow treads a perfect line of ridiculous comedy, extremely relatable drama, and funny, yet catchy as hell pop-music. A rare gem that just works everywhere, but deserves patience in the beginning for the true payoffs.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Absolute grand slam of a movie. I really cant remember the last movie that I saw that brought me every emotion as Eurovision did. Rachel McAdams and Will Ferrell were absolutely breathtaking the whole movie and finished it off with one of the best performances ever. (Shout out to My Marianne for the singing) I will remember that 5 minute scene for the rest of my life as it brought me to the edge of my seat with goosebumps. Alexander Lemtovs character was absolutely perfect as the happy and charming Russian. With all of the negatives going on in the world right now this is something that will bring you joy, happiness, laughter, and take you on a great journey if you allow it to.I would give it a 100/10 if I could.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Funny and cute. Rachel McAdams and Will Ferrel were great and the music is perfect
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: The best movie of this year so far
Review_body:
I don't know how to say it other than I loved everything thing about it. For me it's pure genius.
Amazing work from all actors!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: I Hate Eurovision !!! and LOVE "The Story of Fire Saga"
Review_body:
I had reached the bottom of the "Lock-Down" barrel. So I threw caution to the wind and set to watch the movie.
Immediately the opening sequence lay the plot before me. A bereaved child is lit up by ABBA and "Waterloo", his childhood BFF joins in with his father trying to stop his son in this "Non Macho" act of embarrassment to him. Lars sets his and Sigrid's future declaring to his fathers friends and family that one day he will win the "Eurovision"
Like any good book I was hooked within the first pages. In classic Will Ferrell style the story expanded to this hapless character and his childhood BFF (who is clearly in love with Lars). Their dream to become Eurovision winners in their hearts.
Needless to say the path is not an easy one, the story flows seamlessly and hilariously forward.
I found myself lifted in scenes, close to tears of laughter and sadness. This movie is totally unexpected and yet also so predictable but the journey is what makes it.
This will I assure you become a timeless classic.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Hilarious movie with some surprisingly accurate jokes (on us Icelanders).
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Firstly I'm no Will Ferrell fan, so I went into this hoping that it would not spoil the film.
And boy did it not. It starts off with Volcano man, what a song 😂😂😂 If you love Eurovision you are going to love this film. It has so many good songs including double trouble and Ya ya don't ding! But the pinnacle song is at the end My hometown. Absolutely beautiful song. Can the United Kingdom use Fire saga for the next entry please!
Also watch out for a few cameo appearances from past contestants
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie is awesome, already a cult classic. Wifi in every room 😀
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Its a goofy movie offcorse what do you expect its Will Ferrell, if you love Eurovision you are going to love this movie its funny and goofy, i liked it but it got its flose, but the ending omg so amazing
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
If you love Eurovision, watch this!
If you hate Eurovision, watch this!
If you have no idea what the Eurovision Song Contest is, watch it, enjoy it, and good luck making sense of it!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is a really good show about two likeable characters on a journey together to live out the male lead, Lars, dream of winning Eurovision. It is a really fun journey full of good music and good characters. It was shot in a gorgeous way and it is really fun. You should totally watch it. i think the critics just totally missed the mark. I watched this move each night after I saw it the first night for a total of 3 nights. I have never re-watched a move even once before with 6 months of the original viewing. This move ie a classic. Too bad the critics missed it, but it looks like the people will overcome...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Watched this after hearing some positive reviews. Say I think it says a lot about where will Ferrells career is - big budget but lacks anything really funny at all. This is territory he has covered before, ott, with blades of glory. That though was funny and good.Sadly this completely misses the mark as a comedy. It understands the cheesiness of Eurovision but this tired character he keeps churning out is out of place and out of time. He needs new ideas for himself cos the basis of the movie round his tired performance has potential.I wanted to like this but it is terrible. Long unfunny and dumb. Yes there is espaceisum but it has to be good.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I love the scene when the elf quickly shut the door.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: An Absurd Movie, A Perfect Eurovision Companion
Review_body: When I saw this had been made in association with the EBU, I thought it might have been trying to show Eurovision as some amazing thing...It does. But in a very Eurovision way.It is a terrible movie and if you don't love it, your insane.Rachel McAdams is amazing...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Likely the first time a will ferrel movie has made me cry? I've already downloaded the soundtrack from Spotify and plan to listen on repeat. Rachel is a show stealer but Dan Stevens deserves major cred as well
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Camp, fun, yet moving. The whole package
Review_body: Critics may hate this film because it's fun. They're renowned for hating fun things. This has everything and leaves you feeling so joyful. While for the pedants among Eurovision fans there may be some factual inaccuracies but all those can be overlooked by the sheer joy the film brings. Throw in the world's best songwriters (who've clearly studied the Eurovision style) and it's a winning formula.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Proof that American humor at European pop culture don't mix well
Review_body: First of all, I love irony, sarcasm, parododies and everything that comes along with it. But, in my upinion, to make fun of something, you first have to understand it. And this movie to me is proof that American producers don't know the first thing about Eurovision. The whole way of telling is to way to american, to styled and is lacking everything that this beautiful and also camp about Eurovision. This could have been a great movie, maybe if other people would have been involved. But to me this movie just missed the mark by a mile
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Figured it'd be another dumb ferrell movie. (That I love)
Review_body: This movie. Was. AWESOME! Like. An actual GOOD movie. It was stupid. But great at the same time. It had real emotion. And Rachel McAdams is great
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Couldn't have come at a better time
Review_body: Loved this so much, such an uplifting film and spot on Eurovision. I've since had the playlist on repeat. I'll be watching it over and over!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Great escapism and the best Ferrell film in nearly a decade
Review_body:
Just the right kind of silly and inspiring escapism we need during a pandemic.PROS:
Iceland
Sigur Ros songs
Rachel McAdams is earnest, sweet and has good chemistry with Ferrell - she's simply perfect in this
Ferrell is still goofy and fun, and this is clearly his well-researched love letter to Iceland
Playful jabs at American tourism in Europe
NEW never/rarely-seen locations on film
Fun music
Elves
Inspiring, despite the sometimes-Adam Sandler level of writing
Ya ya ding dong!CONS:
A big too long, and slow in parts
No plans for a sequel....yet
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Who is this movie even for?
Review_body:
The songs are catchy and gets a pass as maybe getting played during a party with some laughs. But the overall experience with the movie is "let it end". Some scenes move way to fast and skips over parts that could be interesting, with other scenes that add nothing to the plot or story gets way more screen time than needed. They've never left their hometown, we get it, a real Eurovision contester made a cameo, we get it.The bad islandic accents are cringe worthy and Ferrels jokes and humour doesn't hold up in 2020 as good as it should, seeing the cg whales suddenly emerge from the water really hits home the "don't except anything" feel this movie had.
I'd rather watch my birth in reverse than watch it again.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I can't believe I'm about to write this! But it was the best movie I've seen in a long time. Been looking for a feel good movie and it really was. I feel happy!I'm from Sweden who usually gets 12 pointers but found myself really rooting for Island. In a freaken' fictionall contest.I think even someone that does'nt know about eurovision will enjoy this movie because it's a crazy, wonderful concept.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A great treat for a Eurovision Fan!
Review_body:
Music and singing has been there for many, during these trying times, to lift spirits and bring hope.
We, Eurovision fans, missed out on our biggest party this year. So this film is a great treat for is! Loved it...watch for the "song-along" with speciel guest stars...
You can tell that Will Ferell is a big fan of the contest. The comedy and sarcasm is respectfull...Will watch again. Love the closing number, would be a contender in a real final!Sadly, americans will not get this...
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This is just a lovely bit of silliness that we all need right now and the film makers obviously LOVE Eurovision. We just loved it 😍
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Il be upfront, the dialogue was poor; but I went in with my Hope's low and was not disappointed.This director deserves alot of credit, it was not a great script and he turned it into a decent movie. The music sequences were pretty fun and catchy and for a 2 hour movie it didnt come across as longwinded.The acting was also good but given the poor dialogue seemed to fell short, Special mention to Pierce as the angry Icelandic father; he was great!Overall I was surprised I enjoyed the movie and that is one of the very few Netflix original 'movies' I have enjoyed (I emphasize movies because Netflix has some great tv series).
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I honestly wasn't expecting much from Eurovision, but I had quite a few good laughs and really, really enjoyed the plot. The music was fun and worth listening to, the sets were lively and fun, and Will Ferrell was funny without going too far over the top. The supporting cast was magical, Iceland was magical, and it was honestly just a good romp. Watch it some night when you have nothing else do to. You're in for some fun.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Enjoyed it so much. singing yaya dingdong every now and then lolll
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As a scandinavian man, I have never before had to repress my feelings harder than during the ending song......and of course I mean Ja Ja Ding Dong, PLAY IT AGAIN!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Is it Step Brothers? Talladega Nights? No, it's not something that if it were on TV you would turn on for the 6th time halfway through and watch the rest of the movie. But is it funny? Absolutely. Great for a night in when you want to laugh and watch a movie that boosts your spirits. Rachel McAdams is great, and the songs are a) fun, b) funny, and c) catchy. Will Ferrell showed he is still here in the world of comedy.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This silly movie sneakily becomes deeper and deeper until it reaches a climactic ending that is actually one of the most powerful movie moments I've ever witnessed about community and taking pride in others. The final song absolutely brought me to tears.One of the paramount accomplishments in Will Ferrell's career how he gradually hands over the prominence to McAdams as the film progresses, as well as writing a genuinely interesting antagonist (don't want to say more and spoil it) in Dan Stevens. Amazing cast, and the music is unbelievably good.But what do I know, I'm an American so I'll just go now. To Starbucks.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Was pleasantly surprised by this. Might also have some "rewatch" moments. Songs were class and very catchy and the it's a very accurate depiction of Eurovision. Great Netflix movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
If you've never watched the Eurovision Song Contest, you will not know what's coming!
This movie is absolutely Eurovision to a tee - loved it, loved the music and the pantomime performances! Dan Stevens is perfectly cringey, McAdams is brilliant, and honestly Ferrell's best work since his heyday in Elf, Anchorman and Stepbrothers! Watch it, watch it now!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: While somewhat predictable a surprisingly pleasant watch
Review_body: This movie has both hilarious and emotional moments as well as surprisingly great music and acting. Some of the jokes might be lost for those who do not know Eurovision or Nordic culture, but for the rest of us this is down right awesome.In my opinion the movie has a few corny moments, but as a comedy and eurovision tribute it succeeds well above expectations.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Even not a big fan of Eurovision I love it
Review_body: This movie was unpredictable good. I really enjoy it and make my afternoon, still singing some of this songs :D
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A Must For All Eurovision Fans!
Review_body: This film is ridiculous and silly and funny and wonderful and has all the camp brilliance of Eurovision in one fantastic film! Plus Dan Stevens with his chest out for a lot of it! Seriously though, it's such a fun film.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: As an Icelander I loved this movie.
Review_body: Although the song contest may seem over the top and cringy in the movie believe me, it's worse in real life. Will made them look good.. it's like a car crash.. you can't look away. This movie is silly yet captivating.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Will Farrell movies in the last 10 years have not been the greatest. I think many people were expecting that to be the case here. The movie certainly had some campy parts and it's far from perfect but I was pleased that it actually was good. I enjoyed the movie from start to finish, it was a fun ride!The movie does feel slightly too long and yes some of the accents aren't all that great but overal it's not a bother.Enjoy the movie, it's worth a watch.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
It was a great movie.1) It was very sweet
2) It was very funny, but still respectful to Iceland and the Contest
3) It had fun music
4) The characters were likeable
5) The Cinematography was very goodThis was a great movie if you want to just enjoy something that is positive and funny.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed this film.It has received quite a few bad reviews in the press. Yes it would benefit shedding quite a few minutes, but in almost every other respect the critics just don't get it.A well observed and clearly affectionate send up the eurovision song contest, which (fan or not) has been part of the upbringing of millions of Europeans like me. Lots of music including 12 original songs from the brilliant opener Volcano Man to the final touching Icelandic entry in the contest. All capture various takes on Eurovision songs over the years. The "song along" sequence is nothing short of joyous.Far from portraying the Icelandic people in a bad light. A caricature yes, but I came away with a feeling of a patriotic, passionate and fun loving people with a sense of community I wish that we had and hope they still do. Some nice footage of amazing Icelandic scenery also.Characters who initially seem two dimensional turn out not to be so, and there's even room for comment on some nations' semi-official attitudes to minorities. Great performances all round with Rachel Mcadam particularly shining.Oh, and it's funny, too.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Brilliant movie. No one does it better than Will Farrell.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Ignore the critic reviews, funny and nostalgic throughout!
Review_body: I ignored the reviews online but my Missus wasn't so sure (as clearly had). Pleased to have watched this in a year so far that has hardly brought much laughter on the film front, plus given Eurovision was cancelled this year!Don't worry about the plot too much, and leave your negativities at the door, this is a laugh a minute along with some good acting from McAdams and Ferrell not always stealing the limelight with normal roles.Great humour and very entertaining! Pure Eurovision (ignore its in Edinburgh and the hosts aren't, plus Pierce Brosnans welsh...sorry, Icelandic accent)Recommend
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Gets better with every single watch. So many clever little one liners and lyrics. Brilliant.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: A surprisingly good film that captures all the quirkiness and cheesiness of Eurovision.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
1 - Any eurovision fan knows fine well the u.k will never host again
2 - Even if we did, theres no way it would be hosted in Edinburgh
3 - THE HYDRO STADIUM IS IN GLASGOW!! 😂😂😂
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Wanted to watch Step Brothers, so glad I ended up watching this!
Review_body: Favourite film this year, did not expect it to be so good.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: No one asked for this America
Review_body: F*** this movie. It's bad and not even in the fun way. Americans making a sole European thing a movie, and not even with a european cast. There's also blatant stupidity like the contest being in Scotland despite UK not winning... The big 5 just don't exist? (Spain sitting in the semi like what). No one asked for this. It's not for Americans to understand.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I enjoyed it It showed good parts of Iceland and also these singing contests. Made fun of its target audience. Which is risky. That's why it's so good. Will Ferrell delivered a good entertaining movie. Thank you
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Feel Good Film of the Year
Review_body: I have never rated a film as a 10 before but under the current COVID 19 global pandemic, this is the feel-good film that we all need. It would be easy for a film about the Eurovision Song Contest to be a ridiculous parody but this film was clearly made with love for the contest; there are so many references and homages to Eurovision as well as cameo appearances from past winners. The soundtrack is typically Eurovision and the storyline is believable (for Eurovision). Just sit back, laugh off any (intentionall?) dodgy accents and let this tale put a smile on your face.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: One of the worst movies of 2020
Review_body: Maybe 1-3 decent jokes within 2hour runtime. Faar to long. Just bad, really bad.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I was nervous about watching. I love Eurovision. Is beautifully honest interpretation of us as individuals. What we strive for and interact with our family friends and loved ones. Then I watched this movie. Stunningly brilliant. Real. Funny. Honest. Very unserious but right on track with honesty. 10/10.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I didn't expect anything, but this i surely a wonderful movie. I was both laughing and crying at the same time. What a beautiful, funny and lovely story. Must see, you will not regret it. The people from Iceland are so lovely and so kind, just like in this movie. They are like that for real and that is what make this people so unique. Iceland can be very proud of this movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Wasn't sure but soooooo glad I did!!
Review_body: I wasn't certain about this though the trailer with the song 'Volcano Man' made me want to give it a go. Well I loved it as it turned out. Delighted with Dan Stevens and Rachel McAdams' performances. Will Ferrell, as usual, did not disappoint. It totally captured the Eurovision quirkiness and added the same excitement. I found myself shouting for Iceland!! A really lovely, feel good, funny movie that doesn't take itself too seriously and has a lovely ending. The soundtrack is incredible m and is now downloaded and on my favourites on Spotify. Just enjoy it :-D
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Love eurovision. love will ferrell. this is a touching and genuine tribute to the contest. it is clear how much the makers of this movie appreciate eurovision and the whole fïlm reflects this. the story is a bit predictable- we are talking a will ferrell movie here! - but the pairing of him and the ever lovely rachel mcadam is genius. the just work really well together and make the sentimental core of the plot believable and quite moving. two complaints. the hydro is in GLASGOW! And the pro critics snooty comments are to be totally ignored. Finally, will someone please turn this into a west end show ?
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I adore this film. It had me laughing and crying and I can easily watch it again and again. The songs are super cheesy which I love. The song Husavik which she sings at the end is so stunning it brought me to tears. Do not listen to any bad reviews just watch it and enjoy.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: They didn't play Ya-Ya Dong-Dong enough
Review_body:
PLAY YA-YA DING-DONG!
...
PLAY YA-YA DING-DONG!
....
I WANT YA-YA DING-DONG!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Can't say that the accent and the fashion was good but the most accurate thing was how much they hated Americans.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I'm not a fan of the Eurovision Song Contest these days, maybe it just goes on too long but this movie was brilliant. Will Ferrell once again played an innocent bystander in a mean world and aced it, whilst Rachel McAdams did a brilliant job as the sweet girl, standing in front of a boy and asking him to love her.The songs were better than most of the songs I've heard in the actual contest too.This movie was funny, heartwarming and wasn't afraid to stick to a well worn method. The crowd scenes were masterfully done too.A good romp that doesn't take itself too seriously!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: It's fantastic fun but the story brings it down
Review_body:
I really liked the vibe in this movie. Nothing complicated story wise and just fun whimsical humor.
All the songs in this movie are absolutely fantastic and by far the best part of the movie, they really nailed the eurovision vibe.
The main thing that brings this movie down is the story in between the songs. If this movie was 90 minutes I think it would be much better, but instead we get these drawn out conflicts that we all know the ending of and all we can do is just wait for them to resolve it and sing another fantastic song.
I would still recommend this movie if you want something stupid and fun, but not much else.
All in all, absolutely what is needed right now to scratch that all important eurovision itch, but the story disappoints.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: All I can say is thank you for making this movie!
Review_body:
Love the film, love the scenes, love the songs, I cannot get them out of my head. Having also some of the most iconic idols of Eurovision on the movie was great! You could not make it any better! It is funny, and cute and amazing! Also if you are an Eurovision fan you will adore it! Thank you for entertaining us on this year without Eurovision!!! Congratulations on this great job! ❤❤ I hope I make your day with this comments as much as you made my day while watching it! :)
23/05/2021 edit: thank you Iceland for the awesome moment on eurovision yesterday night, giving 12 points to jaja dindon, incredible funny!!!😂👏
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: A really fun homage to Eurovision.
Review_body: This was way better than I expected it to be. Some parts were a great homage to Eurovision. Really enjoyed the songs and their typical Eurovision staging. There's a great treat in there too for Eurovision fans. Just what was needed after Eurovision was cancelled this year.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
This film is like a breath of fresh air during the covid period.
12 points from Russia with love!!!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This was nice getaway from everyday pandemic and other depressing issues. Really loved it! As an Finn I really appreciated a little Finnish part of it. Word "kippis" was noted! Can't wait next years Eurovision!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Well it comes pretty close to being great
Review_body:
This could, should, have been a train wreck but they obviously took the time to actually visit and watch Eurovision... Which helped.
Funny at times, ridiculous at times but with it's heart firmly in the right place.
Worth watching for the songs, haha, and: Pierce Brosnon luckily not singing!
I think Europeans will like this more than Americans, because we have a pre-existing condition with this event and it's wierdness.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie continually goes between ridiculously funny to beautiful heartfelt moments. I've always enjoyed Ferrell's comedy, but was surprised how hilarious McAdams can be. Her ability to be so emotionally open and truthful brings this type of comedy to another level! You will laugh and cry. Dan Stevens was phenomenal as well as all the actors. Amazing cinematography, music, wardrobe, hair, set dec... EVERYTHING! Looking forward to what David Dobkin directs next.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie made Will Farrel look like a horrible actor. Horrible representation of Iceland. All in all Hard to watch.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Did not expect it to be so good! It's funny and touching and everyone in it is great, but especially Rachel McAdams. It gives people hope and dreams, and the sense of home and community , which we desperately need during this hard time!!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Is this an epic film meant to change your perspective on life? No.Is this a fun movie about a competition based on outlandish performances with cute quips, catchy songs, fun customs, some jokes and solid comedic performances? YES!If you want to have fun and smile and laugh and have a few feelings but end with a happy note (pun intended) than watch this movie.If you want to be a film snob and don't enjoy anything that isn't completely original and/or serious, than...this movie is not for you.Keep your expectations in check - this is meant to be fun, campy and light hearted while also showing off some actual Eurovision talent along the way. Enjoy it for the uplifting break from reality that it is.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I can't believe this movie is rated below 7. It may have some common themes with underdog contest movies, but it's also so different and kinda captures the spirit of Eurovision. Also the acting is off the charts, Will Ferrel is of course known to be a genius but this is very different. The Icelandic accents may not be perfect, but that just makes it more hilarious.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's not often that I give a 10 and I have never written a review on IMDB. However, having grown up watching Eurovision since as long as I can remember, I must say that this film perfectly encapsulates the ridiculousness and theatrics of Eurvision. I laughed and laughed/cried since the beginning. Can definitely see this becoming a cult favourite amongst Eurovision (and Will Ferrell) fans. Douze points.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I don't know if this is because of the times we are living in right now, or the movie itself, or maybe a little bit of both, but this movie was exactly what I needed. While I was definitely, enjoying it while watching, it wasn't until the end that it really hit me exactly how fun, emotional, funny, and heartfelt this movie was. The elf humor was hysterical, the music was good, and the last song had a 31 year old man tearing up, it is legitimately that good of a song! Do yourself a favor and watch this movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: He's too old and just not funny. His type of humor is for 6-yr old little boys.The movie would have been better without him and his contribution to writing it.How could director have cast him in this role opposite Rachel? How could she and Pierce Brosnan have agreed to make this low-grade movie?Poor writing made it a torture to watch........and Ferrell proceeded to take the life out of it in his portrayal of the character. He added NOTHING to the movie........as a matter of fact, he ruined it.Netflix is desperate to have this one in its lineup.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: As someone who grew up watching Eurovision, this movie is everything. I really enjoyed the cheesy music and Will's humor. Great casting.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
Extremely funny with surprisingly good songs
Yaya finding rules
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: To many years expecting some thing great and big, but Eurovision made of us a big joke.Dreams come true, we live in a pop society and Eurovision is entertaiment.

Review_body: If you love Will Ferrell style comedy then you will love this movie, it had me laughing from start to finish.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Never heard of Eurovision but this movie made me a fan
Review_body: Honestly! Such a great movie. Had me laughing so much. The elf scene, the ghost scene, Rachel Mc Adams, Will Farrell. The songs were just epic. It was cute, funny, touching and so much fun. I've watched it twice now. Never heard of Eurovision until this movie and found where Vitas came from. I am a new fan.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
You may not want to see this movie thinking it's just some dumb comedy, at least those were my worries.
But... the movie is sweet, thrilling and great music all round! The movie manages to capture the absurdity of the Eurovision, but at the same time let's you appreciate it's epicness!
I really think the movie really managed to separate itself from just some dumb comedy with loveable characters thrilling scenes and an awesome soundtrack!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie is a complete package. And the songs us soo good. I think it deserves better review. I really enjoy watching this movie with my family, and I recommend anyone to watch it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Eurovision The Story of Fire Saga
Review_body: Loved this movie, real feel good film that you should not miss. Silly plot and Lyrics in songs but well worth the watch. Both Will & Rachel play the characters very well. Costumes are also Fab & Silly

Review_body:
It's a rare thing a movie gives you a warm feeling it's been a while.
Rachel took my heart or we should say segret she is so pure and innocent not to forget the music and the songs which were actually very emotional for a comedy movie I don't mind have then on auto replay on my playlist 2 hours that I will never regret <3

Review title: Utterly ridiculous - just like the real thing!
Review_body: Didn't know what to expect with this film as I hadn't seen any trailers but decided to give it a go after hearing the song on the radio many times in the past couple of weeks. It's brilliant. I was laughing out loud at quite a few bits as it's just so silly. Dan Stevens (AKA Mathew Crawley from Downton) absolutely steals the show as the mega camp performer from Mother Russia.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: so bad, makes it so good
Review_body:
It is brilliant, it has big belly laughs and huge cringing moments.
if you are a european, you will watch this and totally understand it and the humour behind it, if you are american, you may not fully understand the humour.
it is a must watch for the really wonderful cringe moments.
the characters are fab, they take everything we have seen and heard for i don't know how many years and and make us laugh. it will never put any of us watching eurovision, in fact it gives us the excuse to watch it and party more.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: One of the best movies I watched this year. It makes you laugh, it makes you cry and it makes you nostalgic... Top 10 movies of 2020 for sure!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I loved this movie, and I don't understand why it isn't better rated so felt obliged to leave a good rating. I feel like I owe that to the movie. Is that insane? Possibly. I can only assume the low ratings are left by people that don't know or understand Eurovision. This movie was everything I needed and took me back to watching Eurovision as a kid. Can't say enough good things about it.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
A solid movie, the writing and filmography are fantastic. All of the characters where realistic and charming.
I didn't know I needed this movie in my life but now I couldn't imagine a life without it.So funny and engaging 10/10

Review_body: This is a happy funny film which attracts derision from the critics. The songs and performances are great and it captures the anarchy and bewilderment of the Eurovision Song Contest. We really enjoyed it as we had a curry in front of the TV on Saturday night. A much better film than the reviews suggest.

Review_body: The music 10 points. Will F 0 points. The movie it self 6 points.

Review_body: A good vision of the festival with lively music and interesting details such as singing in the original language (you never win) or in English. Review_body: I started watching this film a little skeptical but it's definitely worth watching, one of those movies that warms your heart.

Review title: Wasn't Expecting Much, But Amazingly Surprised!
Review_body: I thought it's another movie that I would have to sit through bored out of my mind, but my goodness it was so good.I didn't know that I needed this movie. So inspiring and this move made me well like cray cray.That HUSAVIK song was so good! I'm obsessed. All the Sigur Ros inserts made me gasp! Highly recommended.

Review title: Heart Warming. Ja Ja Ding Dong!
Review_body: I am very touched and moved by this movie. A great story to introduce one of the important European culture. It's full of laughters and tears.Thanks to the people whom made this movie happen.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This was a great spectacle. I'm from Europe, so I am well accustomed to Eurovision although I don't actually watch it. Nevertheless it captures the spirit of it perfectly, and the humor is bang on in my opinion. And the music.... it's just SO Eurovision (guess I have seen some if it lol).There's a song rather early in the film, Volcano man. I replayed this song like a thousand times just because it's so funny.Would recommend
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This may well be the worst movie I have ever seen. At the very least it is both Will Ferrell and Rachel Mcadams' worst films. While there are probably worse movies out there they are usually intended to be bad, but this film tried so hard to be good and was everything but that.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Will this put Iceland on the music map?
Review_body:
2020 has been a strange year, and there was no Eurovision Song Contest for obvious reasons; but wait a minute, what's this? A film about a duo from Iceland entering Eurovision. It's fun, it's long and it's as cheesy as the real thing. I enjoyed it; it has cheered me up and has almost made up for the real thing being cancelled.
True Eurovision fans will love it, the story is contrived but moves along nicely. Quite a few recent Eurovision winners turn up for a sing along which is fun, and Mr Graham Norton talks us through the contest itself, so for us Brits it's a bit like the real thing.My only criticism is that they didn't get Mans Zelmerlow and Petra Mede in for a cameo; they were amazing hosting the 2016 contest and would have lent some extra sparkle.If you love Eurovision you won't need much persuading to watch this, if you don't love Eurovision, give it a try anyway, it will bring you a smile, and maybe a tear as well.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Best movie ever <3 Seen it so many times and, and keeps rewinding to 1:44:20 where the last and greatest song are preformed ... Beautiful work! Great movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: It's fun and enjoyable for the fans of the show
Review_body:
20+ years Eurovision fan here!
This movie was so much fun,considering we didn't get the real show this year.To see all my favorites-the winners of previous years!Ah..it was amazing and a Russian villain?!
The costume design,the sound production and casting-all on point.
The movie is Will Ferrell classic silliness. If you know you know.
At times it's dragging and there are a few unnecessary scenes.
The concept with elves killed me! My favorite part)
Fun times and I can say a cool movie.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: People are crazy for not rating this higher, so funny! All the cast are just awesome. Love this movie!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: I don't know why, but I found this hilarious! The premise is silly, the main characters are silly, it's a silly movie. But I laughed through the whole thing.

Review title: A great movie, so what's up with all the haters?
Review_body: This is one of Will Ferrell's best movies and is that Rachel McAdams' voice?! She's amazing! This movie is maybe not as over the top as some of Will's other movies, so if that's what you were looking for I guess you might be disappointed .Personally, we really enjoyed it! Review title: Possibly one of my new Guilty Pleasures!
Review_body: I had heard that this wasn't a good film "panned by the critics" etc.How wrong they were.From Pierce Brosnan's awful accent (which added to the humour) to the sign along with the previous actual contestants it was a beautiful way to spend 2 hours.Highly recommended, leave your brain on the coffee table and just enjoy entertainment.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Perfectly captures the spirit of Eurovision
Review_body: As a life long fan of the actual Eurovision, this film had a lot to live up to in my eyes and boy it did not disappoint. Songs that could easily have been entered into the competition itself, cameos from some of the best Eurovision performers in the last couple of years and a wonderfully warm performance from Dan Stevens as a fabulous Russian with George Michael circa 1980's Wham hair. Will Ferrell perfectly plays the passion and enthusiasm that people have for the Eurovision, Capturing all the crazy but through a lens of absolute love and joy. Loved it so much I've watched it 5 times already. If you ignore the dodgy accents and embrace the dodgy singing. You will love it
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Follow the scent of Pumpkin Spice Lattes!
Review_body: Ignore the critics! If you don't know what Eurovision is then check out both the voting and the contestants on youtube then watch it for fun. Most I have laughed since the pandemic struck.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: It's really the best comedy film in months! Has a great story. Funny scences, cute acting, funny and great songs! Great family movie especially if you love eurovision!
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Never heard of Eurovision, but I'm hooked!
Review_body: I didn't expect much from this movie. Will Farrell movies...hit or miss. Being from Minnesota, Iceland seems boring. Eurovision seemed hokey. I was completely wrong! THIS Will Farrell movie is definitely a "hit", I want to visit Iceland and the Elves, and Eurovision seems quirky and intriguing. This was a very funny, well-written, well-casted comedy. I watched it on the plane and had to keep myself from laughing out loud several times! I actually thought this comedy was brilliant. Loved Rachel MacAdams and her super cute character, and the Russian guy was perfect! Happy flick that was refreshingly non-preachy or political, just a lot of fun.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review title: Fantastic Feel-good Fiesta of what Eurovision has to offer! (Soft Spoilers)
Review_body:
This film is a must watch for any Eurovision Junky, especially since this years contest was cancelled (or was it???), and also a great entry point for anyone who has zero clue what Eurovision is. It's just a really solid, and enjoyable Rom-Com.PROS:
Fantastic Songs! Beautiful final song of the contest, and others bangers like "Ja Ja Ding Dong"Awesome cast. I especially like Dan Stevens character, Alexander Lemtov (RUS). His final scene with the Greek entry was a good bit of social commentary.Great Tourism ad for Iceland! I want to go on an Elf tour!Lots of fan service with previous acts, winners, and lots of Waterloo!CONS:
The Scoreboard of the Semi Final annoyed me! It was totally wrong.Can drag in placesNon-British hosts, despite Eurovision being hosted in Edinburgh (little thing).Overall, I loved it! Ultimate feel good film that we needed during this time!Would Recommend to everyone.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: This movie is so realistic, it was a worthy substitute of 2020 Eurovision contest 😁
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body:
I was not expecting to like this movie so much, but it was one of the most enjoable movies I've seen in a long time. I hate watching movies on repeat but it just came out and I've already seen it twice. Very rewatchable movie. I don't think anyone was expecting so much emotion in that last song. I felt like celebrating in the streets for Fire Saga after that last song and then had to remind myself they weren't a real band. I think it's one of Will Ferrell's funniest movies. It's also cool to go back on YouTube to listen to the songs and see all the comments saying "I'm from Iceland and I approve!"
The only reason I give it a 9 and not a 10 were those statues lol. I could have done without that.
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: Okay, so I love Eurovision soooo damn much and I'm Icelandic. When I first heard tWill Ferrel was making a Eurovision movie I was like....ugh. Because I'm not a huge WF fan and stuff, but then turns out his wife is Swedish and he's a big Eurovision fan so I was like "hmmm, I'll give him a break. Let's see where this goes."And then off course they involved us (Iceland) and came here and shot stuff and have Icelandic actors and stuff. :D The thing that annoys me the most really is THOSE WERE NOT ICELANDIC NAMES. lol. They were Swedish or Scandinavian, but in my head-canon it's because like they come from like Swedish immigrants or something. XDI loved how at the start of the movie it's just all in Icelandic, but oh boy, Brosnan's Icelandic is atrocious. I had no idea what he was trying to say. XD They should have dubbed him, but he tried. lol. And then everything went to english. XDBut I like to think it's like the babblefish in The hitchhikers Guide or the chameleon circuit in the Tardis, they are still talking in Icelandic, it's just translated into English. XD That doesn't explain everything, lol. But that's again my head-canon. lololI LOOOOVVED the cameos from actual past Eurovision performers. I especially loved Conchita Wurst's outfit. <3_<3And the songs are so good or dorky and totally Eurovision-y! The original songs and the use of the other Icelandic songs. <333 And all the stuff on stage? Literally all of it has happened to some degree. XD None of that was unrealistic. XDBasically I just loved the whole movie because it makes fun, but it makes fun with love. Ya know? Like you can make fun of a sibling, but no one else because you do it with love. hahah. And I love that they did it like with the EBU. <333Some critics were like saying oh it has no edge or something and like who said it needed an edge? Pfft. Give me all the sillyness and escapism. And some seem to think they need to be offended on behalf of Icelanders, but trust me, we're not offended at all. XD We love it. XDAnd like about the elves. They probably don't exist, but you never know. So you know better safe than sorry, tbh. XD Just show some respect. XDI loved Alexander so much too. lol. But feel a bit sad for him too. :(That Húsavík song was so great. <3_<3 But lol, people in Iceland the last few days have been all about the Ja Ja Ding Dong. XD It's perfect. *chef's kiss* lolol.It's just silly, and happy and dorky and Eurovision in all it's glory. XD I love it in all its wacky glory, but I also can take it seriously. Maybe sometimes too seriously. XD Because I also want a good song to win and not a too gimmicky of an act. But yes, ugh, i can't wait for ESC next year. Also Iceland could have won this year with Think about things with Daði and the ganamagn. :'( But we'll just have to try again next year! XD
Movie_name: Eurovision Song Contest - The Story of Fire Saga

Review_body: The delightful performace from Rachel McAdams makes this film along with some surprising quality song writing. The first half of the movie had me convinced it was a comedy while the second half had me captivated and in tears. Seriously, the final song deserves awards. Fight me. Play Ja Ja Ding Dong!
